They are planning to save their income to provide a quality education for her son, and the cost of that education in Nepal is very high.

loans.use: To buy raw material for her work

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama S. is a 38-year-old mother of 5 children. She has been the owner of a firewood operation for 8 years. In Ghana the price of cooking gas is high, and consequently firewood and charcoal are common cooking fuels. Her firewood is sourced from around Ghana and is sold to the local marketplace as fuel for food.

Ama is hoping that by expanding her inventory, she can increase her sales and her family's income. All 5 of her children are currently attending school, and she hopes her income can help support them throughout their educational years.

Ama is a member of the trust group called God Is One. The trust group works on the principle of peer pressure, where each member of the group exerts pressure on the other to pay her share of the group loan.

Ama is pictured in the white shirt, proudly holding some of her firewood.

loans.use: To further expand her inventory of firewood

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy chairs and tables for his restaurant, to rent and paint a small stall in the sector for food sales, and to purchase agricultural supplies for a winter crop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy herbicide, seeds, and fertilizer, rent machinery and hire manual laborers for his rice and corn crop.

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en:
Isaac is 25 years old and unmarried. He currently operates a metal fabrication business specializing in coal pots. The pots hold charcoal and are used to cook various dishes in many Ghanaian homes. He currently sell these pots at the market and some road junctions.

He is hoping this loan will help him purchase more materials so that he can increase his sales and income to raise his standard of living. He has recently moved to Kumasi from Obuasi, where he learned the trade for 2 years. He believes the market in Kumasi is better than in Obuasi.

Isaac is a member of the trust group called Nyame Wo Ho (God Is There). The trust group exerts peer pressure on individual members to repay their part of the loan.

loans.use: To purchase more materials for his operation

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy agricultural supplies for his corn crop, cattle and feed. Also to rent machinery, contract labor and have the cattle  vaccinated and disinfected.

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort is a 43-year-old mother of 4 children. She has been instrumental in providing water to her community. Without her efforts, her community would not have easy access to safe drinking water. With her first loan through Sinapi Aba Trust, she was able to lay water pipe from the main city pipeline to her business. With her second loan, she is now hoping to build a permanent bathhouse in her community and to finance her purchase of a new water tank. Comfort has 4 assistants, who help her with distributing her water in the community and in the local market.

Comfort is a member of the trust group "God Is One." The trust group works on the principle that peer pressure exerted by each member on other members will help secure repayments.

loans.use: To purchase materials to build a public bathhouse and to finance her purchase of a water tank

loans.name: Halima's Mazingia E Group

texts.en:
Halima S., aged 39, is married and has four children (ages 19, 15, 13 and 5). She has two butcheries which she started 3 years ago. She works from 7.30am to 7pm daily and has been able to make a monthly profit of about $259.

In the past Halima has taken out two previous loans from Tujijenge Tanzania to increase her business. She now hopes for a new loan to buy roofing sheets and to increase her business. Halima will share this loan with her subgroup members dealing in selling clothes, food, tailoring and shops.

In the picture Halima is second from right in the yellow blouse.

loans.use: To buy roofing sheets and increase the size of her business

loans.name: Ashura 's Watu Hodari Group

texts.en:
Ashura wiiliam , aged 39, is married and has six children (ages 22,18, 16,10 and twins aged15). She has a tie and dye business and sells bed sheets as well, which she began 3 years ago. She works from 7.30am to 4pm daily and is able to make a monthly profit of around $104.

In the past, Ashura has taken out three previous loans from Tujijenge Tanzania to increase her sales. She now hopes for a new loan to increase the size of her business again. Ashura, will share this loan with her subgroup members dealing in selling clothes, food, tailoring and handicraft.

In the picture Ashura is standing, 1st from the left.

loans.use: To increase the size of her business

loans.name: Mashari Fahari Yetu Group

texts.en:
Mashari H. R., age 27, is single and has two children (ages 4 and 1). She has a pharmacy which she began 4 years ago. She works from 8.30 am to 9pm daily and is able to make a monthly profit of about US$173.

In the past, Mashari has taken out one previous loan with Tujijenge Tanzania to buy more medicine. She hopes for a new loan to increase the size of her business and to start selling cosmetics. Mashari will share this loan with her subgroup members dealing in selling pharmacy, clothes and cosmetics.

In the picture Mashari is 2nd from left in a green blouse

loans.use: To buy a larger stock of medicine and start selling cosmetics

loans.name: Epiphanie

texts.fr:
Born around 1967 in Cotonou in the south of Benin, Mrs. Epiphanie D. is married to Jospeh DAH LOKONON who is a bus driver for Abomey-Calavi University (UAC-BENIN). Mother of four children, she has been located for the last ten years in Agbato, a suburb of Cotonou where she does business selling a variety of products. In order to strengthen her business, she is seeking a loan in order to maintain her customer base and to gain greater visibility to attract other customers who don’t patronize her for lack of certain products. 
Translated from French by Liana Bianchi, Kiva Volunteer.
Née vers les années 1967 à Cotonou dans le sud du BENIN, dame D. Epiphanie est mariée à DAH LOKONON Joseph qui est conducteur de bus à l’Université d’Abomey-Calavi (UAC-BENIN). Mère de 4 enfants, elle est installée depuis une dizaine d’années à AGBATO un bidonville de COTONOU où elle exerce son activité de vente de produits divers et autres. Dans le but de relancer son activité, elle sollicite ce prêt afin de maintenir sa clientèle et se donner plus de visibilité afin d’attirer d’autres clients qui ne viennent pas à elle compte tenu de l’absence de certains produits.

loans.use: Purchase of 10 crates of milk, 15 sacks of rice, and 18 trays of eggs.

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 36 year-old Jacqueline L., who is married with two children, aged 7 and 9.
In 2007, Jacqueline established a liquor store business, and now requests a loan of $225 in order to purchase additional stocks of beer and soft drinks in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of beer and soft drinks in bulk.

loans.name: Farida

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 30 year-old Farida M., who is single with one child, aged 11, and one other dependent, her nephew.
In 2002, Farida established a soft drinks and snacks business (given the hot weather, a very popular venture), and now requests a loan of $275 in order to purchase additional bulk stocks of drinks and snack ingredients. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of soft drinks and ingredients for snacks, in bulk

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase cereals and yams for resale.

loans.name: Aghabala

texts.en: Aghabala O. is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Fuzuli region of Azerbaijan. He has been settled with his family in Beylagan since 1993. He is 49 years old, married and has three children. Aghabala is engaged in cattle-breeding. He started his business more than seven years ago. He would like to purchase two calves and expand his livestock business. Because of this he has applied to Normicro Beylagan Branch for the KIVA loan in the amount of $900. He hopes this loan will help his business be very successful.

loans.use: To purchase two calves

loans.name: Getruda

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 30 year-old Getruda M., who is married with no children.

In 2005, Getruda established a clothing business. She has already received and repaid one loan from SELFINA, and now requests a new loan of $850 in order to expand her range of clothes, shoes, and accessories. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To expand her range of clothing, shoes, and accessories.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 21 year-old Amina W., who is single with one child, aged 1. In 2007, Amina established a café business, and now requests a loan of $275 in order to purchase ingredients such as rice, oil, and beans, in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

When you see a SELFINA entrepreneur whose business title is ‘restaurant’ or ‘café’, you may have to adjust your mental image of what that is. A local restaurant or café in Tanzania usually consists of a rough wooden table and some long wooden benches, with the sky as a ceiling. Such places don’t even appear in the Lonely Planet’s budget guide, but if you’re looking for a cheap and tasty meal, and someone to have a chat with, this is the place to be. The food is all-local; rice, ugali (a hot sticky dough, made from maize flour), plantain (a cooked savoury banana), all served with beans, vegetables, meat, and a variety of yummy sauces.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients such as rice, oil, and beans, in bulk.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To relocate her soft drink store and buy more drinks.

loans.name: Tatu

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 39 year-old Tatu K., who is married with three children, aged 9, 12, and 16.

In 1997, Tatu established a business selling fish and traditional cloth, and now requests a loan of $275 in order to purchase additional stock in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of fish and traditional cloth.

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 45 year-old Stella C., single with four children ranging in age from 13 to 29.

Stella owns a soft drinks business, a popular venture for micro-entrepreneurs in Tanzania owing to the hot weather, and requests a loan of $275 in order to purchase additional stocks of drinks in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of soft drinks in bulk.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To produce music  CDs and tapes.

loans.name: Koubouratou

texts.fr:
Born March 17th, 1969 in Cotonou, Mrs. Koubouratou Y. is married and mother of two children who she supports. Since she was a little girl, she has been doing business with her mother and learning basic business techniques. About ten years ago she began her own business in Suru-Lere, a working-class suburb of Cotonou. Her area is well patronized because it is located on the road to the main market Dangokpa; demand is so high her stock can’t meet it. She is therefore seeking a loan to build her supply in order to meet customer demand. 
Translated from French by Liana Bianchi, Kiva Volunteer.
Née le 17 mars 1969 à COTONOU, dame Y. Koubouratou est mariée et mère de 2 enfants à charge. Depuis qu’elle était toute petite, elle faisait déjà le commerce avec sa maman avec qui elle a appris les techniques de base du commerce. Il y a environ une dizaine années déjà qu’elle s’est installée pour son propre compte à SURU- LERE un quartier populaire de COTONOU. Le lieu d’activité étant bien achalandé parce que se situant sur l’axe du grand marché DANTOKPA, la demande est très forte alors que les produits en stocks ne couvrent pas cette demande. Elle sollicite alors ce crédit pour s’approvisionner afin de répondre à la demande de la clientèle.

loans.use: Purchase of 20 sacks of wheat flour and 12 sacks of rice

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is Mariam N., who is married with four children, aged between 8 and 18.

Mariam owns a business selling fish and salt, and requests a loan of $275 in order to purchase additional stock in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of fish and salt in bulk.

loans.name: Alphonsine

texts.fr:
A widow and mother of three children, Mrs. Alphonsine G. was born around 1979 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. She has been a retailer of fabric, purses, and shoes for the last five years. Reliable and of high moral standard, she is seeking her fourth loan. Her monthly sales are around 500,000 francs while customer demand is around 1,000,000 francs. She is seeking this loan to supplement her assets and stock in order to respond to customer demand.

Translated from French by Liana Bianchi, Kiva Volunteer.

Veuve et mère de 3 enfants, dame G. Alphonsine est née vers les années 1979 à COTONOU, capitale économique du BENIN. Elle est une revendeuse de pagne, de sacs et de chaussures depuis plus de 5 ans. De bonne moralité, elle est à son quatrième crédit. Son chiffre d’affaire mensuel est estimé à environ 500 000 francs alors que la demande de sa clientèle est estimée à 1 000 000 de nos francs. Elle sollicite alors ce prêt pour compléter son avoir et s’approvisionner afin de répondre à la demande de sa clientèle.

loans.use: Purchase of 15 bolts of fabric and 20 women's purses.

loans.name: Antonia

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 37 year-old Antonia D., who is married with four children, aged between 12 and 16.

In 2005, Antonia established a grocery store, and now requests a loan of $275 in order to purchase additional stocks of fish, oil, and soft drinks in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of fish, oil, and soft drinks in bulk.

loans.name: Mwanahawa

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 34 year-old Mwanahawa M., who is married with three children, aged 5, 11, and 12, and has one other dependent, her nephew. In 2003, Mwanahawa established a stationary and secretarial business, and now requests a loan of $275 to purchase printer cartridges and stationary stock in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

The striking foresight and insight of people who have never received any training in business management is amply demonstrated in stationary sales; most such entrepreneurs strategically place their shops, stalls, or tables close to post offices, banks, schools and universities, thereby succeeding in their businesses.

loans.use: To purchase printer cartridges and stationary stock in bulk.

loans.name: Philomena

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 42 year-old Philomena M., who is married with two children, aged 13 and 17, and has one other dependent, her nephew.
In 2006 Philomena established a business involving automobile spare parts, gas, and welding, and now requests a loan of $275 in order to purchase additional spare parts for resale. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase additional spare parts for resale.

loans.name: Françoise

texts.fr:
Located in Cotonour for over 15 years to do business, Mrs. Francoise K. is originally from Port Novo, where she was born March 8th, 1960. Married to Norbert SINGBO, a Beninese police officer, she is the mother of two children and also cares for two nieces and a cousin who help her with certain tasks. She is a retailer of products such as trays of eggs, tomatoes, onions, oil, etc. For the last few months her customers have faced supply shortages of some products such as bags of rice, corn, wheat flour, and others because their distance from Cotonou’s main market. She is therefore seeking a loan to stock these products in order to be closer to her customers and to gain new types of customers.

Translated from French by Liana Bianchi, Kiva Volunteer.

Installée à COTONOU depuis plus de 15ans pour cause de son commerce, dame K. Françoise est originaire de la ville de PORTO NOVO où elle est née le 08 mars 1960. Mariée à SINGBO Norbert, agent de la Police béninoise, elle est mère de 2 enfants mais a aussi à sa charge 2 nièces et une cousine qui l’aident dans l’accomplissement de certaines tâches. Elle est revendeuse de produits divers tels que des plateaux d’œufs, de la tomate, l’oignon, l’huile et autres. Depuis quelques mois ces clients éprouvent quelques difficultés dans l’approvisionnement de certains produits tels que : les sacs de riz, de maïs, de farine de blé et autres à cause de la distance qui les sépare du grand marché de COTONOU. Elle sollicite alors ce prêt pour l’approvisionnent de ces divers produits afin d’être plus proche de sa clientèle et de gagner d’autres catégories de clients.

loans.use: Purchase of 140 trays of eggs, 5 baskets of fresh tomatoes and 5 baskets of onions

loans.name: Gilles

texts.fr:
Born July 21st, 1969 in Cotonou in the south of Benin, Mr. Gilles A. is married and the father of two children. He was a teacher in several primary schools in Cotonou before starting to sell herbal (medicinal) teas, recipes for which he learned from a young age from his mother. Located near Dantokpa market, he gets supplies from Hevie and Porto Novo. According to his statements, his daily sales are estimated at 20,000 francs. Demand is becoming greater, thus he is seeking a third loan to stock more supplies in order to meet the demand of his customers.

Translated from French by Liana Bianchi, Kiva Volunteer.

Né le 21 juillet 1969 à COTONOU dans le sud du BENIN, Monsieur A. Gilles est marié et père de 2 enfants à charge. Il a été instituteur dans plusieurs écoles primaires de COTONOU avant de se lancer dans la vente de tisane qu’il a apprise dès son bas âge auprès de sa maman. Installé près du marché DANTOKPA, il s’approvisionne notamment à HEVIE et PORTO NOVO. Son chiffre d’affaire journalier selon ses déclarations est estimé à 20 000 francs. La demande devenant de plus en plus croissante, il sollicite son troisième prêt pour pouvoir mieux s’approvisionner afin de faire face aux exigences de sa clientèle.

loans.use: Purchase of various medicinal leaves

loans.name: Dalia

texts.en:
Dalia P. D. runs a business selling homemade meals typical of the tropical region in Pucallpa, Ucayali.  She serves cakes, sandwiches, tamales, and more from her home for breakfast and dinner.  Dalia owns a stand where she also serves delicious evening meals to the people of her neighborhood and others passing through.  
	
Dalia is 40 years old, married, and has 3 children.  Education is very important in her family so she makes sure all of her children get the opportunity to study.  She is proud of her business, happy to have a second income, and loves to cook.  
	
A member of the community bank Juan Zaplana Belliza, Dalia is requesting a loan of s/2000 (US$725) to repay over 6 months.  She will use the loan to buy ingredients for her meals such as sugar, milk, eggs, and butter.

loans.use: To buy ingredients of foods for sale

loans.name: Massa Ayawa

texts.fr:
Massa Ayawa D. has been settled in Lomé for a dozen years. She was born on February 25, 1971 in Lomé, is married, and has five children. Her main business is selling fried yams in the Gbényédji district of Lomé. She sells in the courtyard of Gbényédji high school when it is recess time and at its main gate when class is in session. She realizes a high sales volume, since the size of the high school can be estimated at 3,000 students, which enables her to clear an attractive profit. Her experience in this domain has allowed her to master all aspects of this business. She is on her first cycle and is requesting a loan of 500,000 francs CFA to buy 20 yam tubers and 20 bolts of Hitarget-brand pagnes (colorful print fabric) to be sold.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Installée à Lomé depuis une dizaine d’année, Madame D. Massa Ayawa est née le 25 février 1971 à Lomé. Mariée et mère de 5 enfants, elle a pour activité principale la vente d’ignames frittes dans le quartier de Gbényédji à Lomé. Elle vend dans la cour du Lycée de Gbényédji pendant les heures de récréation et pendant les heures de cours au portail dudit lycée. Elle réalise un chiffre d’affaires important car l’effectif de ce lycée peut être estimé à 3000 élèves ce qu lui permet de dégager une marge bénéficiaire intéressante. Son expérience dans le domaine lui a permis de maîtriser les contours de cette activité. Elle est à son premier cycle et sollicite un crédit d’un montant de 500.000FCFA pour acheter 20 tubercules d’ignames et vingt pièces de pagne de marque Hitarget destinés à vendre.

loans.use: To sell fried yams and pagnes

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda G. D. N. has a small sewing business in the tropical city of Pucallpa, Ucayali.  Erlinda specializes in making bedspreads, pillow covers, sofa covers, and blankets.  She started the business 4 years ago after taking a sewing class at a local technical school.  
	
Erlinda is 57 years old, married, and has 9 children.  She is a special woman and community leader.  In addition to caring for her children, Erlinda runs a preschool in the morning, sews in the afternoon, and works as an officer for a health organization in the evening.  She is proud that she can be a leader in her community and a positive influence for her children.
	
A member of the community bank Juntos Hasta el Final, Erlinda is requesting a loan of s/1500 to repay over 6 months.  Erlinda will use the loan to buy more cloth, elastic, and thread.

loans.use: To buy more cloth, elastic, and thread.

loans.name: Maritza

texts.en:
Maritza C. D. Aguilla runs a small shop where she sells candy in the district of Yarina Cocha, department Ucayali.  She also sells sodas, fruit, ice cream and juices.  Maritza has many loyal clients, most of whom are neighborhood children.  To promote her business and continue to grow, Maritza conducts raffles and lotteries and serves homemade chocolate milk to all her clients during Christmas.
	
Maritza is 34 years old, single, and has no children.  She is very driven and has big plans for her future.  She currently studies nursing at a local university.  She is also excited to expand her business and start selling medicinal plants. 
	
A member of the community bank Las Azucenas, Maritza is requesting a loan of s/1200 to repay over 4 months.

loans.use: To buy more inventory for a sweets shop

loans.name: Couture Grâce À Dieu Group

texts.fr:
"Couture Grâce à Dieu" (Dressmaking by the Grace of God) is a business created by three people: A. Akossiwa, 39; A. Massan, 35; and K. Akuvi, 36. These three women are mothers of 4,4 and 5 children respectively. Like a lot of women in Togo, they work as seamstresses. They create clothes for clients in d'Aventonou, a small village situated approximately 120 kilometres from Lomé, the togolaise capital. With this loan, they will buy 3 sewing machines to better satisfy the needs of their clients. They also hope to use the money to go to Lomé to buy pagnes (traditional fabrics) to resell them in Aventonou. They hope with this loan to increase the capacity of their shop and in doing that, better take care of the needs of their families through the profit they will get from selling the fabrics.

Translated from French by Susan Bell, Kiva Volunteer.

Couture Grâce à Dieu est une entreprise crée par trois personnes, A. Akossiwa, 39, A. Massan, 35 et K. Akuvi, 36. Ces trois femmes sont mères de 4, 4 et 5 enfants respectivement. Comme beaucoup de femmes au Togo, elles opèrent dans la couture. Elles créent des vêtements pour leurs clients d’Avetonou, un petit village situé à environ 120 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Avec le crédit, elles vont acheter 3 machines à coudre pour mieux satisfaire les besoins des clients. Aussi elles souhaitent utiliser le crédit pour aller à Lomé acheter des pagnes (tissus traditionnels) pour les revendre à Avetonou. Elles souhaitent avec ce crédit augmenter la capacité de leur atelier et par là participer à la prise en charges des besoins de la famille par les profits qu’elles vont dégager dans la vente des tissus.

loans.use: buy 3 sewing machines and traditional fabrics

loans.name: Mirian Isabel

texts.en:
Mirian Isabel F. S. runs a small restaurant in the city of Pucallpa, Ucayali. She serves delicious meals typical to the region that include many dishes of beef, chicken, and rice served with soup and a drink.  She has many loyal customers, including workers from a factory across from her home who come for an economical home-cooked meal.
	
Mirian is happily married and has 4 children.  She started her business after losing her job at a nearby gas station.  She loves to cook and help people so her little restaurant was the perfect fit.  Being able to provide a second income for her family makes her feel good.  All of her children are able to attend school and are planning on attending a university.
	
A member of the community bank Juntos Hasta El Final, Mirian is requesting a loan of s/1600 to repay over 6 months.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her restaurant meals

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora R. M. runs a business making top quality furniture in the city of Pucallpa, Ucayali. She has the help of all of her family. She loves designing custom pieces and giving her customers exactly what they want. Nora is 47 years old, happily married, and has 4 children. She is a busy, hard working woman and a leader in her community. She is happy she can send all of her children to university and proud of all of her accomplishments.

A member of the community bank Genesis, Nora is requesting a loan of s/1200 to repay over 6 months. Nora will use the loan to buy more high quality wood such as Peruvian Cedar.

loans.use: To buy high quality wood

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa F. D. sells beauty products in the tropical city of Pucallpa, Ucayali. She has had the business for 4 years and has slowly increased the number of her clients and products. Rosa keeps trusted clients happy and loyal by offering a credit program. She now sells soaps, deodorants, creams, shampoos; her best selling items are perfumes. Rosa is 35 years old, married, and has 4 children. She is happy and proud of the independence she has gained through her business. Now she has her own money and doesn’t need to ask her husband if she wants to buy something for herself or the children.

A member of the community bank Juntos Hasta el Final, Rosa is requesting a loan of s/1000 to repay over 4 months. She will use the loan to buy more high quality creams and perfumes, which are not offered in the markets of Pucallpa.

loans.use: To purchase inventory for a cosmetics business

loans.name: Ferme « Le Sauveur » Group

texts.fr:
The farm "le Sauveur (the saviour)" was created by three men: K. Yawogan, 43; A. Komla, 39 and Segbedzi D., 37. They have respectively 7, 5 and 5 children. The farm "le Sauveur" is a large farm, specialized in the raising of pigs and chickens. The farm is located in Avetonou, a small village situated approximately 120 kilometres from Lomé, the togolaise capital. With this loan, they want to buy 10 pigs (7 females and 3 males) and 250 laying hens to increase their stock. They want to use the loan to increase their business, meet the needs of their families and also participate in the development of their community.

Translated from French by Susan Bell, Kiva Volunteer.

Ferme « le Sauveur » etait crée par trois hommes, K. Yawogan, 43, A. Komla, 39 et Segbedzi D., 37. Ils ont respectivement 7, 5 et 5 enfants. Ferme « le Sauveur » est une grande ferme spécialisée dans l’élevage de cochons et des poulets. La ferme est localisée à Avetonou, un petit village situé à environ 120 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Avec ce crédit, ils veulent acheter 10 cochons dont 7 femelles et 3 mâles et 250 pondeuses (poulets) pour augmenter leur stock. Ils désirent utiliser le crédit pour améliorer leur activité afin de subvenir aux besoins de leurs familles et participer ainsi au développement de leur communauté.

loans.use: buy 10 pigs and 250 laying hens

loans.name: Zoila Rosa

texts.en:
Zoila Rosa Y. D. runs a wood and lumber distribution business in Pucallpa, Ucayali. The business specializes in the sale of Quina, Bolinas, Caliora, and Marupa woods, all of which are native to the tropical region of Ucayali. The business is family-owned and employs many workers.

Zoila is 44 years old, has 4 children, and is happily married. She is busy all day long taking care of her family, home, and business. Family is the most important part of her life. She is driven to make sure all of her children study and attend university.

A member of Manuela Ramos and the community bank Ricardo Palma, Zoila is requesting a loan of s/3000 to repay over 6 months.

loans.use: To buy more inventory for a lumber business

loans.name: Jhoana

texts.es:
Jhoana works selling sweets and groceries. She is also an employee at a wood furniture business. These two activities are her main source of income which she uses to take care of her young son. She lives in the Villa Ingenio zone of El Alto city.

Jhoana will use the loan to buy more merchandise for her sales location and increase her family income. This is her second loan with Kiva. Her good credit history allowed her request to be accepted.

Translated from Spanish by Geoff Rubin, Kiva volunteer

Jhoana tiene un puesto de venta de golosinas y abarrotes, también trabaja como empleada en una empresa de muebles de madera. Estas dos actividades son sus fuentes de ingresos con las que mantiene a su pequeño hijo; vive en la Zona Villa Ingenio de la Ciudad de El Alto. El crédito requiere para incrementar su mercadería en su puesto de venta e incrementar sus ingresos familiares. Es el segundo crédito via Kiva, el buen comportamiento de pago permite aprobarle el préstamo solicitado.

loans.use: Purchase of sweets and other merchandise

loans.name: Mario

texts.es:
Mario is a taxi driver in the city of La Paz. The public transport business is his main source of income. He uses the money to take care of his parents, who are of retirement age. He lives in the Bajo Llojeta zone in La Paz.

Mario is asking for a loan because he wants to buy a small truck which will serve as a brick transport for construction jobs. He hopes to increase his income with this additional business.

This is Mario's third loan with Impro. He has a solid credit history and thus is able to take out a loan. He has been an Impro customer since 2006.

Translated from Spanish by Geoff Rubin, Kiva volunteer

Mario es transportista de servicio público en la ciudad de La Paz, es su fuente de ingreso con la que ayuda con la manutención de sus padres que son de la tercera edad; vive en la Zona Bajo Llojeta de la Ciudad de La Paz. El crédito requiere para comprar un pequeño camión de carga que le servirá para comercializar ladrillos de construcción y así incrementar sus ingresos familiares. Es el tercer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada permite aprobarle el préstamo. Es cliente de IMPRO desde el año 2006.

loans.use: Purchase of a truck to start a business transporting bricks

loans.name: Restaurant Tanty D Group

texts.fr:
"Restaurant Tanty D" is a small restaurant created by three women: T. Akoko, 43; A. Mawuto, 40; and S. Etonam, 39. They are married and mothers of 5, 6 and 4 children respectively. They are specialized in the preparation of "fufu" a traditional yam-based dish. The restaurant is located on a road in front of the market in Aventonou, a small village situated approxiamately 120 kilometres from Lomé, the togolaise capital. The restaurant's location allows people to eat while they are doing their shopping. With this loan, they will buy 100 tuber yams to use in the preparation of "fufu". They will also fix up their restaurant. That will allow them to increase their capacity to respond to the needs of their clients and in doing that, increase profits and improve the living conditions of their families.

Translated from French by Susan Bell, Kiva Volunteer.

Restaurant Tanty D est un petit restaurant crée par trois femmes, T. Akoko, 43, A. Mawuto, 40 et S. Etonam, 39. Elles sont mariées et mères de 5, 6 et 4 enfants respectivement. Elles sont spécialisées dans la préparation du « fufu » un plat traditionnel obtenu à partir de l’igname. Le restaurant est situé sur la rue en face du marché d’Avetonou, un petit village situé à environ 120 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise et permet aux gens de manger pendant leurs courses. Avec ce crédit, elles vont acheter 100 tubercules d’ignames pour la préparation du « fufu » et aussi aménager leur local. Ce qui leur permettra d’augmenter la capacité de leur restaurant pour répondre aux besoins de la clientèle et par là dégager plus de profits pour et améliorer les conditions de leurs familles

loans.use: purchase 100 tuber yams and fix up restaurant

loans.name: Emefa

texts.fr:
Emefa K., 40, is the married mother of four children. She walks through the central market of Avetonou, a little village located about 120 kilometers from Lome, the Togolese capital, selling "akpan", a local dish made of maize. With this loan, she hopes to buy two bags of maize to use in preparing her "akpan", a dish of which the local population eats a great deal. The bags of maize that are sold in Togo are very large, weighing about as much as a normal person would, and the cost of transport further explains the relatively big loan she is requesting. This will allow her to expand her sales, earn more, and better cater for the needs of her children.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

K. Emefa, 40, est une femme mariée et mère de 4 enfants. Elle se promène dans le marché d’Avetonou, un petit village situé à environ 120 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Elle vend « akpan », une pâte locale fabriquée à partir du maïs. Elle souhaite avec ce crédit, acheter 2 sacs de maïs pour la préparation de « akpan » énormément consommée par la population. Les sacs de maïs qui sont vendus au Togo sont d'une taille importante, à peu la taille moyenne d'une personne, et aussi le coût de transport expliquent la valeur élevée du crédit demandé. Ceci lui permettra d’augmenter ses ventes, gagner plus et répondre aux besoins de ses enfants.

loans.use:
purchase two big bags of maize (corn)

acheter 2 grands sacs de maîs

loans.name: Adjovi Fissétou

texts.fr:
Adjovi Fissétou T. was born on April 13, 1964 in Atakpamé, the seat of the Plateaux region of Togo. (The city is located 160 km from Lomé).  She is married and the mother of five.  She lives with her husband, who is a warrant officer.  Her business is in selling carpeting in bulk at the Autonomous Port of Lomé, a business she has been practicing for over eight years.  Her first loan, in the amount of 500,000 francs CFA, enabled her to get well-established in the year 2000.  After a prompt repayment of her first loan, she cleared a profit that enabled her to help her husband with schooling costs for their children.  During this period of time when she receives many orders, she is again requesting a loan of 500,000 francs to buy 20 new-arrival carpets for increasing her inventory and to serve her customers better.  

 Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Madame T. Adjovi Fissétou est née le 13 avril 1964 à Atakpamé, chef-lieu de la région des Plateaux au Togo (Ville située à 160km de Lomé). Elle est mariée et mère de 5 enfants. Elle vit avec son mari qui est un Adjudant. Elle a pour activité, la vente de moquettes en gros au Port Autonome de Lomé, activité qu’elle exerce depuis plus de huit ans. Son premier crédit d’un montant de 500.000FCFA lui a permis de bien s’installer en l’an 2000. Après un prompt remboursement de son premier crédit, elle a dégagé un bénéfice qui lui a permis d’aider son mari dans les dépenses scolaires de leurs enfants.
A cette période où elle reçoit beaucoup de demandes, Madame T. Adjovi Fissétou sollicite encore un emprunt d’un montant de 500.000FCFA pour acheter 20 moquettes d’un nouvel arrivage en vue d’augmenter son stock et de mieux servir ses clients

loans.use: To expand her display of carpets

loans.name: Mery

texts.fr:
Mery T., age 32, was born in Blitta, a place located 200 km from Lomé.  She is married to Sadikou KPADJA, who is a spot welder and scrap metal merchant.  They have two children.  Her main business is the sale of pagnes (colorful print fabrics).  She is a traveling retailer going from house to house and district to district.  Each day, she covers a distance of 26 km on average.  She had started this business in 2004 selling only lower-quality pagnes.  Her first loan of 150,000 francs CFA enabled her to add another type of pagne, the HITARGET brand of intermediate quality.  After paying off her loan, she is again requesting a loan of 150,000 francs to buy 15 bolts of Hitarget pagnes.  

 Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Madame T. Mery, âgée de 32 ans est née à Blitta localité située à 200Km de Lomé. Elle est mariée à Monsieur KPADJA Sadikou qui est un Soudeur Ferrailleur. Ils ont deux enfants. Elle a pour activité principale la vente de pagnes. Elle est une revendeuse ambulante et vend de maison en maison et de quartier en quartier. Elle parcourt journalièrement une distance moyenne de 26 km. Elle avait commencé cette activité en 2004 uniquement avec la vente de pagne de qualité inférieure. Son premier crédit d’un montant de 150.000 FCFA lui a permis d’ajouter un autre type de pagne de marque HITARGET de qualité intermédiaire. 
Après remboursement de ce crédit, elle sollicite encore un emprunt d’un montant  de 150.000 CFCFA pour acheter quinze pièces de pagne Hitarget.

loans.use: To grow her stock of traditional fabrics

loans.name: Afi Mawulawoè

texts.fr:
Afi Mawulawoè A. was born on June 14, 1974 in Lomé. Married and the mother of three, her main business is in the catering of rice, salad, and corn mash every evening in one of the busiest district of Lomé. She started this business in 2005. Since that year, she alone has been ensuring that her children are cared for. To serve her customers better, she is requesting, for the first time, a loan of 300,000 francs CFA to buy 15 sacks of corn and 3 sacks of rice. This supply will allow her to avoid being subjected to the price increase in April.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Madame A. Afi Mawulawoè est née le14 juin 1974 à Lomé. Mariée et mère de 3 enfants elle a pour activité principale la restauration du riz de la salade et de la pâte de maïs chaque soir dans l’un des quartiers les plus animés de Lomé. Elle a commencé cette activité en 2005. Depuis cette année elle assurait seule la charge de ses trois enfants. Pour mieux servir ses clients, Madame A. Afi Mawulawoè sollicite pour la première fois un emprunt d’un montant de 300.000FCFA pour faire acheter 15 sacs de maïs et 3 sacs de riz. Cet approvisionnement lui permettra de ne pas subir l’augmentation des prix des sacs dans le mois d’avril

loans.use: To increase her stock of corn

loans.name: Komla Edem

texts.fr:
Born on February 28, 1978, Komlan Edem A. is married and has four children. In 2002, he created a video game center, and he repairs and also sells electronic equipment (TV sets and DVD players). He has named his center AGORA. The income enables him to meet his responsibilities. His first loan of 300,000 francs CFA, which he has paid off, enabled him to acquire new television sets. The loan that he is requesting in the amount of 300,000 francs will go towards the purchase of seven TV sets that will be for resale.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Né le 28 février 1978 à Lomé, Monsieur A. Komlan Edem est marié et a quatre enfants. Il a crée en 2002 un centre de jeux vidéo, répare et vend également des appareils électroniques (Postes Téléviseurs, Lecteurs DVD). Il a dénommé son centre Etablissement « AGORA ». Ces revenus lui permettent de supporter les charges. Son premier crédit d’un montant de 300.000FCFA qu’il a bien remboursé lui a permis d’acquérir de nouveaux postes téléviseurs. Le crédit qu’elle sollicite d’un montant de 300.000FCFA lui d’acheter sept postes téléviseurs qui seront destinées à la revente.

loans.use: To increase his stock of TV sets

loans.name: Aminatou

texts.fr:
Mrs. Aminatou A. was born in 1973 in Nilai in the prefecture of Amou, 112 miles from Lomé. She is married to a refrigeration engineer and has two children. Her main business is the restaurant trade and selling staples in Agoè. As far as the restaurant side is concerned, Mrs. Aminatou Allassani prepares and sells corn paste, rice and fufu (yam paste). The income from these two businesses enables her to help her husband with the family expenses, especially since he does not have a regular income. The first loan she is requesting, CFA 500,000, will help towards the cost of 10 bags of corn and four bags of rice, as her clientele is growing daily. The rest of the loan will be used to buy five cases of tinned food.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame A. Aminatou est née en 1973 à Nilai localité située dans la préfecture d’Amou à 180 km de Lomé. Elle s'est mariée à un frigoriste et a deux enfants. Elle a pour activité principale la restauration et la vente des produits de première nécessité à Agoè. Pour ce qui concerne la restauration, Madame ALLASSANI Aminatou prépare et vend la pâte de maïs, le riz et du fufu (pâte d’igname). Le revenu de ces deux activités lui permet d’aider son mari dans les dépenses familiales surtout que ce dernier a un revenu irrégulier. Le premier crédit qu’elle sollicite d’un montant de 500.000FCFA lui permettra en partie, d’acheter dix sacs de maïs et quatre sacs de riz car sa clientèle augmente au jour le jour. Le reste du crédit sera consacré à acheter 5 cartons de boite de conserve.

loans.use: To stock up on corn and rice

loans.name: Messavi

texts.fr:
Mr. Messavi K. was born on February 24, 1976 in Lomé. Single with two persons in his care, he sells drinks and staples in the Tokoin Doumasséssé neighborhood. His first loan of CFA 300,000 in 2005 enabled him to get established. The loan of CFA 500,000 he is requesting now will enable him to buy four cans of vegetable oil, 25 cases of fizzy drinks, 12 bags of rice, two bags of sugar, one case of Peak milk, two cases  of tomatoes, three cases of insecticide and five cases of soap. Buying this merchandise will enable him to achieve good sales during the Easter holidays. He will thus be able to increase his profit.Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer. 
Monsieur K. Messavi est né le 24 février 1976 à Lomé. Célibataire avec deux personnes à charge, il est revendeur de boisson et des produits de première nécessité dans le quartier de Tokoin Doumasséssé. 
Son premier crédit d’un montant de 300.000FCFA lui a permis de s’installer en 2005.
Le crédit qu’il sollicite d’un montant de 500.000FCFA lui permettra d’acheter quatre bidons d’huile végétale, vingt cinq casiers de boissons gazeuses douze sacs de riz, deux sacs de sucre, un cartons de lait peak, deux cartons de tomates trois cartons d’insecticides et cinq cartons de savon. L’achat de ces marchandises lui permettra de bien vendre pendant  la période des fêtes de pâques. Ainsi il pourra améliorer ses bénéfices.

loans.use: To increase his merchandise

loans.name: Egaégnidji

texts.fr:
Mr. Egaégnidji A. was born on January 2, 1984 in Vogan in Togo’s Lakes prefecture. He is single and lives in Agoè. His business is making metal doors and arc welding. He began this activity in 2001. As a result of customer demand, Mr. Egaégnidji A. is requesting a first-time loan of CFA 300,000 to buy sheet metal and iron to make beds and metal doors in order to satisfy his customers.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Monsieur A. Egaégnidji est né le 02 janvier 1984 à Vogan dans la préfecture des Lacs au Togo. Il est célibataire et réside à Agoè. Il a pour activité est la fabrication des portes métalliques et la soudure à l’arc. Il a commencé cette activité depuis 2001. Suite à la demande de ses clients, Monsieur A. Egaégnidji sollicite pour la première fois un crédit d’un montant de 300.000FCFA pour acheter des tôles et fer pour la fabrication de lits et portes métalliques et de pouvoir répondre à la demande de sa clientèle.

loans.use: To increase his stock of sheet metal

loans.name: Foussenatou

texts.fr:
Born in 1978 in Adjengré in the prefecture of Sotouboua, Mrs. Foussenatou Allassani is married and has five children. Her husband is currently in Ghana and she is taking care of the children’s expenses. She sells yams in Agòè, an activity she began in 1993. The income she makes from selling yams enables her to support her children. This first-time loan she is requesting of CFA 300,000 will enable her to buy 11 bags of yams and increase her sales with the aim of improving her revenue.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Née en 1978 à Adjengré dans la préfecture de Sotouboua, Madame ALLASSANI Foussenatou est mariée et a cinq enfants. Présentement son mari est au Ghana et les dépenses de ses enfants sont à sa charge. Elle est revendeuse d’ignames à Agoè et a démarré cette activité depuis 1993. Les recettes provenant de la vente des ignames lui permettent de supporter ses enfants. Son premier crédit qu’elle sollicite d’un montant de 300.000FCFA lui permettra d’acheter onze sacs d’ignames et de pouvoir multiplier ses ventes en vue d’améliorer ses recettes.

loans.use: To increase her stock of yams

loans.name: Silvia Elena

texts.es:
Silvia Elena, a young woman at 36 years old, lives in Villa Reconciliacion with her husband, who is also a merchant, and their 2 young kids, who are 5 and 1. They both used to be workers, but when their 1st child was born they decided to start their own business together, so they resigned and with the money they had they started a small shop in their house, as this allowed them to be near their son, and now both their kids. The family unit is very important for them, as are looking after and educating their kids personally. They have had the shop for 4 years and they sell all kinds of foodstuffs and basic household goods. They now have the chance of enlarging their small business, and they would like a loan to do this. With the money they will buy materials such as cement, iron, wood etc. Once done, they would better be able to offer more products. This marriage fights every day to improve the business, and therefore provide better opportunities to their kids.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

SILVIA ELENA, joven mujer de 36 años de edad, habita en Villa Reconciliación con su esposo que junto a ella es comerciante, y sus 2 pequeños hijos de 5 y 1 año de edad. Ambos trabajaban como operarios en una Zona Franca, al nacer su primer hijo decidieron montar un negocio juntos por lo que renunciaron y con el dinero de su liquidación montaron un pulpería en su casa lo que les permitiría estar cerca de su hijo y ahora de sus dos hijos ya que para ellos es importante la unión familiar, cuidar y educar personalmente a sus hijos. Tienen 4 años de tener su Pulpería en la cual venden todo producto de alimento y aseo personal básico en toda casa, ahora con posibilidades de ampliar su pequeño negocio solicitan un préstamo para ampliar el local del negocio, con este préstamo comprará el material como es cemento, hierro, madera etc. Una vez ampliado podrán ofrecer mayores productos de ventas. Este matrimonio lucha cada día por mejorar su negocio y así brindar mejores oportunidades a sus hijos.

loans.use: To buy building materials to enlarge her business/Comprar materiales de construcción para ampliar su negocio

loans.name: Doribell Del Carmen

texts.es:
Doribell C., who is 34 years old, lives with her husband and 2 young kids in Villa Reconciliacion. Together her and her husband work selling wood, something they have been doing for 11 years. They need a loan to buy some mahogany, royal cedar and light cedar, which are the best sellers. With their mutual efforts as a marriage partnership they have given their family all that is needed, they have a good credit rating and they hope that, in these difficult times, the price of wood would go up so that with great effort their business would move forwards.

Translated form Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

DORIBELL C., de 34 años de edad, habita con sus esposo y dos hijos menores en Villa Reconciliación es casada y junto a su esposo trabajan e el comercio de madera desde hace 11 años. Necesitan un crédito para comprar madera de caoba, cedro real y cedro macho que son las variedades de mayor venta, con el esfuerzo mutuo como matrimonio han mantenido su hogar sin mayores necesidades, han crecido con su buen comportamiento de crédito y aspiran en estos tiempos difíciles en que el precio de la madera esta alto poner sus mejores esfuerzos para sacar adelante su negocio.

loans.use: To buy a variety of wood/Comprar variedades de madera

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es:
Don Carlos is 44 years old and he lives in Villa Reconciliacion, with his wife, who is a house wife, and his 4 kids who are all adults now. He sells basic items, such as rice, sugar, tins of sardines, toilet paper etc. He started this business with his own money 10 years ago, and it has helped him to pay the household costs, his kids education (they are still studying). He dreams of becoming old, together with his wife, maintaining the home financially and interacting with his community as with this business he has made good friends with many neighbours and people who live in the area. He would like credit to increase the inventory of his store, and now, as it is beach season, people are buying more food so that they can take it on holiday with them, or stay in their houses relaxing. He wants to buy fizzy drinks, tuna, bread, basic grains and tins of sardines, among other things.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Don Carlos es un hombre de 44 años de edad, que habita en Villa Reconciliación junto a su esposa quien es ama de casa y sus 4 hijos ya todos mayores de edad, Se dedica al comercio de insumos básicos del hogar como arroz, azúcar, sardina enlatada, papel higiénico, etc, Este negocio lo empezó con fondos propios hace 10 años lo que le ha dado para los gastos del hogar y que sus hijos hayan estudiado y aun sigan estudiando, sueña llegar a viejo junto a su señora pudiéndose mantener económicamente de su negocio e interactuar con su comunidad ya que con este negocio también han logrado ser mas amigos de sus vecinos y demás habitantes de su barrio. Solicita un crédito para aumentar el inventario de su Pulpería, en esta época de playa la gente compra mas comida ya sea para llevar en sus paseos al mar o para su hogar los que deciden quedarse descansando, comprar gaseosas, atún, pan, granos básicos, sardina enlatada, entre otros.

loans.use: To buy beach products/Comprar productos para época de playa

loans.name: José

texts.es:
Being 22 years old, Jose Luis really knows the value of hard work and how important it is. His parents' low income meant that he had to leave secondary education and become very independent at a young age. Since then, he decided to travel to the capital in order to find a way of earning some money himself, and in the city he did many craft and business activities. After saving enough money he went back to his home town of Juliaca, and bought some tricycles to rent as a mode of transport, and this is how he earned the steady income which he will use to implement the clothes making workshop. Your support of this young enterprising man will allow him to make his plans concrete in a short amount of time.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

José Luis a sus 22 años sabe el verdadero valor del trabajo y cuan valeroso e importante es, los bajos recursos económicos de sus padres lo obligaron a dejar sus estudios secundarios e independizarse a muy corta edad, desde entonces decidió viajar a la ciudad capital de su país para buscar la manera de generar sus propios ingresos económicos, en dicha ciudad se dedicó a diversas actividades entre ellas a la artesanía y al comercio. Luego de ahorrar lo suficiente decidió volver a su ciudad natal, Juliaca, y comprar triciclos para alquilarlos como movilidad de transporte y así obtener un ingreso seguro con el que pretende implementar su taller de tejidos de prendas de vestir.Tu apoyo a este emprendedor y joven empresario le permitirá concretar sus planes en muy corto tiempo.

loans.use: Injection of capital in order to put together his sewing workshop/Inyección de capital para implementar su taller de tejidos.

loans.name: Siloe 8 Group

texts.es:
Maria Elena is 46 years of age. For four years, she has been supporting her family with the profits earned from her mini market, in which she also sells fruits and vegetables. She travels to the city of Comitan to buy her products. She would like to buy a greater quantity of sugar, cooking oil, and soft drinks with this loan so that she will not have to travel so often just to purchase a small amount of goods. The other members of the group are Candelaria A. X., who sells goods, fruits, and vegetables; Maria Candelaria Pérez L., who sells chicken (cut into pieces); Ana Carina G. S., who sells apparel; and Maria Eulalia G. Pérez, who sells pork.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

MARIA ELENA TIENE 46 AÑOS DE EDAD, DESDE HACE CUATRO AÑOS MANTIENE A SU FAMILIA CON LOS INGRESOS QUE LE DEJA UNA PEQUEÑA TIENDA DE ABARROTES EN LA QUE TAMBIEN VENDE FRUTAS Y VERDURAS, VIAJA A LA CIUDAD DE COMITAN A COMPRAR SU MERCANCIA, CON EL PRESTAMO DECEA COMPRAR AZUCAR, ACEITE Y REFRESCO EN CANTIDAD, PARA EVITAR VIAJAR SEGUIDO POR POCA MERCANCIA, LAS OTRAS INTEGRANTES DEL GRUPO SON CANDELARIA A. X. VENDE ABARROTES, FRUTAS Y VERDURAS, MARIA CANDELARIA PÉREZ L., VENDE POLLO TROZADO, ANA CARINA G. S., VENDE ROPA Y MARIA EULALIA G. PÉREZ, VENDE CARNE DE PUERCO.

loans.use: Purchase more goods (rice, sugar, cooking oil, etc.)

loans.name: Siloe 1 Group

texts.es:
Maria Elena is 62-year-old mother of 5 children, whom she cannot ask for financial help due to their lack of funds. For this reason, she decided to sell cut-up chicken, which is brought from the Venustiano Carranza municipality, in her home. Her profits help her to both support herself and continue buying chicken. With this loan, she would like to purchase a kitchen scale and a larger number of chickens, thus saving on transportation costs. The other members of the group are: Maria del Socorro G. G., who sells shoes by catalogue; and Gloria Pérez, who sells groceries from home.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

MARIA ELENA TIENE 62 AÑOS DE EDAD, TIENE 5 HIJOS A LOS QUE NO LES PUEDE PEDIR AYUDA ECONOMICA, DEBIDO A LA FALTA DE INGRESOS EN LAS FAMILIAS DE ELLOS, POR LO CUAL DESDE HACE UN AÑO DECIDIO COLOCAR EN SU CASA LA VENTA DE POLLO TROZADO, EL CUAL ES TRAIDO DESDE EL MUNICIPIO DE VENUSTIANO CARRANZA, LAS GANANCIA LE AYUDA A MANTENERSE Y A SEGUIR COMPRANDO MAS POLLOS PARA SU VENTA, CON EL CREDITO LE GUSTARIA ADQUIRIR UN MAYOR NUMERO DE POLLOS Y EVITAR EL GASTO DE TRASLADO, ASI COMO LA COMPRA DE UNA PESA, LAS OTRAS INTEGRANTES DEL GRUPO SON: MARIA DEL SOCORRO G. G., VENDE ZAPATOS POR PEDIDO Y GLORIA PÉREZ A. VENDE ABARROTES EN SU CASA.

loans.use: Purchase of more chicken and a kitchen scale

loans.name: Siloe 7 Group

texts.es:
Maria del Carmen is a 33-year-old mother of 3 children, whom she has been supporting for 2 years by going door-to-door selling shoes by catalogue. She buys those shoes in Comitan. She would like to buy several pairs of shoes with this loan. The other members of the group are: Dominga Alicia G. A., who owns a restaurant; Mariola G. M., who owns a butcher shop; Maria Julieta L. G., who sells clothing; and Blanca Elizabeth Peña M., who sells Jafra beauty products.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

MARIA DEL CARMEN TIENE 33 AÑOS DE EDAD Y TRES HIJOS A LOS CUALES MANTIENE DESDE HACE 2 AÑOS SALIENDO A VENDER ZAPATOS POR CATALOGO DE CASA EN CASA, LOS CUALES SURTE EN LA CIUDAD DE COMITAN, CON EL CREDITO LE GUSTARIA COMPRAR VARIOS PARES DE ZAPATOS. LAS OTRAS INTEGRANTES DEL GRUPO SON DOMINGA ALICIA G. A. TIENE UN RESTAURANTE, MARIOLA G. M. TIENE UNA CARNICERIA, MARIA JULIETA L. G. VENDE ROPA Y BLANCA ELIZABETH P. M. VENDE PRODUCTOS JAFRA.

loans.use: Purchase more merchandise (shoes) to cut back on transportation costs

loans.name: Samar 3 Group

texts.es:
Mrs. Maria P. has been raising pigs for a living for 2 years, selling them to local butchers. She is a 47-year-old mother of 3 children, whom she has been able to move forward thanks to this job. She would like to purchase more piglets, vitamins, and pig feed so that her piglets can grow healthy. The other members of the group are: Maria Pérez V., who sells medicinal products; and Carolina G. L., who also raises pigs.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

DOÑA MARIA AGUSTINA DESDE HACE 2 AÑOS SE DEDICA A LA CRIANZA DE PUERCOS , PARA DESPUES VENDERLOS A LOS QUE VENDEN CARNE DE PUERCO, TIENE 47 AÑOS Y 3 HIJOS A LOS CUALES A SACADO ADELANTE CON ESTE TRABAJO, DECEA CON SU CREDITO DECEA COMPRAR MAS PUERQUITOS, VITAMINAS Y ALIMENTO PARA QUE CRESCAN SANOS Y BONITOS, LAS OTRAS INTEGRANTES DEL GRUPO SON: MARIA PÉREZ V., VENDE PRODUCTOS MEDICINALES Y CAROLINA G. L., A LA CRIANZA DE PUERCOS.

loans.use: Purchase more pigs, vitamins, and feed

loans.name: Pascuala's Group

texts.es:
Pascuala is a 38-year-old woman who makes regional, traditional clothing for a living. She makes blouses that take her a long time to finish because she embroiders them. This merchandise is sold to women in her community, as well as to women in the nearby communities. She is able to support her 3 children with what few profits she earns. With this loan, she would like to purchase more fabric and thread so that she can make more clothing. The other members of the group, Elena H. G., Rosa H. G., Dominga H. S., and Maria G. H., are all artisans.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

PASCUALA TIENE 38 AÑOS, SE DEDICA A CONFECCIONAR ROPA TIPICA DE LA REGION, ELABORA BLUSAS A LAS CUALES LES DEDICA MUCHO TIEMPO YA QUE TAMBIEN LAS BORDA, ESTA MERCANCIA ES VENDIDA CON MUJERES DE SU MISMA LOCALIDAD O COMUNIDADES CERCANAS, CON EL POCO DINERO QUE OBTIENE DE ESTO MANTIENE A SUS 3 HIJOS, CON EL CREDITO LE GUSTARIA ADQUIRIR MAS TELA E HILOS PARA CONFECCIONAR MAS ROPA. LAS OTRAS INTEGRANTES DEL GRUPO SON: ELENA H. G., ROSA H. G., DOMINGA H. S. Y MARIA G. H. SON ARTESANAS.

loans.use: Purchase of fabric, thread, and dyes

loans.name: Va Group

texts.es:
Pascuala would like to set up a general store in her house because she lives 30 minutes from the nearest town, there are no stores in her community, and there are hardly any cars for transportation. With this loan, she would like to purchase rice, sugar, cooking oil, cookies, soft drinks, pasta, etc. She is a 44-year-old mother of 3 children, whom she will be able to better support once her business is in place. The other members of the group are Petrona H. H. and Julia Herandez H., who both sell fruits and vegetables, and Teresa Maria Pérez H., who is an artisan.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

PASCUALA QUIERE INSTALAR UNA TIENDA DE ABARROTES EN SU CASA YA QUE VIVE A 30 MINUTOS DEL PUEBLO MAS CERCANO Y EN SU LOCALIDAD NO HAY TIENDAS Y CASI NUNCA HAY CARROS PARA VIAJAR, CON EL CREDITO LE GUSTARIA COMPRAR, ARROZ, AZUCAR, ACEITE, GALLETAS, REFRESCOS, PASTAS, ETC. ELLA TIENE 44 AÑOS, 3 HIJOS, A LOS QUE CON LA INSTALACION DEL NEGOCIO PODRA MANTENER MEJOR ,LAS OTRAS INTEGRANTES DEL GRUPO SON PETRONA H. H., JULIA H. H. LAS CUALES SE DEDICAN A VENDER FRUTAS Y VERDURAS Y TERESA MARIA PÉREZ H. QUE ES ARTESANA.

loans.use: Purchase of more goods (rice, cooking oil, soft drinks, etc.)

loans.name: Va!lectic 2 Group

texts.es:
Doña Juanita, as she is known in her community, works in floriculture, growing roses, which are sold in San Cristobal. With the loan, she wants to buy fertilizers and insecticides to be able to grow good, pretty flowers and some day be able to export roses to many countries. She is 32 years old and has 3 children to whom she is teaching to take care of the flowers that for so long have sustained the whole family. The other members of the group are Lorena H. P. and Catarina G. H., who sell fruits and vegetables, and Rosa H. H. and Maria Elena H. H., who work in floriculture.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer

DOÑA JUANITA COMO TODOS LAS CONOCEN EN SU COMUNIDAD SE DEDICA A LA FLORICULTURA, CULTIVA ROSAS, LAS CUALES SON VENDIDAS EN SAN CRISTOBAL, CON EL CREDITO QUIERE COMPRAR FERTILIZANTES E INSECTICIDAS PARA OPTENER FLORES BUENAS Y BONITAS, Y ALGUN DÍA PODER EXPORTAR ROSAS A MUCHOS PAISES, TIENE 32 AÑOS Y 3 HIJOS A LOS QUE LES ESTA ENSEÑANDO A CUIDAR LAS FLORES LAS CUALES POR MUCHO TIEMPO LES HAN DADO DE COMER A TODA LA FAMILIA, LAS OTRAS INTEGRANTES DEL GRUPO SON LORENA H. PÉREZ Y CATARINA G. H. SE DEDICAN A LA VENTA DE FRUTAS Y VERDURAS Y ROSA H. H. Y MARIA ELENA H. H. SE DEDICAN A LA FLORICULTURA.

loans.use: buy fertilizers and insecticides for the flowers

loans.name: San Juan De Orcasitas Group

texts.es:
The Communal Bank San Juan of Orcasitas is a bank that is just starting, with 21 members. The members of the communal bank are residents of the community of Orcasitas, which belongs to the districts of Pacaycasa. Orcasitas is 40 minutes away from the city of Ayacucho. The main economic activity of the town is craft brick manufacturing.

The members work on different businesses, such as selling food, groceries, tara(a Peruvian native plant used to make leather tanning powder), cochinilla (an insect used to make natural pigments), tuna (the fruit of a cactus plant), brick manufacturing, raising animals, and agriculture. Each member has a different history. For example, Edith works manufacturing bricks and sells them among their community and to middlemen. In addition, Edith studies obstetrics at University and her dream is to graduate.

The members need different quantities, 300 soles, 600 soles, 750 soles, totaling 7,650 soles in loans for the communal bank. The loans will be invested in buying rice, pasta, oil, sand, plastic products, farming tools, tuna, cochinilla, tara, and to pay the laborers. The dreams of the members is that their businesses grow, to become professional, that their children grow to be professionals, and having a union of brick manufacturers to sell wholesale without intermediaries.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer

. El Banco Comunal San Juan D. Orcasitas es un banco que recién inicia con 21 socias. Las socias del Banco Comunal son pobladores D. la comunidad D. Orcasitas que pertenece al distrito D. Pacaycasa, Orcasitas queda a 40 minutos D. la ciudad D. Ayacucho, la actividad económica mas importante es la fabricación D. ladrillos artesanales.

Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como la venta D. comida, abarrotes, compra y venta D. tara, cochinilla, tuna, fabricación D. ladrillos, crianza D. animales y agricultura. Cada socia tiene una historia diferente como es el caso D. Edith que se dedica a la fabricación D. ladrillos y sus ventas lo realiza en la misma comunidad a intermediarios. Además Edith estudia en la Universidad la carrera D. Obstetricia y su sueño es sacar su titulo profesional.

Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. préstamos, algunos montos son D. 300 soles, 600 soles, 750 soles, haciendo un total D. 7,650 soles D. préstamos en el Banco Comunal. Los préstamos lo invertirán en la compra D. arroz, fideo, aceite, arena, plásticos, herramientas para la agricultura, tuna, cochinilla, tara y para el pago D. los peones. Los sueños D. las socias es que sus negocios crezcan, realizarse profesionalmente, que sus hijos sean profesionales, tener una asociación D. fabricantes D. ladrillos para vender al por mayor y sin intermediarios.

loans.use: The loans will be invested in buying rice, pasta, oil, sand, plastic products, farming tools, tuna, cochinilla, tara, and to pay laborers.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es:
Alicia M. is from Saltillo, Nuevo Leon. She is married and has a 4-year-old daughter. Her husband works as an office worker. She stared her business 9 years ago. Since she was little she has enjoyed sewing. She started doing some mending, and thanks to her effort and good work, she managed to save some money. After that she was able to create clothes and acquire a larger clientele.

Because she lacks capital to buy inventory, she requests a loan for US $475, which she will pay in 6 months, so she can take advantage of the coming Spring-Summer season. With your support, Alicia will be able to succeed.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer

Alicia Martínez es originaria de Saltillo Nuevo León, es casada y tiene una hija de 4 años, su esposo trabaja como empleado. Inicio su negocio hace 9 años, desde pequeña le ha gustado la costura, empezó haciendo pequeñas composturas y fue gracias a su empeño y buen trabajo que pudo junto dinero, entonces consiguió confeccionar mas prendas y así hacerse de una clientela más amplia.

Debido a la falta de liquidez para comprar inventario es que ella solicita un crédito de US $475 que pagara en 6 meses, buscando aprovechar la próxima temporada primavera- verano. Con tu apoyo Alicia podrá salir adelante.

loans.use: buying merchandise (comprar mercancia)

loans.name: Blanca Margarita

texts.es:
Blanca E. is an entrepenourial woman who is married and has 3 children of ages 14, 12, and 10 months. A few years ago, she went through a difficult financial situation since her husband, who was the main provider for the family, fell ill. This left them with no money to pay for expenses, so she started to make and sell steamed tacos. Little by little, her business started to prosper and currently, her husband helps her manage and run the establishment.

Due to lack of funds, she is looking for a loan of $425 USD which she will repay in 6 months to renovate her business' image, better her presentation and increase her sales. Lets support Blanca and her family so that her business thrives.

Translated from Spanish by Natalie Kane, Kiva Volunteer.

Blanca E. es una mujer emprendedora esta casada y tiene 3 HIJOS DE 14, 12 AÑOS Y 10 MESES, hace unos años vivió una difícil situación económica ya que su esposo quien era el sostén de su familia enfermo, por lo que al no tener dinero para solventar los gastos elaboro tacos a vapor y empezó a venderlas, poco a poco su negocio empezó a progresar y actualmente su esposo le ayuda en el manejo y operación del mismo.

Debido a la falta de dinero para renovar la imagen de su negocio es que ella ahora busca un crédito por US$425 que pagara en 6 meses para así tener una mejor presentación e incrementar sus ventas. Apoyemos a Blanca y su familia para que su negocio prospere.

loans.use: Renovate her shop's image

loans.name: Ana's Group

texts.es:
The Communal Bank “Hatun Ayllu D. Aqchapa” is a young organisation. Currently, it has 2 courses and 16 members. the members of this bank live in the Aqchapa community which is in the Quinua district. They mainly do agricultural and farming activites.

The members do different agricultural activites, such as selling vegetables, raising animals, selling cereals, sewing blankets and selling brick-a-brack.

The members need different amounts of money; 300 soles, 450 soles, 600 soles, 900 soles, making a total of 8,850 soles that the Communal Bank needs as a loan.

The loans will be invested in buying guinea pigs for raising, buying cows, maize, wheat, peas, thread, wool, seeds, sugar, rice and to cover the cost of growing cress and vegetables.

They will use their savings to increase the capital of their businesses, start to raise guinea pigs and thereby increase their profits.

The members' dream is to see their businesses grow, to have a guinea pig farm, to have a shop, and that their kids study and get good jobs.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

El Banco Comunal “Hatun Ayllu D. Aqchapa” es un banco joven. Actualmente tiene 2 ciclos y 16 socias. Las socias del Banco Comunal son pobladores D. L. comunidad D. Aqchapa que pertenece al distrito D. Quinua, L. actividad económica que realizan son L. agricultura y L. ganadería. Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como L. agricultura, venta D. verduras, crianza D. animales, venta D. ganados, cereales, tejido D. mantas, venta D. abarrotes. Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. préstamos, algunos montos son D. 300 soles, 450 soles, 600 soles, 900 soles, haciendo un total D. 8,850 soles D. préstamos en el Banco Comunal. Los préstamos lo invertirán en L. compra D. cuyes para crianza, ganado vacuno, maíz, trigo, arveja, hilos, lanas, semillas, azúcar, arroz y para los gastos D. L. siembra D. alfalfa, verduras. Sus ahorros lo utilizaran en incrementar el capital D. sus negocios, implementar galpones D. crianza D. cuyes y engorD. D. ganado Los sueños D. las socias es que sus negocios crezcan, tener una granja D. crianza D. cuyes, tener una botica, que sus hijos estudien y sean profesionales.

loans.use: The loans will be invested in buying guinea pigs for raising, buying cows, maize, wheat, peas, thread, wool, seeds, sugar, rice and to cover the cost of growing cress and vegetables/Los préstamos lo invertirán en la compra de cuyes para crianza, ganado vacuno, maíz, trigo, arveja, hilos, lanas, semillas, azúcar, arroz y para los gastos de la siembra de alfalfa, verduras.

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es:
The sale and marketing of lamb’s wool and alpaca fiber is one of the most popular activities in the city of Juliaca. Maritza is 24 years old and no stranger to this kind of work. She’s been doing it since she was an adolescent, and little by little she acquired excellent knowledge and results, thanks to the advice and motivation that her parents inculcated in her. She learned this job from her parents who were hard-workers with big aspirations in life, just like Maritza. This enterprising woman buys her merchandise from intermediaries or travels to nearby towns to buy it, and when she acquires enough, she sells it wholesale to a textile factory in Arequipa. Market demand is increasing, and as such, Maritza needs to increase her business capital. That’s why she is asking for a loan.

Translated by Beatriz Yuste.

La comercialización de lana de oveja y fibra de alpaca es una de las actividades más populares en la ciudad de Juliaca. Maritza joven de 24 años de edad no es ajena a esta labor, se dedica a este negocio desde adolescente y poco a poco fue adquiriendo excelentes conocimientos y resultados, gracias a los consejos y motivaciones que sus padres inculcaron en ella.Aprendió esta labor de sus padres quienes siempre demostraron ser personas muy trabajadoras con grandes aspiraciones en la vida al igual que Maritza.Esta emprendedora muchacha adquiere su mercadería de los comerciantes minoristas dedicados a este negocio, y en algunas oportunidades viaja a los diferentes pueblitos aledaños a su ciudad con el fin de reunir una buena cantidad y ser vendido al por mayor a una empresa textil de la ciudad de Arequipa.Al ver la demanda del mercado Maritza tiene pensado aumentar el monto de su capital, con ese propósito recurre a tu persona para solicitarte un préstamo.

loans.use: To increase capital in order to buy bigger quantities of lamb's wool and alpaca fiber.

loans.name: Fiorella

texts.es:
Fiorella is a very happy woman who is very affectionate with her parents. At 20 years old, she is already the owner of a call centre. She decided to open this business 2 years ago with the support of her parents who offered her their help every step of the way. This telephone service has become very useful to the neighbors and those visiting the area, as it’s the only phone in the vicinity. With the result of offering more comfort and convenience to her clients, Fiorella wants to expand her business space and add some furniture (sofas). Your support will help Fiorella accomplish her plans.

Translated by Beatriz Yuste.

Fiorella, es una muchacha muy alegre y cariñosa con sus padres, a sus 20 años ya es propietaria de un Locutorio de llamadas telefónicas, decidió brindar este servicio hace 2 años con el apoyo de sus queridos padres quienes en todo momento le ofrecieron su ayuda para abrir este negocio.Actualmente este servicio les resulta muy cómodo y útil a sus vecinos y personas concurrentes a su localidad, ya que es el único que existe en su zona.Con el fin de brindar mayor comodidad a sus clientes Fiorella tiene pensado ampliar su locutorio y adquirir unos muebles (sofás) para una mejor estadía de sus clientes.“Vuestro aporte permitirá concretar los planes de Fiorella, no la dejes esperando”

loans.use: To buy furniture to improve the comfort of and service to her clients.

loans.name: Octavia

texts.es:
San Juan de Loro is one of the most beautiful valleys of the Puno department. Its residents are fruit-growers and produce a great variety of fruit such as papayas, oranges, bananas, cacao, etc. Octavia is no stranger to this activity. As a resident of this beautiful valley, she got started in the fruit-growing business since she was a child. For many years she used to distribute a large variety of fruits, from her native city, to different wholesale buyers. However, she later realized that she could earn higher profits selling her merchandise directly to the consumer. Therefore, four years ago she decided to obtain a stand at the Santa Bárbara Market in the city of Juliaca, whence she sells her fresh and delicious fruit.

At the moment, as she takes note of the demands of the market, she hopes to expand the quantity and variety of her products. It is with this purpose that she comes to you requesting a loan. Your help will allow Octavia to carry out her plans.

Translated from Spanish by Libertad Leal, Kiva volunteer.

San Juan de Loro, es uno de los valles más hermosos del departamento de Puno, sus pobladores son productores de una gran variedad de frutas como papayas, naranjas, plátanos, cacao, etc, y doña Octavia no es ajena a esta actividad, ella como pobladora de ese hermoso valle desde muy niña se dedicó a la producción de frutas.Durante mucho años distribuía una inmensa variedad de frutas desde su misma ciudad natal a los diferentes compradores mayoristas, pero observó que podía obtener mayores ingresos económicos siendo la vendedora directa de su mercadería, es por ello que desde hace 4 años decidió adquirir su puesto de venta en el mercado Santa Bárbara de la ciudad de Juliaca, desde ahí se dedica a vender sus deliciosas y frescas frutas.

En esta oportunidad observando la demanda del mercado tiene pensado aumentar la cantidad y variedad de productos, es con ese propósito recurre a ti para solicitarte un préstamo. Tu importante aporte permitirá concretar los planes de Octavia.

loans.use: To increase her capital and be able to offer a greater quantity of fruits.

loans.name: Renee's Group

texts.es:
Renee, Maria and Rodecinda have been members of the Banco Comunal “Tarpuy”, which means “Sowing” in the native Peruvian language of Quechua for 3, 12 and 15 years, respectively. There, they learned how to be punctual, responsible, how to save money, avoid sickness and how to boost their self-esteem.

Renee is 27-year-old single mother with a 3-year-old son. She sells groceries, fruits and vegetables. Renee also has a photocopier and offers it as a service. She is also a teacher and offers tutoring for children.

Maria is a 31-year-old mother of a 12-year-old daughter. Maria buys Tara (dye derived from a plant), cochineal (dye derived from an insect) and leather in the Magdalena Market and sells them to intermediaries who take them to Lima to sell.

Rodecinda is a 58-year-old married mother of 10, of which 6 still live with her. She buys Tara, cochineal and leather and sells them walking around the market.

Renee, Maria and Rodecinda need loans of 600 soles, 600 soles and 1400 soles, respectively; which they will invest in buying sugar, rice, school supplies, cochineal, Tara and leather.

Their dreams incluD. building a house, buying land, improving their business, and that their children will study.

Translated by Beatriz Yuste, Kiva Volunteer.

Renee, Maria y Rodecinda pertenecen al Banco Comunal Tarpuy que significa “Siembra” en quechua, hace 3, 12, 15 años respectivamente. En su Banco Comunal aprendieron a ser puntuales, responsables, a ahorrar, como evitar las enfermedades y tener autoestima.

Renee es madre soltera, tiene 27 años y 1 hijo D. 3 años, Renee tiene una tienda donD. venD. abarrotes, verduras, frutas. Además Renee tiene una fotocopiadora y brinda el servicio D. fotocopiado. También Renee es profesora y dicta clases particulares a niños.

Por otro lado Maria es conviviente, tiene 31 años y 1 hija D. 12 años, Maria compra tara, cochinilla y cuero D. animales en el mercado Magdalena, productos que venD. a intermediarios que llevan a Lima.

Mientras que Rodecinda es casada, tiene 58 años y 10 hijos D. los cuales 6 viven con ella, Rodecinda compra y venD. Tara, cochinilla, cueros D. animales, D. manera ambulatoria en el mercado Magdalena.

Renee, Maria y Rodecinda necesitan préstamos D. 600 soles, 600 soles, 1400 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra D. azúcar, arroz, útiles escolares, cochinilla, tara y cuero.

Los sueños D. Renee, Maria y Rodecinda son construir su casa, comprar un terreno, mejorar su negocio y que sus hijos estudien.

loans.use: To invest in buying sugar, rice, school supplies, cochineal (dye), Tara (dye) and leather.

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es:
Maria has been a member of the Comunal Bank “Tarpuy” which means “Sowing” in the native Peruvian language of Quechua for 12 years. There, she learned how to be punctual, responsible, and supportive of her community.

Maria is a married, 63-year-old mother of 9 children. All of the children are independent and she lives with her spouse. Maria travels to all of the different agricultural fairs of the Ayacucho region, 3 times a week to buy grain, small animals, cheese and other products. She then sells them at different markets of the city of Ayacucho. She also travels sporadically to the jungle of Ayacucho where she sells clothing and utensils depending on demand.

Maria needs a loan of 3000 soles (3 soles = 1 dollar), which she will invest in buying blouses, lingerie, notebooks, pencils, pens and paper.

She will use her savings to finish building her house. Maria dreams that her business will grow and prosper, she’ll have a nice house and her son will become a professional.

Translated by Beatriz Yuste, Kiva Volunteer.

Maria pertenece al Banco Comunal Tarpuy que significa “Siembra” en quechua hace 12 años, en su Banco Comunal aprendió a ser puntual, responsable y ser unidas entre socias.

Maria es casada, tiene 63 años y 9 hijos, actualmente Maria vive sola con su esposo, Maria viaja a las diferentes ferias D. la región D.
