Ayacucho, 3 veces por semana, D. las ferias compra cereales, animales menores, queso, entre otros productos, sus ventas lo realiza en los diferentes mercados D. la ciudad D. Ayacucho. Además Maria viaja esporádicamente a la selva ayacuchana donD. venD. ropa, útiles, dependiendo D. la demanda.

Maria necesita un préstamo D. 3000 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra D. blusas, ropas interiores, cuadernos, lapiceros, plumones, papeles.

Sus ahorros lo utilizará para terminar D. construir su casa. Los sueños D. Maria son que su negocio crezca y sea prospero, tener una casa bonita y que su último hijo sea profesional.

loans.use: To invest in buying blouses, lingerie, notebooks, pencils, pens and paper.

loans.name: Olga

texts.es:
Olga has been a member of the Communal Bank Tarpuy (which means sowing in quechua) for the past 5 years.

She is 34 years old, married, and has 2 children. Olga has a restaurant in a leased space in a high traffic area in the city of Ayacucho. In the mornings she sells fruit juices, in the afternoon assorted prepared meals, and in the evenings she sells fried fish (and activity which she has been doing for many years). Olga also sells natural products from brands such as Kaita and Santa Natura, which she offers to her friends and clients at the restaurant.

Olga needs a loan of 1800 soles with which she will buy rice, sugar, noodles, oil, flour, and fish.

She will use her savings to buy land or a house. Olga's dreams are to help her children get ahead, have her own house and own a stable business.

Translated from Spanish by Samantha, Kiva volunteer.

Olga pertenece al Banco Comunal Tarpuy que significa “Siembra” en quechua hace 5 años.

Olga es casada, tiene 34 años y 2 hijos, Olga tiene un restaurante en un local alquilado ubicado en una avenida concurrida de la ciudad de Ayacucho, en las mañanas vende jugos de frutas, al mediodía vende platos diversos y en las noches vende pescado frito, actividad que realiza hace muchos años. Además Olga vende productos naturales como Kaita y Santa Natura, productos que ofrece a amigos y clientes de su restaurante.

Olga necesita un préstamo de 1800 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar, fideos, aceite, harina, pescado.

Sus ahorros lo utilizará en la compra de un terreno o casa. Los sueños de Olga son sacar adelante a sus hijos, tener casa propia y un negocio estable.

loans.use: Olga will use the loan to buy products such as oil, fish, sugar, and rice for her restaurant.

loans.name: Simona

texts.es:
A few metres from the Central Cemetery in the city of Juliaca we find a very happy Simona, selling her beautiful flower bouquets. She’s originally from the Mañazo district. She comes from a very modest family so instead of finishing grade school, she stayed home and helped out on the farm. She married at 21 and the result of this union was her dear son Carlos. But, a short time later they decided to mutually separate. A few months later, she decided to move to Juliaca where she began working a few different jobs to make ends meet. Today she sells beautiful, colorful flowers. Her hard work is motivated by her desire to provide her dear son the opportunity to finish his studies. To accomplish this, she is asking for a loan so she can increase her business capital.

Translated by Beatriz Yuste, Kiva Volunteer.

A pocos metros del cementerio Central de la ciudad de Juliaca encontramos muy contenta a doña Simona vendiendo los hermosos y variados ramos de flores. Ella es natural del distrito de Mañazo, no pudo concluir sus estudios primarios porque sus padres provenían de una familia muy humilde, es por ello que desde muy niña se vio en la necesidad de apoyar a sus padres en su actividad agrícola y ganadera.A los 21 años contrajo matrimonio, fruto de su unión nació su querido hijo Carlos, pero poco tiempo después en mutuo acuerdo decidió separase de su esposo, a los pocos meses de su separación decidió radicar junto a su hijo en la ciudad de Juliaca y en dicha ciudad se dedicó a diversas actividades con el fin de brindarle lo mejor.Actualmente se dedica a la venta de coloridas y hermosas flores, el motivo de su esfuerzo es para otorgarle la oportunidad de concluir la carrera que está estudiando su querido hijo.Para cumplir su más grande anhelo requiere aumentar sus ingresos económicos, es por esa razón que recurre a ti para solicitarte un préstamo.

loans.use: To buy more flowers to sell.

loans.name: Susana

texts.es:
Susana is 24, very talented, and a loving mother. She finished her technical career, but for lack of job opportunities she hasn’t been able to practice her profession. That’s why she started selling handcrafts 3 years ago. She sells beautiful colorful clothing like sweaters, gloves and hats. Susana is from Lima but her job took her to Juliaca where she acquires merchandise from the San José market and when she has enough, she travels to Lima to sell it at a higher price. With this work she’s trying improve her son’s quality of life; he’s the focus of all her adoration and the reason she’s works hard and consistently. Your support will allow Susana to continue her work.

Translated by Beatriz Yuste, Kiva Volunteer.

Susana, es una mujer muy talentosa y madre muy amorosa de 24 años de edad, terminó su carrera técnica pero por falta de oportunidades no puede ejercer su profesión, es así que hace 3 años decidió dedicarse a la artesanía, confecciona hermosas y coloridas prendas de vestir como: guantes, chullos, gorras y chalinas.Susana es natural de la ciudad capital de su país, pero la necesidad y el trabajo la llevaron a radicar en la ciudad de Juliaca. Ella adquiere su mercadería en el mercado San José, luego de reunir una buena cantidad los lleva para venderlos a la ciudad de Lima, lugar donde sus hermosas prendas obtiene mayor precio.Con esta labor está logrando sacar adelante a su querido hijo, quien es su única adoración y el motivo de su esfuerzo y su constancia. Tu indispensable aporte permitirá que Susana siga desenvolviéndose con mucho más empeño en su noble labor.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise.

loans.name: Vilma's Group

texts.es:
Vilma and Marline have been members of the Tarpuy Communal Bank for 5 years now. "Tarpuy" means "seed" in quechua, an indigenous language in Peru. Vilma is a happy 35 year old mother of 3 children. She buy cereals from the Playa Grau market and sends them to her sister, who sells them in the rainforest.

Marline is 38 years old, married, and has 5 children. She sells food every morning out of the Nery García Zarate market. She also sells firewood out of her home.

Vilma and Marline need respective loans of 1000 and 600 soles ($575 total), money that will be invested in the purchase of peas, beans, wheat, cereals and firewood. They will use their savings to buy some land, build a house, and educate their children. Vilma and Marline share common dreams. They would each like to have their own house someday. They each wish to see their children working in the professional sector. Lastly, they would like to finish building their home and open a grocery store.

Translated from Spanish by Geoff Rubin, Kiva volunteer

Vilma y Marline pertenecen al Banco Comunal Tarpuy que significa “Siembra” en quechua hace 5 años.

Vilma es conviviente, tiene 35 años y 3 hijos, Vilma compra cereales del mercado Playa Grau y lo envía a su hermana para que lo venda en L. selva ayacuchana.

Mientras que Marlinees casada, tiene 38 años y 5 hijos, Marline venD. comida todas las mañanas en el mercado Nery García Zarate D. manera ambulatoria. Además Marline venD. leña en su casa.

Vilma y Marline necesitan préstamos D. 1000 soles y 600 soles, dinero que será invertido en L. compra D. arveja, haba, trigo, cereales procesados y leña.

Sus ahorros lo utilizarán para comprar un terreno, construir su casa y para L. titulación D. su hija. Los sueños D. Vilma y Marline son tener casa propia, que sus hijos sean profesionales, construir L. segundo piso D. su casa y tener una tienda D. abarrotes.

loans.use: Purchase of peas, beans, wheat, cereal and firewood

loans.name: Edith

texts.es:
The sale of cosmetics is the main source of income for Edith, a 23 year-old caring mother. Edith started this business 5 years ago when there was a lack of employment opportunities in her native city Juliaca. Every day Edith tirelessly traverses the streets for hours upon end with the objective of finding more customers. This way at the end of each month she generates more income so that she can care for her young son. This hard working mother together with her son looks to the future with optimism and hope. She would like to invest more money in her business with the end goal of generating more returns. She looks forward to receiving your selfless support.

Translated from Spanish by Geoff Rubin, Kiva volunteer

La venta de cosméticos de belleza se convirtió en el ingreso económico más importante de Edith, madre joven y muy cariñosa de 23 años de edad. Ella incursionó en este negocio hace 5 años ante la carencia de oportunidades de empleo en su ciudad natal, Juliaca.Edith desde que se inició en este negocio, transita durante largas horas incansablemente por las calles de su ciudad con el fin de obtener mayor cantidad de pedidos y así cada fin de mes obtener mejores ingresos económicos para que su pequeño niño no pase limitaciones económicas.Esta emprendedora madre junto a su menor hijo ve su futuro con mucho optimismo y esperanza, es por ello que desea aumentar el monto de su capital para incrementar la cantidad de sus ingresos, con el objetivo de continuar con su proyecto recurre a tu solidario corazón con la esperanza de recibir tu apoyo desinteresado.

loans.use: To offer a wider variety of cosmetics

loans.name: Gualberto

texts.es:
In spite of his economic status, Mr. Gualberto keeps working very hard to improve his situation and open up a carpentry workshop. He would like to offer a higher quality of life to his parents, who are his greatest treasure. This hard working man struggles every day to increase the number of commissions and customers he receives. Little by little he moves to the end goal of owning a fully stocked carpentry workshop. He needs a loan to invest in acquiring work tools and raw materials to decorate his beautiful wooden furniture that is in such high demand from his customers. Your invaluable support will help Mr. Gualberto realize his dreams.

Translated from Spanish by Geoff Rubin, Kiva volunteer

A pesar de su situación económica don Gualberto sigue trabajando con mucha insistencia para sacar adelante e implementar su pequeño taller de carpintería, y así ofrecer una mejor condición de vida a sus ancianos padres quienes son su mayor tesoro. Este emprendedor hombre se esfuerza constantemente para incrementar sus pedidos y mejorar la calidad de los mismos, y así poco a poco cumplir uno de sus más grandes anhelos de poseer una carpintería con todos los implementos necesarios.Hoy requiere para ello un préstamo de dinero que invertirá en adquirir herramientas de trabajo y materia prima para finalmente elaborar hermosos y variados muebles que son muy solicitados por sus clientes. Tu indispensable aporte permitirá concretar los sueños de este emprendedor y noble hombre.

loans.use: Purchase of tools and raw materials

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.es:
For 20 years Mrs. Lourdes has been selling merchandise in the Las Mercedes market and other fairs in Juliaca. Ever since she started her business she has shown herself to be entrepreneurial, dedicated and hard working. In every moment she has tried to move her business forward so that she could improve her family's economic situation. In recent months she decided to sell miniature products. Mrs. Lourdes packs and bottles her products for distribution to the public. She is very proud and happy with her work because with her small business she has provided her children with a good life and a good education. Everything Mrs. Lourdes does is for her children. This loving mother would like to increase the amount of goods she sells. For this reason she is asking for a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Geoff Rubin, Kiva volunteer

Desde hace 20 años, en el mercado Las Mercedes y ferias aledañas de la ciudad de Juliaca la señora Lourdes de 44 años de edad se viene dedicando a la venta de mercadería por campañas. Desde que inició su negocio ha demostrado ser una mujer muy esforzada, dedicada y trabajadora, siempre trató en todo momento de sacar adelante su negocio para el mejoramiento de su situación económica familiar.Por estos meses decidió vender productos en miniaturas para diferentes adornos, es por ello que Lourdes con todos sus hijos se encarga de imprimir los empaques y envasarlos para su distribución al por mayor, se siente muy orgullosa y contenta con su trabajo porque con este pequeño negocio viene brindándoles bienestar y educación a sus queridos hijos quienes en todo momento le corresponden por el esfuerzo que hace su amada madre.El deseo que tiene esta amorosa madre es aumentar el volumen de venta, con ese propósito recurre a tu buen corazón haciéndote la petición de un préstamo.

loans.use: To offer a greater quantity of decorations

loans.name: Octaviana

texts.es:
Mrs. Octaviana is very popular, hard working and beloved within the Santa Bárbara market in Juliaca. Ever since she was a child, poverty forced her to leave behind her studies and work to support her humble parents by selling fruit. After many years of working in this field, she is now 66 years old and very proud to see her own kids have professional jobs, families and promising futures. This is all thanks to the great effort of Mrs. Octaviana and her beloved husband.

But now Mrs. Octaviana feels sad and alone. Only a few years ago she suffered the loss of her irreplaceable life companion, her husband. Yet at the same time she was able to confront the hard times and move forward with strength, just as her husband would have wanted her to. The desire of this working woman is to increase the quantity and variety of her merchandise. With this request she turns to you. Your good heart will allow this courageous mother to keep smiling as life goes on.

Translated from Spanish by Geoff Rubin, Kiva volunteer

Doña Octaviana, es muy popular, trabajadora y querida dentro del mercado Santa Bárbara D. la ciudad D. Juliaca. DesD. muy niña la necesidad la obligó a dejar sus estudios primarios y apoyar a sus humildes padres en su negocio D. comercialización D. frutas; después D. muchísimos años D. haberse dedicado a esta actividad y con 66 años D. edad tiene el orgullo y la satisfacción D. ver a sus queridos hijos profesionales con sus respectivas familias y con un futuro promisorio, gracias al esfuerzo y empeño que puso constantemente junto a su inolvidable esposo.Actualmente Doña Octaviana se siente triste y sola, porque hace pocos años sufrió la penosa pérdida D. su compañero D. toda la vida, su esposo, pero al mismo tiempo con suficiente fortaleza para enfrentar la vida y seguir adelante como en alguna oportunidad su querido esposo se lo pidió.El deseo D. esta emprendedora mujer es aumentar la cantidad y variedad D. mercadería, con esa solicitud recurre a ti.Tu buen corazón permitirá que esta valerosa madre siga derramando sonrisas en su vida.

loans.use: To increase the quantity of products

loans.name: Reveca's Group

texts.es:
Dorotea, Reveca, and Gertrudes have belonged to the communal bank Tarpuy, which means "Sowing" in Quechua, for 8 months, 1 year, and 1 year respectively.

Dorotea is married, 52 years old and has 6 children, 4 of whom still live with her. Dorotea has a store where she sells groceries, vegetables, fruit. In addition, Dorotea sells salchipollo (traditional Peruvian dish based on roasted chicken) and hamburgers outsiD. of her home.

Reveca is married, 32 years old, and has 4 children. Reveca grows flowers in her land located in San Miguel D. Ayacucho, 20 minutes way from Ayacucho, and sells them to flower shops wholesale.

Gertrudes is married, 38 years old, and has 5 children. She lives in the community of Satica, district Pampa Cangallo where she has a general store. In addition, Gertrudes buys cheeses in her hometown and sells them wholesale at the markets of the city of Ayacucho.

Dorotea, Reveca, and Gertrudes need loans for 600 soles, 600 soles, 1000 soles, money which will be invested buying sugar, rice, oil, soap, cheese, and products to cure flower pests.

Dorotea, Reveca, and Gertrudes dream that their children will become professionals, their business grows, and to build a house in the city of Ayacucho.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer

Dorotea, Reveca y Gertrudes pertenecen al Banco Comunal Tarpuy que significa “Siembra” en quechua hace 8 meses, 1 año, 1 año respectivamente.

Dorotea es casada, tiene 52 años y 6 hijos D. los cuales 4 viven con ella, Dorotea tiene una tienda donD. venD. abarrotes, verduras, frutas. Además Dorotea por las noches venD. salchipollo y hamburguesas en la puerta D. su casa.

Por otro lado Reveca es casada, tiene 32 años y 4 hijos, Reveca se dedica al cultivo D. flores en sus terrenos ubicados en San Miguel D. Ayacucho a 20 minutos D. la ciudad D. Ayacucho, sus ventas lo realiza a las florerías al por mayor.

Mientras que Gertrudes es casada, tiene 38 años y 5 hijos, Gertrudes vive en la comunidad D. Satica, distrito D. Pampa Cangallo donD. tiene una tienda surtida D. abarrotes. Además Gertrudes compra quesos en su pueblo y lo venD. al por mayor en los mercados D. la ciudad D. Ayacucho.

Dorotea, Reveca y Gertrudes necesitan préstamos D. 600 soles, 600 soles, 1000 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra D. azúcar, arroz, aceite, jabón, queso y remedios para controlar las enfermedades D. las flores.

Los sueños D. Dorotea, Reveca y Gertrudes son que sus hijos sean profesionales, su negocio sea más granD. y construir su casa en la ciudad D. Ayacucho.

loans.use: Dorotea, Reveca, and Gertrudes need loans for 600 soles, 600 soles, 1000 soles, money which will be invested buying sugar, rice, oil, soap, cheese, and products to cure flower pests. (Dorotea, Rebeca y Gertrudes necesitan préstamos de 600 soles, 600 soles, 1000 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de azúcar, arroz, aceite, jabón, queso y remedios para controlar las enfermedades de las flores.)

loans.name: Zoila Maria

texts.es:
Mrs. Zoila S. is a hard-working woman who has always had to support herself. She is 50 years old and lives in the Memorial Sandino neighborhood of Managua, Nicaragua. She lives with her niece, who works as an executive secretary in the Baptist Hospital. Zoila has always been a very organized woman, which has helped her go about improving her home according to her means. She sells ice and ice creams in her house which generates a little income apart from her salary, and this is enough for Zoila since she does not have a family to support. In the future she would like to have a business that will help her maintain herself in her old age. She is asking for a loan in order to expand her kitchen. Her focus has always been on keeping her house well-maintained and having a nice home that can help to fill her loneliness.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Zoila S., es una mujer trabajadora que siempre se ha valido por si misma, tiene 50 años de edad habita en el Barrio Memorial Sandino, vive acompañada con su sobrina que trabaja como Secretaria ejecutiva en el Hospital Bautista. Ha sido una mujer muy organizada lo que le ha ayudado para ir mejorando su casa en las medidas de sus posibilidades, en su casa vende hielo y helados lo que genera una pequeña entrada aparte de su salario, suficiente para ella ya que no tiene carga familiar, en sus planes esta poder en un futuro tener un negocio que le ayude a mantenerse en su vejez. Solicita un préstamo para ampliar su cocina, su preocupación ha sido siempre la de darle un buen mantenimiento a su hogar y tener una casa bonita que llene un poco su soledad.

loans.use: To purchase materials to expand her kitchen

loans.name: Darling

texts.es:
Miss Darling is 25 years old and lives in Hialeah, where she has a general store and sells clothes and household appliances on demand. She started working five years ago in order to support herself. She requests a loan to buy products to sell and stock her general store with fruit, breads, sodas, etc. In spite of her youth, she has been working from an early age because she lives with her Aunt, who raised her. Aside from working, she studies and is an example to her community because of her effort and hard work.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer

La joven Darling de 25 años de edad habita en Hialeah en donde tiene una Pulpería, además vende ropa y electrodomésticos por encargo, desde hace cinco años empezó a trabajar para mantenerse sola. Solicita su crédito para comprar productos de ventas y abastecer su pulpería de frutas, repostería, gaseosa, etc, a pesar de su corta edad trabaja desde temprana edad ya que vive con su Tía que es su madre de crianza, además de trabajar estudia y es un ejemplo para su comunidad de esfuerzo y trabajo.

loans.use: Stock her general store (Abastecer de Inventario su Pulpería)

loans.name: Gustavo Antonio

texts.es:
Mr. Gustavo García is a hard-working and determined 53 year-old. He lives in Batahola Norte together with his wife and only son. Gustavo has taught his 16 year-old son the value of work, the importance of education, and family values since the time his son was young. For the past 8 years they have run a dining room in which they sell food to the people who live and work nearby. The business began in their house by selling 10 plates of food daily. Today they sell more than 60 plates daily. Gustavo’s success and business growth has come thanks to the support of his wife and the part-time assistance of his son, who helps with the business after school.

Gustavo is asking for a loan in order to purchase basic grains, fruits, vegetables and soft drinks in bulk. The vacations surrounding Holy Week are coming and that is a good time for his business, and thus he doesn’t want to lose the opportunity for sales. With a little more effort and dedication Gustavo dreams of seeing his small dining room become a successful restaurant that his son can take over after finishing his university studies.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer.

El señor Gustavo G. es un hombre trabajador y esforzado de 53 años de edad que habita en Batahola Norte junto a su esposa y un solo hijo de 16 años de edad a quien le ha enseñado desde pequeño el valor del trabajo, amor al estudio y valores familiares. Desde hace 8 años tienen un comedor en donde venden comida a los que habitan y trabajan alrededor, este negocio lo iniciaron en su casa vendiendo 10 platos diarios de comida hoy vende mas de 60 platos diarios, este éxito y crecimiento ha sido gracias al apoyo de su esposa y aporte de medio tiempo de su hijo quien del colegio se integra al negocio de la familia. Solicita un crédito para prepararse a comprar granos básicos, frutas, verduras y gaseosas en mayor cantidad ya que la en las vacaciones de Semana Santa es una buena época para su negocio que no quiere desaprovechar, con un poco mas de esfuerzo y dedicación don Gustavo sueña con ver su local de comedor a pequeño Restaurante y dejar a su hijo a cargo cuando termine una carrera Universitaria.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials for making meals

loans.name: Rodolfo De Jesus

texts.es:
Don Rodolfo is 47 years old. He lives with his family in the settlement Memorial Sandino, which is a poor neighborhood, which lacks basic services such as water, sewerage, and paved streets. The population lacks financial resources. This man works as a security guard, and with his job he takes care of the household expenses of his family. His wife helps out, washing and ironing other people's clothes, and it is so that these parents support their three children who are still studying. The greatest wish of this father is to accommodate their humble home, which currently lacks an adequate infrastructure. Mr. Rodolfo requests a loan to improve the kitchen in her home, which is constructed with sheets of zinc and plycem boards. With the future income, fruit of the hard work of both parents, they hope to offer their children a prettier and more dignified home.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer

Don Rodolfo tiene 47 años de edad, habita con su familia en el asentamiento Memorial Sandino, el cual es un barrio pobre, en donde existe escasez de servicios básicos como agua, no cuentan con servicios fluviales, no hay calles pavimentadas, la población es de escasos recursos económicos. El señor trabaja como guarda de seguridad, es con su trabajo que se encarga de los gastos de su familia, su esposa lo ayuda, la cual lava y plancha ropa ajena, es así como estos padres mantienen a sus 3 hijos, los cuales se encuentran estudiando. El mayor deseo de este padre es de ir acondicionando su humilde vivienda, la cual no presenta una adecuada infraestructura. El señor solicita un préstamo para mejorar la cocina de su hogar, el cual esta construida con laminas de zinc y plycem. Con el ingreso fruto del duro trabajo de ambos sueñan brindarle a sus hijos un hogar mas digno y bonito.

loans.use: Buying bricks, cement, and iron (Comprar bloques, cemento y hierro)

loans.name: Brenda Elizabeth

texts.es:
Brenda S. is a very creative and hardworking woman. Due to her piñata making abilities, she started her business 5 years ago at her home. At that time she was motivated by the need to financially support her husband and give a better quality of life to her son who was 1 year old. Currently, she is divorced and is able to provide her little one with all he needs thanks to her business.

Lack of funds to model and expand her business have led her to ask for a loan of $675 which she will repay in 6 months. Lets help Brenda and her son to have a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Natalie Kane, Kiva Volunteer.

Brenda S. una mujer creativa y trabajadora dada la habilidad que tiene para realizar piñatas hace 5 años surgió su negocio en un acuarto de su casa, en ese entonces movida por la necesidad de apoyar económicamente a su esposo y darle una mejor calidad de vida a su hijo quien tenia 1 año, actualmente ella esta divorciada y puede darle a su pequeño todo lo que necesita gracias a su oficio.

La falta de liquidez para hacer las remodelaciones y ampliaciones que necesita su negocio es lo que la hace pedir un crédito por US $ 675 que pagara en 6 meses. Ayudemos a Brenda y su hijo a tener una mejor calidad de vida.

loans.use: hacer  remodelaciones

loans.name: Lorena

texts.es:
Lorena R. is married and has a ten year-old son. Her story begins 16 years ago, when she began, along with a brother-in-law, to use clearance sales. Lorena and her brother-in-law began purchasing paintings from Ciudad Juárez, Chihuahua, Mexico, in order to make and sell frames. At that time Lorena’s husband was working for a trucking company that subsequently closed. He became unemployed, and they thus had to look for another way to pay for family expenses. They decided to open a business selling frames and mirrors.

Lorena needs to expand her business but she does not have the necessary capital. She is looking for a loan of $475 US that will be repaid in 6 months.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer.

Lorena R. es casada y tiene un hijo de 10 años su historia inicia hace 16 años, empezó con un cuñado utilizando la liquidación, de este empezaron trayendo pinturas de Cd. Juárez, Chihuahua, para hacer y vender marcos. En ese entonces su esposo trabajaba en una línea de camiones la cual cerraron originando que lo desocuparan, fue así que tuvieron que buscar la manera de costear los gastos familiares y decidieron abrir un negocio de venta de marcos y espejos.

Ante la necesidad de ampliar el negocio pero no contando con el capital suficiente es que buscan un apoyo económico por US $475 que liquidaran en 6 meses.

loans.use: To remodel the business

loans.name: Belbertina

texts.es:
Mrs. Berbertina Arévalo F. is a member of the bank Banco Comunal. Known to some as "Saint Rose of Lima", Berbertina lives in the San Martín region of Mariscal Cáceres province. She works out of the city market, called Las Brisas de Huallaga (Huallaga Breezes). Every day her customers come to eat her food. Her customers are mainly locals and passersby from neighboring villages.

After being let go from her previous job, Berbertina came to San Martín from Lima and began selling oranges. This business took up most of her time, and she had less opportunity to care for her kids. For this reason she decided to change her line of work to selling quality, well seasoned food every day from a set menu. This work has brought her great satisfaction, as she has more and more customers every day.

The $375 loan, which will be repaid in 6 months, will be invested in the purchase of various products to prepare her foods. She will buy rice, sugar, stews, various vegetables, beef, chicken, and pork. She would also like to repair her tables and benches to ensure her customers' satisfaction.

Berbertina is a happy woman who really wants to move forward. She is 35 years old and six children. Her youngest lives at home and is a student. She longs to convert her house into a store where she could sell groceries right from home.

Translated from Spanish by Geoff Rubin, Kiva volunteer

La señora Berbertina Arévalo F. es socia del Banco Comunal. “Santa Rosa de Lima”, vive en la Región San Martín ,provincia de Mariscal Cáceres , distrito de Juanjui , desarrolla su negocio en el mercado Las Brisas de Huallaga de la ciudad, donde diariamente acuden su comensales, que son moradores de la propia localidad o transeúntes de lugares cercanos Al ser despedida hace 8 años de su centro de trabajo vino desde Lima, dedicándose al negocio de la venta de naranjas, trabajo que ocupaba todo su tiempo descuidando la atención de sus hijos, razón por la que decide cambiar de actividad a la venta de comida variada tipo menú preparados con muy buena sazón que hace que cada día su clientela aumente por lo que se siente muy satisfecha. Con el crédito de S/ 1000.00 el cual pagara en un plazo de pago de 6 meses, lo invertirá en la compra de insumos para la preparación de los alimentos como: arroz, azúcar, menestras al por mayor, verduras en todas sus variedades por kilos, carnes de res, pollo, cerdo también en kilos, así mismo refaccionara sus mesas y bancas para una mejor atención de sus clientes. Berbertina es una mujer jovial, con muchas ganas de progresar, tiene de 35 años, 6 hijos, la ultima vive con ella y es aun estudiante, anhela acondicionar en su casa un ambiente donde poder dedicarse a la venta de abarrotes,

loans.use: Purchase of products to prepare food

loans.name: Luz

texts.es:
Mrs. Luz C. T. is a member of the Communal Bank. “Saint Rose of Lima,” lives in the San Martin region, in Mariscal Caceres Province, in the district of Juanjui. She is developing her business in three business stands in the Brisas del Huallaga market in the city of Juanjui. Daily, she tends to the residents who visit the market to buy their basic necessities. When her children reached school age, she felt the need to work in order to help her husband with the maintenance of their home. It has been 22 years since she began with small sales of fruits and vegetables. Now, she has established a clientele that knows her, whom she tends to daily for the purchase of their products. With the credit of 1000 PEN ($375 U.S. dollars) that she would be able to pay off within a period of 6 months, she would invest in the purchase of bunches of bananas, oranges, lemons, and other fruits typical to the region, in order to increase business in her three sales stands. Luz shows a lot of energy and vitality, she enjoys the business that she is developing together with her husband and her children and dreams of one day opening a stand for the sales of groceries.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Kirkvold, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Luz C. T. es socia del Banco Comunal. “Santa Rosa de Lima”, vive en la Región San Martín, Provincia de Mariscal Cáceres, distrito de Juanjui, desarrolla su negocio en tres puestos de venta en el mercado Brisas del Huallaga de la ciudad de Juanjui, donde diariamente acuden los moradores a comprar productos de primera necesidad Cuando sus hijos iniciaron su etapa escolar sintió la necesidad de trabajar para ayudar a su esposo en la manutención del hogar, es así que hace 22 años se inicia en la venta de frutas y verduras al por menor, actualmente tiene una clientela ya conocida que acude diariamente a comprar sus productos. Con el crédito de S/ 1000.00 el cual pagara en un plazo de 6 meses, lo invertirá en la compra de : plátanos por racimos, naranjas, sapotes, coconas, limones en cientos, shica shica fruto silvestre de la región entre otros, para implementar sus tres puestos de venta. Luz, muestra mucha energía y vitalidad y le gusta el negocio que desarrolla junto a su esposo y sus hijos y sueña con tener un puesto de venta de abarrotes.

loans.use: With the loan, she will buy more products for her sales.

loans.name: Maria Adolfina

texts.es:
Mrs. Maria Adolfina T. T. is a member of the Communal Bank. “Saint Rose of Lima,” lives in the San Martin region, in Mariscal Caceres province, in the district of Juanjui. She is developing her business in a stand in the Pomarrosas market in the city. There, on a daily basis, she tends to the residents that visit the market to buy food products. Thanks to her dedication she has managed to make her business prosper. When she first began, she was selling small quantities of fruits on the ground on one of the main streets in the city. Her clientele has increased considerably and now she has her own sales stand where she sells fruits and vegetables in larger quantities. With the credit of 1000 PEN ($375 U.S. dollars,) which she would be able to pay back within a period of 6 months, she would buy guineos (small fruit similar to a banana,) papayas, oranges, and other fruits and vegetables typical to the region to sell to her clients from day to day. Maria Adolfina is a hard-working woman. She lives with her husband and 4 of her youngest children, for whom she works daily and tirelessly, with the firm desire that they will one day have in their own home a shop where she can sell her groceries.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Kirkvold, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Maria Adolfina T. T. es socia del Banco.Comunal. “Santa Rosa de Lima”, vive en la Región San Martín , provincia de Mariscal Cáceres, distrito de Juanjui, desarrolla su negocio en un puesto del mercado Pomarrosas de la ciudad, donde diariamente acuden los moradores a comprar productos alimenticios. Gracias a su y dedicación ha logrado que su negocio prospere, pues cuando empezó vendía en el suelo en una de las principales calles de la ciudad, pequeñas cantidades de frutas, actualmente posee un puesto propio done vende frutas y verduras en mayores cantidades, su clientela ha crecido considerablemente. Con el crédito de S/.1000.00 el cual pagara en un plazo de 6 meses, comprará guineos, papaya, naranjas, sapotes, coconas en cientos, culantro, cebolla china en kilos, ajíes de distintas variedades, entre otros, para vender a sus clientes día a día. María Adolfina es una mujer trabajadora, vive con su esposo y 4 de sus hijos menores, por quienes día a día trabaja sin descanso, con el firme deseo que en el futuro pueda tener en su propia casa una bodega donde pueda vender abarrotes.

loans.use: With the loan she will buy more products to sell in her business.

loans.name: Tesalia

texts.es:
Mrs. Tesalia T. S., founder of the Hidden Treasure Community Bank, lives in the San Martin region, section Mariscal Caceres. Her sales booth is located in front of the Pomarrosas market in the city of Juanjui. She is dedicated to the purchase and sale of hens. She began selling hens when she was motivated by her husband who was the one that would purchase the hens that were brought from the town of Chacras. It is then that she saw that it was a beneficial business and thus they decided to begin their sales booth. With her loan of $725, which will be paid in 6 months, she will buy hens in an average of 10 to 50 every day. She will also invest in the purchase of feed and the fabrication of cages for their exhibition and sale. Tesalia is 33 years of age and together with her husband, she has two young children. She has many expectations and dreams for her life. Among them is to own her own home and there be able to start a small grocery store in order to secure the future of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer Wendy Wise

La señora Tesalia T. S. fundadora del Banco Comunal Tesoro Escondido, vive en la región San Martín, provincia de Mariscal Cáceres , distrito de Juanjui, su puesto de venta está ubicado, frente al mercado Pomarrosas de la ciudad de Juanjui, se dedica a la compra/ venta de gallinas. Se inicio en la venta de gallinas al por menor motivada por su esposo quien era el que compraba las gallinas que traían de las Chacras y vio que el negocio era rentable es así que deciden tener un puesto fijo de venta. Con el crédito de S/.2,000.00, el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprará gallinas en un promedio de 10 hasta 50 diarias. Así mismo invertirá en la compra de alimento y la fabricación de más javas para su exhibición y venta. La señora Tesalia tiene 33 años, junto a sus su esposo y sus 2 pequeños hijos,tiene muchas expectativas y sueños como tener sus casa propia y ahí implementar un negocio de venta de abarrotes ,bebidas gasificadas y plásticos que asegure el futuro de su familia.

loans.use: Purchase more hens for subsequent sale.  Con el prestamo comprara mas gallinas para su venta

loans.name: Laura

texts.es:
Laura T. Salas, partner of the Santa Rosa de Lima Community Bank, lives in the San Martin region, providence of Mariscal Caceres in the city of Juanui. Her business of selling new and used clothing is located in her own home. From here she heads out into the local communities to sell her items to clients who like this type of clothing. When she separated from her husband, she decided to begin her business. She knew she had a daughter to raise, so she began selling local and American clothing, which is now a successful business thanks to her many clients. With her $1075 loan, which she will repay in 6 months, she will invest in the purchase of new and used clothing items. These items will be for men, women and children and will consist of various sizes and styles. They will be brought in shipments from the city of Lima. Laura is a woman who has learned to make her own decisions and has grown to be sure of herself. She lives wither only daughter, who is the sole reason for her keep going. She dreams of having a well stocked store and also would like to implement various types of products.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer Wendy Wise

Laura T. Salas, es socia del Banco Comunal “ Santa Rosa de Lima ” vive en la Región San Martín , Provincia de Mariscal Cáceres , distrito de Juanjui . Su negocio de venta de ropa nueva y usada esta ubicada en su propia casa,desde donde se desplaza a las comunidades cercanas a vender sus productos a los moradores que gustan de este tipo de prendas de vestir. Al separarse de su esposo y teniendo una hija a quien criar decide dedicarse al negocio, de la venta de ropa nacional y americana en la que le va muy bien en la actualidad cuenta con una buena cantidad de clientes. Con el crédito de S/.3000.00 el cual pagara en un plazo de pago de 6 meses, lo invertirá en la compra de prendas de vestir nuevas y usadas para damas caballeros y niños en diferentes tallas y modelos los mismos que vienen en fardos, que lo envían desde la ciudad de Lima. Laura es una mujer que ha aprendido a tomar sus propias decisiones, segura de si misma vive con su única hija, quien es su principal motor para seguir adelante, sueña con tener una tienda bien abastecida, además implementarla con productos de plástico.

loans.use: Purchase more clothing for subsequent sale.  Con el prestamo comprara mas ropa para su venta

loans.name: Clara Esther

texts.es:
Mrs. Clara Esther P. T. is a member of the Communal Bank. “Hidden Treasure,” lives in the San Martin region, in the province of Mariscal Caceres, in the Juanjui district, and is dedicated to the production and sales of typical Peruvian foods (tamales, humitas, and juanes.) Her sales stand is located in the wholesale food market #2 in the city of Juanjui, where she helps her clients on a daily basis. Since she was very small, she and her mother have been committed to this work. She started her own business selling from house to house, through the streets of the city, and in doing so she established regular clientele for her current sales stand. With the credit of 1800.00PEN ($650.00 U.S. dollars) that she would pay off in 6 months, she would invest in the purchase of the basic ingredients for the production of her juanes, tamales and humitas, such as bags of rice, mass quantities of bottled oil, eggs, hens, bags of corn, and all of the other condiments that she uses. She would also buy firewood and bijao leaves for the wrapping of the juanes. Clara Esther is 50 years old and has 4 children, 2 of whom still depend on her. She is very content with the development of her sales activities, which allow her to support her children’s education. She dreams for them to have professions in the future, just as she also dreams to one day have a bodega in her own home.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Kirkvold, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Clara Ester P. T. es socia del Banco Comunal. “Tesoro Escondido”, vive en la región San Martín, provincia de Mariscal Cáceres, distrito de Juanjui, se dedica a la elaboración y venta de tamales, humitas y juanes, en su puesto de venta ubicado en el mercado de abastos Nº 2 de ciudad de juanjui, a donde diaria mente acuden sus clientes Desde muy pequeña junto a su madre se dedico a este trabajo, iniciándose sola en el negocio vendiendo casa por casa por las calles de la ciudad, para luego de haber ganado clientela establecerse en su actual puesto de ventas. Con el crédito de S/. 1800.00 que pagara en 6 meses, lo invertirá en la compra de los ingredientes básicos para la elaboración de sus juanes, tamales y humitas como son sacos de arroz, botellas de aceite en gran cantidad, huevos por javas, gallinas choclos, maíz en sacos y todos los condimentos que utiliza, también leña en tercios, hojas de bijao en cientos para envolver los juanes. Clara Esther tiene 50 años, tiene 4 hijos, 2 de los cuales aun dependen de ella, esta muy contenta por que la actividad que desarrolla le esta permitiendo apoyar en la educación de sus hijos, ya que sueña verlos profesiones, como también tener en su propia casa una bodega.

loans.use: With the loan she will buy supplies for the production of typical Peruvian foods for her sales stand.

loans.name: Francisco Ivan

texts.es:
Francisco N. runs a restaurant in Saltillo, Coahuila. His mother opened the restaurant 10 years ago in order to deal with family expenses. But now Francisco is in charge of running the business.

Francisco is asking for a $1125 loan which he will repay in 6 months. With the loan he would like to renovate the restaurant and therefore provide his customers with better service.

Translated from Spanish by Geoff Rubin, Kiva volunteer

Francisco N. tiene un restaurant en Saltillo, Coahuila el cual inicio su madre hace 10 años ya que requería de mayor ingresos para solventar los gastos familiares, ahora el es quien se encargada de manejar este negocio.

Actualmente el requiere de un préstamo por US $1125 que liquidara en 6 meses para hacer remodelaciones en el local y así brindar un mejor servicio a sus comensales.

loans.use: To renovate a restaurant

loans.name: Elith

texts.es:
Mrs. Elith V. S. is a member of the Communal Bank "Santa Rosa de Lima". She lives in the area of San Martin, in the province of Mariscal Caceres, in the Juanjui district. She owns a bookstore that is located in her own home. Motivated by her daughter, she started this business 4 years ago. Thanks to the first loan that she received from the Communal Bank, she was able to progress and currently she carries different products that allow her to meet all of her clients' needs. With the loan of S/.2000, which she will be repay in 6 months, she will buy school supplies such as notebooks, pens, pencils, erasers, paper, and office supplies such as photocopy paper, envelopes, clips, and so on. Edith is a very communicative and determined person who has the goal of installing her business in a downtown location.

Translated from Spanish by Samantha, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Elith V. S. es socia del Banco Comunal. “Santa Rosa de Lima”, vive en la Región San Martín , Provincia de Mariscal Cáceres ,distrito de Juanjui, su Librería . Cuenta con una librería la cual esra ubica en su propia casa, Hace 4 años motivada por su hija se inicia es este tipo de negocio, gracias a su primer préstamo recibido en el Banco Comunal, poco a poco fue progresando, hoy en día tiene una mercadería bien surtida que le permite cumplir con los requerimientos de sus clientes. Con el préstamo de S/. 2000.00 el cual será pagado en 6 meses, lo invertirá en la compra de útiles escolares como cuadernos, lápices, lapiceros, borradores de goma, vinifán, cartulinas, gomas en cientos, también útiles de oficina como papel bond, papel para fotocopias, clip, gramas, sobre Manila entre otros. Edith es una mujer muy comunicativa y perseverante que tiene como meta instalar su negocio en un lugar céntrico de la ciudad.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for her business.

loans.name: Rosa Mary

texts.en:
Rosa Mary Z. D. runs a small market in the tropical city of Pucallpa, Ucayali. At her market she sells clothing, shoes, and tools. She started her market one year ago after running a bodega for many years. When the bodega didn’t work out she changed her focus and she now has a successful business. Rosa is 32 years old, single, and has two children. She is happy to have her business and a supportive family that helps her with her children. She works and saves daily so that one day she can send her children to study at a university.

A member of the community bank Juan Zaplana Belliza, Rosa is requesting a loan of s/1500 to repay over 6 months to buy more clothing and shoes to restock her store.

loans.use: to buy more clothing and shoes.  The loan will be vital to restock her store.

loans.name: Juana Maria

texts.es:
Juana María R. is a mother of 2 kids who are 8 and 10 years old. Two years ago when her of her children got sick, she needed to find a way to generate more income in order to pay for medications, help cover family expenses, and pay for her children's education. She decided to start to sell a bit of everything. Succeeding at her business, she opened a shop where she sells clothes.

Due to lack of funds, she needs the financial support of $350 USD which she will repay in 3 months, to purchase a shop window to display her clothing and show off her merchandise. With your help, Juany will be able to provide better living conditions to her children.

Translated from Spanish by Natalie Kane, Kiva Volunteer.

Juana María R. es madre de familia de 2 niños de 8 y 10 años hace 2 años al enfermarse uno de sus hijos, tuvo la necesidad de buscar la manera de generar más ingresos para poder completar los medicamentos y además apoyar con los gastos familiares, y la educación de sus hijos, entonces decidió a empezar a vender un poco de todo, prosperando en el negocio abrió un local donde vende ropa.

Debido a la falta de dinero para comprar un aparador para exhibir su ropa y así lucir mejor la mercancía es que ella requiere de un apoyo económico por US $350 que pagara en 3 meses. Con tu apoyo Juany podrá brindarles mejores condiciones de vida a sus hijos.

loans.use: Purchase furniture

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
María del Carmen is a hair stylist. She has 4 children who are 26, 24, 18, and 16 years old. Her husband is a carpenter and due to the nature of his trade, they do not count on a steady income. In order to help pay for expenses and mainly to fund her children's studies, she started offering stylist services three years ago. Starting out with just a chair and a mirror and catering to her neighbors, her services are now in high demand.

She needs to expand her salon and buy a few pieces of furniture, but does not have sufficient funds to do so. This is why she asks for $1125 USD that she will repay in 6 months. With your contribution, Carmen will be able to achieve her goals.

Translated from Spanish by Natalie Kane, Kiva Volunteer.

María del Carmen es estilista, tiene 4 hijos de 26, 24, 18 y 16 años su esposo es carpintero, por la naturaleza del oficio de su esposo no contaban con un ingreso seguro por lo que para completar con los gastos y principalmente solventar los estudios de sus hijos hace 3 años, con una silla y un espejo, empezó ofreciendo sus servicios de estilista a los vecinos, ahora tiene buena demanda de estos.

Ella requiere ampliar su estética y comprar algunos muebles pero no cuenta con los recursos suficientes por lo cual solicita US $ 1125 que pagara en 6 meses. Con tu aportación Carmen podrá lograr sus metas.

loans.use: Expand her business

loans.name: Olga Lidia

texts.es:
Olga R. is a single mother and has a 4 year old son. Faced with the need to help her family and pay for her young son's expenses along with her own, she started selling jewelry as of 3 years ago. She buys gold and silver jewelry from the city of Monterrey in order to buy it at a less expensive price. Today, she has much more of an inventory which for the most part is made out of gold.

She needs $1125 USD which she will repay in 6 months. This loan will help her buy display cases to generate more sales and income. With your contribution, Olga will be able to give a better life to her son.

Translated from Spanish by Natalie Kane, Kiva Volunteer.

Olga R. es madre soltera y tiene un hijo de 4 años ante la necesidad de ayudar a su familia y solventar los gastos de su pequeño hijo así como personales, hace 3 años ella inicio comprando joyería de oro y plata en la ciudad de Monterrey para conseguirla mas barata, actualmente ya cuenta con mas inventario la mayor parte de oro.

Requiere US $ 1125 que pagara en 6 meses, este crédito la va a apoyar para comprar exhibidores y poder generar más ventas e ingresos. Con tus contribuciones Olga le podrá dar una mejor vida a su pequeño.

loans.use: Purchase display cases

loans.name: Bordadora Flora Group

texts.es:
The women that make up the “Bordadora Flora” comunal bank arrived at the Friendship Bridge office in the district of Nahuala ten minutes before the meeting was to begin. The members arranged the benches in the shape of a “U” and told the facilitator that they were ready to begin.

The clients would surprise anyone, since the spark they have in their eyes is unusual in many women who live in secluded communities like El Novillero, which is located in a very rural and poor area.

All of the members are well-known as embroiderers in their towns. Their principle occupation is embroidering beautiful traditional blouses. The main colors used in the blouses are lavenders, light blues, maroon, and purple. The combination of these colors with the color of the blouse is incredible. When the women wear these blouses, they give color and life to the streets of El Novillero.

However, four of these clients have more than one business. They have the following types of businesses: buying and selling clothes, a cafeteria, a small basic goods store, and traditional clothing sales.

Marta Tzco commented that she was going to use her loan to buy a refrigerator for her cafeteria. The refrigerator costs $720 and she is going to buy it using her savings from previous months and the loan. Julia E. said that she was going to use her loan to buy approximately 700 boxes of thread. It takes an average of four boxes to embroider one blouse. She expects that with this loan she will be able to embroider 175 blouses.

In addition to the fact that these clients know their businesses well, they would like to acquire new skills in different areas. For example, some would like to learn English, others would like to learn baking, while others would like to learn more about medicine.

The dream of each of the members is to get out of poverty. They simply want to escape from the clutches of a reality that does not allow them to develop to their full potential in different areas of their lives. It is important that we continue to support them so that this simple dream can become a simple reality, so that they can get ahead in life and combat the status quo.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Las señoras que integran el banco comunal “Bordadora Flora” llegaron a la oficina de Friendship Bridge en el distrito de Nahuala a tiempo diez minutos antes de que la reunión empiece, las integrantes ubicaron los bancos de plástico en forma de una “U” y le avisaron a la facilitadota que ya estaban listas para empezar.

Estas clientas pueden sorprender a cualquier, ya que la chispa que tienen en los ojos es inusual en muchas mujeres que viven en comunidades retiradas como las de El Novillero, que está ubicada en un área rural y muy pobre.

Todas las integrantes son bordadoras conocidas en sus aldeas. La actividad principal de las Bordadoras Flora es el de bordar bellísimas blusas tradicionales. Los colores principales de estas blusas son lilas, celestes, corinto y morado. La combinación de colores entre los bordados y el color de la blusa es increíble. Estas blusas cuando son usadas por las mujeres colorean y avivan las calles de El Novillero.

Sin embargo, cuatro clientas tienen más de un negocio. Estas clientas tienen un negocio respectivo en las áreas de compra y venta de ropa, cafetería, tienda de consumo diario y venta de ropa típica.

Marta Tzco comentó que iba a usar su préstamo para comprar una refrigeradora para su cafetería. La refrigeradora cuesta $US720 y ella la va a comprar con las ganancias de los meses pasados más su préstamo. Julia E. dijo que ella iba a utilizar su préstamo para comprar aproximada 700 cajas de hilo. Una blusa se puede bordar en promedio con cuatro cajas. Ella proyecta que con ese préstamo va a poder bordar 175 blusas.

Además de que estás clientas conocen bien su negocio, ellas quieren adquirir nuevos conocimientos en distintas áreas. Por ejemplo, algunas quisieran aprender a hablar inglés, otras repostería, mientras que otras les gustaría aprender más sobre medicina.

El sueño de todas las integrantes es salir de la pobreza. Simplemente quieren escapar de las garras de una realidad que no las deja desenvolverse a plenitud en distintos rubros de sus vidas. Es importante que sigamos apoyándolas para que este simple sueño se vuelva en una simple realidad, salir adelante en la vida combatiendo el status quo.

loans.use: To buy thread for embroidery; To buy clothes and traditional clothing for resale; To buy products and ingredients for sale in bakeries and stores

loans.name: Trinidad

texts.es:
Trinidad Hernández is a seamstress. She started her business more than 5 years ago with a sewing machine that her mother lent her in order to generate extra income to pay for various financial family needs since they weren't making ends meet with her husband's salary alone. He works as a high school teacher; their 4 children devote themselves to their studies and are 14, 13, 9, and 7 years old.

Faced with a lack of money to remodel her tailor shop, she asks for a loan of $950 USD that she will repay in 6 months. With your help, Trini's children will be able to continue with their studies.

Translated from Spanish by Natalie Kane, Kiva Volunteer.

Trinidad Hernández es costurera inicio su negocio hace mas de 5 años, con una maquina de coser que su madre le presto para que generara un ingreso extra para cubrir varias necesidades económicas de su familia ya que con el sueldo de su esposo no completaban, el se desempeña como maestro de secundaria, sus 4 hijos se dedican a estudiar tienen 14, 13,9 y 7 años.

Ante la falta de dinero para remodelar su taller de costura es que ella solicita un crédito por US $950 que pagara en 6 meses. Con tu ayuda los hijos de Trini podrán seguir estudiando.

loans.use: Remodel her workshop

loans.name: Paola

texts.es:
Paola A. is a mother of four children: Fidel, Paola, Margarita, and Raul. Her husband is a salesman at various markets where he sells clothing. Having to help out with the family's income 9 years ago, she started working alongside her husband until she branched off to sell toys and costume jewelry at the markets.

She needs a loan of $475 USD that she will repay in 6 months to repair her van, which is her work's main tool. Lets support Paola so she can continue with her business.

Translated from Spanish by Natalie Kane, Kiva Volunteer.

Paola A. es madre de cuatro hijos, Fidel, Paola, Margarita , y Raúl su esposo es comerciante en varios tianguis se dedica a la venta de ropa. Por necesidad de ayudar en el ingreso familiar hace 9 años empezó a trabajar a lado de su esposo, hasta q se independizo ahora se dedica a vender juguetes y bisutería en los mercados.

Ella necesita un crédito de US $475 que pagara en 6 meses para la reparación de su camioneta que es su principal herramienta de trabajo. Apoyemos a Paola para que pueda seguir con su negocio.

loans.use: Repair her van

loans.name: Nazira's Group

texts.en:
My name is Nazira R., I am married and a mother of ten, including seven boys and three girls. I have lived all my life in Chichawatni, Pakistan and my family currently resides in a three room brick mud house. Due to the high expenses of raising a large family, we have had difficulty meeting the needs of our family in a timely manner. My husband has decided to start a grocery store and I hope this business will yield reasonable profits to help our family situation.

The group members whom I plan to share the loan with include: Shamim and Amna, both of whom want to buy sheep and goats for their livestock trading; Nazira, who will buy wood; and Anweri, who plans to expand her fruit business. These members have learned many things over the course of working together, such as: to work under a mutual agreement, to be responsible, to save, and to receive training on a variety of issues.

loans.use: Start up a grocery store

loans.name: Rajan's Group

texts.en:
My name is Rajan M. and I was born in the historic city of Harrapa, Pakistan. Currently living in Chichawatni, Pakistan, I am a mother of five children including four boys and one girl, all of whom attend a local school. My husband runs a cycle rental store and he earns $5 to $6 daily out of this business. We require a loan to help expand and improve our business, thus being able to better provide for the needs of our growing children.

I will share this loan with four other entrepreneurs including: Shahnaz B., to buy a sewing machine; Khalida I., to expand her family’s shoes business; Rabia B., to expand her tailored clothing business; and Nazia B., to buy a dairy cow. These women share practicing values of punctuality, responsibility, and solidarity.

loans.use: Expand cycle rental store

loans.name: Sakina's Group

texts.en:
My name is Sakina S. and I am from Chichawatni, Pakistan. I have four kids including three girls and one boy. All my girls are teachers and my boy is obtaining a law degree. Both my husband and I have worked very hard all our life to provide a good future to our kids, and although we have limited resources, we have always put a top priority on our children's education.

My husband runs a diesel oil agency that receives reasonable revenues, however, we require a loan in order to improve our business even further. As group leader, I have undertaken responsibility for five women who reside in my neighborhood, including: Sakina M.. who requires a loan to expand her general store; Shugufta N., who would like to buy clothes for her business; and Shugufta P., who needs to buy a sewing machine.

loans.use: Expand diesel oil store

loans.name: Suriya's Group

texts.en:
I am Suriya S. from Chichawatni, a small city in Pakistan. I am married with two daughters and two sons. I hope to borrow a loan from Kiva to expand my family's shoe business. This expansion will help us generate higher profits in the high wedding season which fast approaching.

I would like to borrow for a group of women including Gulzaran and Shamshad and Saima, who will invest their share of the loan to the family’s shop in order to improve and expand the shoe business.

loans.use: Expand shoes business

loans.name: Nodirahon

texts.en: S. Nodirahon is 24 years old and she lives in the Spitamen region of Tajikistan. She applied to MicroInvest in 2007 and today she is an active client. She started her own business from scratch and through the loans she organized this business in wholesale rice trading. Despite her young age, she has been engaged in the business for 8 years. She works directly with the suppliers and delivers rice to the many traders in her region at very low prices. She is now applying to Kiva for an 8 month loan of $775 to open a new trade outlet.

loans.use: Opening a trade outlet.

loans.name: Karomat

texts.en: A. Karomat was born in 1974 in the Spitamen region of Tajikistan and is married and has one child. She has been a client of MicroInvest since 2007.  A schoolteacher by her professional background, she is also engaged in the business of selling food, growing many of the fruit products herself.  She is applying to Kiva for a loan of $1,200 for 4 months to implement the seasonal works.

loans.use: Implementing seasonal works.

loans.name: Lutfyjon

texts.en: B. Lutfyjon lives in the Spitamen region of Tajikistan and has a wholesale business. She is engaged in the rice trading business and grows the rice herself.  It is a family business, and she has been engaged in it for many years, thereby acquiring many of the necessary skills. Now she is applying to Kiva for a loan of $1,200 for 8 months to further increase the size of her business.

loans.use: for the business development.

loans.name: Mahbuba

texts.en: K. Mahbuba lives in the Spitamen region of Tajikistan.  She is divorced and has one child.   A client of MicroInvest since 2007, she has established her credibility as a borrower and has opened a trade outlet selling food products.  Over time she has expanded her business and now sells food products, towels and furnishings, perfume and toys. She works with suppliers from China so she trades in low prices and has repeat customers. She is now applying to Kiva for an 8 month loan of $775 which she will use in expanding her business.

loans.use: Expand sales areas.

loans.name: Sharobjon

texts.en: K. Sharobjon is 26 years old and he lives in the Spitamen region of Tajikistan. He is married and has 2 children. A client of MicroInvest since 2007, the stability of his business has allowed him to return the previous loans on time. He is engaged in the family business of selling rice and fruit which they import and grow. He trades by lower prices than the bazaar's, and therefore has many wholesale customers. He is applying to Kiva for a $1,200 loan for 8 months to take advantage of seasonal work.

loans.use: Implementing seasonal works.

loans.name: Malohat

texts.en: U. Malohat was born in 1960 in the Spitamen region and she is married and has 2 children. Her stable business has allowed her to repay past loans on time and to improve the business terms significantly. She opened a trade outlet in the local bazaar selling shoes and men's clothing.  Because she has a good assortment of products and low prices, many of her customers return to her.  She is applying to Kiva for a $625 loan for 8 months to import new goods and increase the variety of goods in her business.

loans.use: To import goods and expand their variety of goods.

payments.comment: Correction due to underpayment for business #40876

loans.name: Nasiba

texts.en: M. Nasiba was born in 1977 in the Spitamen region of Tajikistan and is married and has 2 children. She works on a collective farm but because it is seasonal work, she essentially depends on the income she takes from the family business of raising and selling livestock. She has great experience in the livestock business and has many of the appropriate skills.  She is also engaged in milk production, and is applying to Kiva for a loan of $475 to build a new barn that will allow her to to increase the number of livestock in their business.

loans.use: To build a new barn.

payments.comment: Correction due to overpayment for business 40877

loans.name: Khurshed

texts.en: N. Khurshed lives in the Spitamen region of Tajikistan and is married and has 2 children. He is engaged in the family business of raising and selling livestock.  His wife helps him with the milk production aspect of their business. His father started the family business and N. Khurshed has continued it with success.  Now Mr. N. Khurshed is applying to Kiva for a business development loan of $475 for 6 months to purchase one more pedigree bull.

loans.use: To purchase a pedigree bull.

payments.comment: Correction due to overpayment for business 40878

loans.name: Uktamjon

texts.en: N. Uktamjon lives in the Spitamen region of Tajikistan and is married with 3 children. He is engaged in the family business of raising and selling livestock, which his father started years ago.  As a boy, he helped his father to take care the flock and now he has his own flock which he is working to increase. Mr. N. Uktamjon loves the work he is engaged in.  He is applying to Kiva for a loan of $625 for 8 months to purchase a pedigree bull.

loans.use: To purchase a pedigree bull.

payments.comment: Correction due to underpayment for business #40879

loans.name: Un

texts.en:
Mrs. Un P., age 29, is a mother of two children. She works as a weaver and makes $6 a day on average. Her husband Mr. Kim Vy, age 30, works as a construction worker building house. He earns around $3 a day. They have two children, both of whom are students.

This couple wants a loan from Kiva to purchase a motorbike to commute to work. This will allow them to save a lot of money.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for commuting to work.

loans.name: Zevar

texts.en: U. Zevar has been a client of MicroInvest since 2007 and is engaged in the home business of raising and selling livestock and milk products. She is married and has 9 children who help her take care of the animals. With years of experience, she is applying for a business development loan of $625 for 8 months to purchase a pedigree bull.

loans.use: To purchase a pedigree bull.

payments.comment: Correction due to underpayment for business #40881

loans.name: Adolat

texts.en: K. Adolat was born in 1967 in the Spitamen region of Tajikistan and is married with one child.  She has been a client of MicroInvest since 2007.  Like many rural women, she is engaged in the business of raising and selling livestock.  By education and profession, she is actually an accountant, but her love for animals motivates her to be engaged in selling livestock. She is applying to Kiva for a business development loan of $625 for 8 months to purchase a pedigree bull.

loans.use: To purchase a bull.

payments.comment: Correction due to underpayment for business #40882

loans.name: Viloyat

texts.en: O. Viloyat has been client of MicroInvest since 2007, and like many rural women is engaged in the home business of raising and selling livestock and milk products. She is applying to Kiva for a business development loan of $475 with a term of 8 months to build a new barn.

loans.use: To build a new barn.

loans.name: Cheav

texts.en:
Mrs. Cheav K., age 38, is married with three children. Her husband grows a variety of vegetables, normally earning about $4 a day. They have three children. Two are students and other one is a blacksmith with a salary of $60 a month.

This couple will use this loan to purchase bamboo, a water pump, fertilizers, petroleum, a good bean seed, and to make a trap to grow beans.

loans.use: To purchase bamboo, a water pump, fertilizers, petroleum, and a good bean seed.

loans.name: Mastura

texts.en: U. Mastura was born in 1972 in the Spitamen region of Tajikistan.  She is married with 3 children.  She has been a client of MicroInvest since 2007.  Like many rural women, she is engaged in the business of raising and selling livestock.  Having years of experience in raising livestock, she is applying to Kiva for a business development loan of $625 with a 7 month term to purchase a pedigree milk cow.

loans.use: Purchasing a cow for milking.

loans.name: Block A 2024-2 Group

texts.en: The group leader of this small group is Christine B..  she is currently in the business of selling grossory and is requesting a loan to constract houses for rent and expand her business.  Christine is 45 years old and is married with a husband  who is a peasant . she has 8 children ranging from age 10 to 29 and her children go to school.  each week, Christine makes approximately 100 sudanese pound in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to constract houses for rent Christine is joined in her small group by Jackline K., Elizerbert N., Robina A. , and Cicilia K..  Jackline K. has a business in selling beer and wants to expand the resturant.  Elizerbert N. is currently operating a business in selling bread and wants a loan to buy motor-bike and use it for special hire.  Robina A.  operates a business of selling charcoal and wants to expand her business.  Cicilia K. is currently in the business of selling vegetable and is requesting a loan to constract shop.

loans.use: constract houses for rent and expands her shop

loans.name: Dilora

texts.en: O. Dilora is 27 years old and is married with one child. She lives in the Spitamen region of Tajikistan and sells children's clothing. She imports goods from China and sells them at low prices, thereby acquiring many wholesale customers. She also deals at the trade outlet that is located in the local bazaar.  She is applying to Kiva for a loan of $475 for 3 months to import new seasonal goods.

loans.use: Importing seasonal goods.

loans.name: Lon

texts.en:
Mrs. Lon S., age 26, is a mother of a little child and works as a garment worker with a daily income of $4 a day. Her husband, Mr. Veoun Von, age 27, supports the family income as a motor-taxi driver, normally earning around $3 a day of profit.

The couple will use this loan to help finance their house repairs.

loans.use: To renovate their house.

loans.name: Thuch

texts.en:
Mrs. Thuch P., age 40, is married with nine children and works selling groceries at home. On average, she earns about $2.5 of profit per day. Her husband Mr. Lay Vy, 44, is a fisherman and makes about $2.50 a day.

Of their two eldest daughters, one works as casino staffer with a salary $80 each a month, and the other is a motor-taxi driver and makes $2 a day of profit. The rest stay at home and are students.

Mrs. Thuch P. will use this loan to purchase more groceries in bulk to save money. With the remainder, she will buy a motor-taxi for her son to drive as a business.

loans.use: To purchase groceries and a motor-taxi.

loans.name: Dildora

texts.en: J. Dildora is 29 years old.  She is married and has 2 children. She lives in the Spitamen region and has a business producing and selling furniture, as well as installing furniture. Many of her clients are loyal and come back to her for business. She is applying to Kiva for a $775 loan with a term of 7 months to expand her business by modernizing and improving her workshop.

loans.use: To modernize and expand furniture workshop.

loans.name: Phnom

texts.en:
Mrs. Phnom C., 32, is a widow and lives with her two little children in a part of Bathambong Province, Cambodia. To meet her family’s expenses, she works on her small piece of land growing vegetables and also works part-time as a construction foreman making on average less than two dollars each day.

Mrs. Phnom C. would like to expand her crops to save more money for her children's tuition in the future. She would like to send all her children to school so that they won’t be illiterace like she is. After learning about Credit MFI from one of her next-door neighbors, C. is very interested in borrowing money to purchase seeds, fertilizer, and some farming tools to expand her crops and make her work more productive.

loans.use: To purchase seeds fertilizer, and some farming tools to expand her crops

loans.name: Bon

texts.en: Bon, who owns a soup stand, has received loans from Kiva twice before. She has successfully paid back each loan on time. Now she hopes to carry on her partnership with Kiva in order to acheive continued business growth.

loans.use: To buy more ingredients

loans.name: Lang

texts.en:
Mrs. Lang H., 56, is a mother of five children and lives with her husband in Bathambong province, Cambodia. She works making a local food called "nem" (a sour roll made of hashed meat (usually pork and fish) wrapped and cooked in green banana leaves), which is favored by the Cambodian people. With this business activity, she can typically make around $5 each day in revenue.

Her husband also helps to generate the family income by working as a carpenter and normally earns about $5 each day of income. Two of her children work with her, helping her to make nem. The other three are married and stay outside the family’s home.

Mrs. Lang H. has applied for a loan to expand her business. Another part of the loan is to repair her oven.

loans.use: To expand her business and repair her oven.

loans.name: Tep

texts.en:
Mrs. Tep C., 44, is a widow who works selling a variety of vegetables in a busy market and earns around $1 a day of profit. Her son Mr. Sim Soka, 25, is a taxi driver. He earns $10 a day.

Her son wants a loan from Kiva to use with his saving to purchase a new car to replace his old, unreliable car that uses a lot of gas. This will allow him to save in the future and help the family to establish a standard of living. Mrs. Tep C. is pictured with her son.)

loans.use: To purchase a new car.

loans.name: Inobat

texts.en: Inobat U. was born in 1962 in the Spitamen region. She is married and has 6 children. She has been an active client of MLF MicroInvest-Tajikistan since 2007. She is engaged in the family livestock business but also has her own business selling soup kits, jellied minced meat and cooked trotters (pigs' feet). She has been in this business for 8 years. Now Mrs. U. is applying for a loan of 1,600 STJ to further her business development.

loans.use: Business development

loans.name: Nghean

texts.en: Mrs. Nghean S., age 35, is married with two children. She makes souvenirs and sells them to souvenir stores in her community. She usually can earn around $5 each day of income from this business. Her husband works as a secondary-school teacher and can make only two dollars each day. In order to facilitate her business production and reduce her work burden, Mrs. Nghean S. has humbly applied for a loan from CREDIT MFI to purchase more carving tools and wood to supply her business.

loans.use: To purchase more carving tools and wood to supply her business.

payments.comment:
Congratulations to Nghean Sarean for repaying her loan early! Because of your loan, she was immediately able to increase her output and repay this Kiva loan. She thanks you for your support

And we thank you for supporting poor Cambodian entrepreneurs. WE hope you will invest in CREDIT MFI in the future.

Many thanks,
Jordyan Edmiston, Kiva Fellow, Cambodia
and the entire CREDIT MFI staff

loans.name: Hout

texts.en:
Mrs. Hout H., age 50, works as a dealer purchasing chili and dry fish, making on average $2 a day. Her husband, Mr. Pum Phun, age 52, is an army doctor with a salary $50 a month. They have 5 children.

Two of their children are teachers with a salary $80 each per month and their other children help their mother with the housework.

She would like to borrow $500 to increase the amount of chili and dry fish she can buy in bulk and resell. She will use the rest of money to raise pigs. (Picture: husband and wife)

loans.use: To purchase chili and dry fish and raise pigs

loans.name: Dau

texts.en:
Dau, 41 years old, sells groceries and brewed coffee in front of her home. She is able to earn between 5-10,000 VND (US$ 0.31-$ 0.62) per day. She wishes to increase her inventory so that she can sell more items. She received loan from Kiva on September 2007 that she paid back on time after four months.

Dau's husband Thanh, age 48, works at the train station. He fixes the railways when they are in bad condition, but he only gets paid 30,000 VND ($1.87) per day. With the money they earn, they are able to put food on the table, but they cannot afford to pay for their son's education, so he must stay home to help the family. Dau and Thanh have two children. D. Ngoc Son is 25 years old and D. T. Ha is 11 years old.

loans.use: To increase inventory in Dau's grocery store

loans.name: Roth

texts.en:
Mrs. Roth N., age 52, is a widow and is a mother of five children. To improve her standard of living, Roth N. started a business selling Chinese noodle soup at her home in 1997. She can make about $4.50 each day in revenue. Three of her children work as sculptors, another one is unemployed, and the rest are married and stay outside of the family’s home.

Mrs. Roth needs the loan to expand her business and to buy more sculpture tools to facilitate her children’s work.

loans.use: To expand her business and to buy more sculpture tools to facilitate her children’s work

loans.name: Usmonjon

texts.en: Usmonjon A. lives in the Spitamen region. He is 37 years old married with five children. He is engaged in the family business of growing and selling rice, onions, potatoes and carrots. Besides that, he also is engaged in wholesale tea trading. He has a good assortment of tea. Mr. A. is applying for a loan of 2,100 STJ for the required seasonal preparation that permits him to have the good yield and to yield the vegetables he can further trade.

loans.use: The required seasonal preparation

payments.comment: Correction due to underpayment for business #40900

loans.name: Rith

texts.en:
Mrs. Rith C., age 43, has about 10 years of experiences selling vegetables at a Phsar Loer market and usually makes on average around $3/day of income. Her husband uses his own motor-bike to transport clothes and other household goods to sell from place to place. He adds about $5 each day for his family. This couple has five children who are students.

Mrs. Rith C. has applied for a loan to expand her inventory. She will also use a part of the loan to buy extra fashionable clothes to satisfy the demands of her husband's clients. Her husband said that the more clothes they have in their inventory, the more options they have to fulfill their clients’ demands.

loans.use: To expand her inventory and to buy very fashionable clothes to sell

loans.name: Nim

texts.en:
