Mrs. Nim K., age 54, is a mother of three children. She owns a plot of farmland for growing rice. After the farm work, she also makes Khmer food to sell to the villagers. She earns around $2 a day of profit. Her husband, Mr. Leng Put, age 60, works as farmer. They have three children, all of whom are employed by a garment factory and earn a salary of $60 each a day.

She will use this loan to purchase a small tractor to assist her in her farm work.

loans.use: To purchase a small tractor

loans.name: Sam

texts.en:
Mrs. Sam S., age 62 and her husband, age 67, run a carpentry store, making wooden furniture, such as windows, doors, chairs, and tables. They make an average of about $5 each day. All of her family members, including two children, live in a small wooden house built partly inside the carpentry store, which is the life blood of her entire family. The photo shows one of her sons working in the carpentry store.

The rainy season is a big concern of Mrs Sam S.'s family because some parts of her carpentry store are prone to flooding and some of her wooden furniture becomes soaked and rotten. Mrs. Sam S. would like to request a loan of $1200 to fill up the land so that this will not happen again in the future.

loans.use: To fill the land under her store to protect the store from flooding during the rainy season.

loans.name: Pon

texts.en:
Mrs. Pon N., 41, owns a plot of farmland where she grows a variety of vegetables. She makes an average of about $4 a day in profit. Her husband, Mr. Thon Krat, age 42, works as a construction worker building houses. He earns around $5 a day. They have four children, two of whom are married and live away from home. Two others work in a garment factory with a salary $100 each a month.

She needs this loan to purchase wood, cement and construction tools to repair her house.

loans.use: She hopes to use this loan to renovate her house.

loans.name: Huyen

texts.en:
Huyen, 29, and her husband Thanh, 41, are originally from a town near Hanoi in the north of Vietnam. They moved to Tanh Linh in hopes of being abL. to make a better living. Finding work was initially very difficult, so they asked for a loan in order to get started. The lender they received the loan from charged an exorbitant interest rate, which left them stuck in poverty.

Huyen runs a small grocery store in the front of their home and Thanh works as a day laborer. Huyen is abL. to earn between 10-15,000 VND (US$ 0.62-$ 0.94) per day. Thanh earns about 30,000 VND per day (about $1.85 US), but he is not always abL. to find work. With the loan from Mekong Plus and Kiva, they can save more of their money without worrying about interest payments. They are trying to raise two children, Han T. Tuyet Loan and Han Minh Cong, aged 8 and 4 respectively. They received loan from Kiva on September 2007 and paid it back on time after four months. She hopes to continue with Kiva again to help her business grow.

loans.use: To expand grocery store

loans.name: Tun

texts.en:
Mr. Tun C., age 44, is married with three children and lives with his wife and his ailing mother in Bathambong province, Cambodia. Tun C. is a fisherman at the Tunle Sap river, which is the biggest lake in Cambodia. His wife works selling fish at a busy market. She usually takes some fish from her husband, Mr. Tun C., and sometime buys from a nearby dock.

With this daily business activity, this couple can make collectively around $9/day of income. This couple hopes to use this loan to purchase more fishing tools and to reinvest in their business.

loans.use: To purchase more fishing tools and to reinvest in their business.

loans.name: So

texts.en:
Mrs. So C., age 45, is a widow with two children. She sells porridge in her village and makes around $2 a day of profit. One of her daughters is a garment worker with a salary $70 a month and her son works digging a well in the village.

Mrs. So C. wants to use this loan to renovate her house.

loans.use: She will use this loan to renovate her house.

loans.name: Tam

texts.en: Tam and Cuong have proven to be very reliable business partners. They have borrowed from Mekong Plus on 3 different occasions and have repaid each loan on time. They also received a loan from Kiva last time and have repaid on time as well. Her previous loans have helped Tam's family to be able to build a new small home with a bathroom. They were even able to paint their home with the money they saved up. They would like to continue to partner with Mekong Plus and Kiva so that they can expand Tam's grocery business.

loans.use: To buy more produce for her little business

loans.name: Chin

texts.en: Mrs. Chin Y., 50, is a widow and has four children. Her husband passed away many years ago, so she is the one who take care of and covers all of her family’s expenses. Starting in 2000, she opened a stand in front of a primary school selling biscuits, snacks and sugarcane juice. She is able to earn around $8 each day of income. In order to lessen her family’s financial cost, Mrs. Chin Y. is taking a loan from CREDIT MFI in the amount of $400 to purchase piglets to breed on her piece of land. She expects to earn income from this breeding in six to seven months.

loans.use: To purchase piglets to breed

loans.name: Chan

texts.en:
Mrs. Chan V., age 42, is a mother of six children and works as land broker, making around $3 a day. Her husband, Mr. Chun Ro, 60, owns a plot of farmland and grows rice. He earns approximately $2 a day. They have six children. One child is married and lives away from home and two others works as car mechanics with a salary $100 each a month. The rest are students.

She wants to use this loan to repair her house.

loans.use: She wants to use this loan to repair her house

loans.name: Prok

texts.en:
Mrs. Prok S., age 60, works with her retired husband making fishing nets and selling them for a profit. She also sells biscuits to generate extra income to cover some parts of her family’s financial cost. Mrs. Prok S. has six children. Five are single and one is married. One of her children sells make-up and beauty products and another one is a photographer. Some part of their income is added to the family income.

Mrs. Prok S. has requested for a loan to purchase more make-up and beauty products for her daughter to sell, so that she can satisfy her clients’ needs. (Mrs. S.'s husband is pictured, she was not available.)

loans.use: To purchase more make-up and beauty products for her daughter's business

loans.name: Ludmila

texts.en:
Ludmila is a dedicated mother and business owner who, despite difficult life circumstances, is working hard to make a better life for her family. Ludmila is a widow. She has four children: three boys and a girl. Her oldest son was married for a year, but his wife died and he was left with a baby son to raise. Ludmila lives with her children and wants to use her income to help support her family. She started her clothing sales business about five years ago, after deciding that since she always went to the market to buy clothing, others would too. So it would be a good business to get into. With hard work, perseverance, and financial assistance from Nadiya Ukraine, she has developed a successful business. Ludmila currently makes about $800 profit in a typical month.

Ludmila has requested a loan of $1000 to help prepare for the change of seasons, by purchasing new spring and summer inventory. She hopes to be ready for the busy spring holiday time which is coming up soon. It is a privilege to help an entrepreneur like Ludmila with her work and we look forward to many more opportunities to assist her in making a better life for her loved ones.

loans.use: Purchase inventory for spring and summer seasons

loans.name: Oleg

texts.en:
Oleg has a little business selling a variety of tools and accessories in the auto parts section of the busy Central Market in Melitopol, Ukraine. He has a nice location at the market that is convenient and offers good visibility to passing customers. Oleg has been in business for about eight years. He has established good relations with his co-workers in the market and has a loyal client base. Not married at the moment, he is making preparations to have a family in the future.

Oleg has requested a loan of $800 to purchase new inventory. The ability to buy more inventory at low prices will give Oleg the opportunity to increase his profits and continue developing a successful enterprise while improving his standard of living.

loans.use: Purchase more inventory for his business

loans.name: Gulnara

texts.en:
Gulnara is married with two grown children. She lives in Simferopol and runs a vending business in the central city market. Gulnara sells jeans and women’s outer wear. Several other family members work with her in this business. They help her with sales as Gulnara owns four vending kiosks and needs much help. She has been in this trade for four years.

Gulnara is very purpose-driven and enterprising. She never stops where she’s at but tries to press on and move forward with her business endeavors. Today Gulnara is requesting a loan of $1000 to restock her merchandise and possibly open a new vending location. She is hoping to generate enough profit to provide her kids with separate apartments one day. This is one of her biggest dreams and goals in life.

loans.use: To purchase additional merchandise

loans.name: Yelena

texts.en:
Yelena is divorced with two grown daughters. The company she had worked for downsized, and Yelena had to look for other work opportunities. That is how she decided to start her own venture. Today Yelena owns a business selling athletic sportswear in the local market called “Yulana.” This is the only source of income for her family. Yelena has a nice assortment of inventory in her kiosk. She has been in this trade for 12 years. Her average daily profit is about $30. 

Yelena is always innovative and dedicated to the ideal trendy brands and superior design of her merchandise. She always sells only the best quality sportswear that gives the right choice of comfort, fit, and style for her clients. Today Yelena is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase additional merchandise. She’s hoping to expand her trade in the future and start selling athletic footwear too.

loans.use: To purchase 30 sport suits

loans.name: Sum

texts.en:
Mrs. Sum Y., age 34, is a mother of two children and lives with her parents and her husband, Mr. Pok Bun luom, who works as a policeman. She is a market vendor selling grocery products and clothes, and making about $4 each day in revenue. One day each week, she has to import clothes from the city to fill her stock.

Mrs. Sum Y. has humbly applied for a loan to purchase more grocery products to meet her growing customer demand.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery products to sell

loans.name: Cesilia's Rose Red Group

texts.en:
Cesilia, age 31, is the singe parent of an 8 year old girl. She owns two businesses- a small street cafe and also a tailoring office. She starts cooking at 6:30am for her cafe, which serves lunch daily. In the afternoon, she works at her tailoring business and finishes work at 7:30pm. She started these businesses in 2005 and now makes a monthly profit of about $320 from her work.

In the past, Cesilia took a previous loan from Tujijenge Tanzania to buy more food stock and fabrics. She paid this loan back successfully and now hopes for a new loan to help her tailoring business. She will share this loan with her loan group, which totals 18 members. These members hold eachother accountable in paying back their loans.

In the picture, Cesilia is sitting in the front row, third from the left.

loans.use: To purchase more fabrics for her tailoring business

loans.name: Kitima Adzovi Et Adzato Ami Group

texts.fr:
K. Adzovi, 43, and A. Ami, 45, are two married women who have 7 and 6 children, respectively. They own a small restaurant located at the marketplace in Avetonou, a small village situated about 120 km from Lomé, the Togolese capitol. The restaurant has a good location in the marketplace to allow people to eat while they are shopping. The women hope to use this loan to buy five sacks of rice, two drums of oil, and five boxes of canned tomatoes for cooking purposes. This will enable them to increase their restaurant's capacity in order to meet customer needs and thus to make a larger profit to improve the condition of their families.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

K. Adzovi, 43 et A. Ami, 45 sont deux femmes mariées qui ont 7 et 6 enfants respectivement. Elles sont propriétaires d’un petit restaurant situé au marché d’Avetonou, un petit village situé à environ 120 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Le restaurant est bien localisé au marché pour permettre aux gens de manger pendant leurs courses. Elles comptent utiliser ce crédit pour acheter 5 sacs de riz, 2 bidons d’huiles et 5 cartons de tomates en boîtes pour cuisiner. Ce qui leur permettra d’augmenter la capacité de leur restaurant pour répondre aux besoins de la clientèle et par là dégager plus de profits pour et améliorer les conditions de leurs familles.

loans.use: To buy five sacks of rice, 2 drums of oil, and 5 boxes of canned tomatoes

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en: Patrick, a resident of Buyege in Kasanje, is a health worker at Buyege Health Center and has a 4-year-old poultry farm at home. He is 31 years old and married with 4 children, including 2 girls and 2 boys, and he cares for 5 of his other relatives. His wife has a salon in Buyege, and so his family is not doing very badly. He needs a loan to help partly with the expansion of his poultry building and partly with buying more chicks, since the previous loan helped with buying chicken mash and paying school fees for his children. His dream is to have as many as 1000 chickens, since he has enough space for expansion.

loans.use: Patrick intends to expand his poultry building to accommodate the chicks he will buy using this loan.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane, age 40, is a resident of Kamunye in Kasanje. She is married with 7 children, including 2 girls and 5 boys. In addition, she cares for 3 grandchildren and pays their school fees. She has had a poultry farm at her home for 3 years, where she rears 300 chickens. She plans to sell off the old ones because she is in the process of bringing in 300 young chicks, and the loan is to help her buy chicken feed and vaccinations. She is really hard working and focused, and we trust she will achieve her dream of including over 400 broilers on her farm.

loans.use: Jane has planned to buy chicken mash and vaccinations for her chickens, once she gets a loan from Kiva.

loans.name: Luz Del Carmen

texts.en:
Luz Del Carmen operates a reputable mini-market in the Felicita community of Yamasá. Luz defines herself as an experienced businesswoman because she has been running her mini-market for twenty-two years. She confesses that she puts up fight to maintain her three sons and pays their university studies. Luz has been separated from her husband and left with the children. She had to raise her sons on her own, and she is very proud that they all go to the university.

Her loan will be used to buy more products to restock her mini-market. The entrepreneur hopes her business will allow her to maintain a comfortable lifestyle for her children.

loans.use: To acquire many goods to replenish a mini-market.

loans.name: Isabel Salvador

texts.pt:
Isabel Salvador D. was born on August 23rd, 1958, in Boane. She is a single mother of 3 children. She lost her father at a early age but thanks to herself, and her mother's dedication, she was able to graduate from high school and she's been working at the Interior Ministry since 1980. She realized that that position's salary was not enough to support herself and she felt obligated to start a business as a way to increase income and meet daily expenses. She began by selling imported clothes in 1993, and, later on, she was able to set up a store. Two small commercial establishments (tents) were built; her son ran one of them and she ran the other. She became aware of HLUVUKU-ADSEMA in 2006 and in the following year she requested her first loan which was used for business expansion. The loan was repaid in record time and without any difficulties. With the proceeds from the businesses she was able to purchase a vehicle and cover her family's living expenses - not an easy task for a single mother. Her stores have a positive impact in the community because they supply sodas and other basic goods to residents in the Zone 4. With this 25,000.00 MT loan she plans to increase merchandise volume to avoid stock gaps and unnecessary, out-of-town purchasing trips. In the future, she wants to build a home for herself and allow her mother and sisters to occupy the old one.

Translated from Portuguese by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer

Localizaçao : Bairro 4 - Boane Cliente: Isabel Salvador D. Actividade: Comercio Valor de empréstimo: 25.000,00 MT Aplicação do montante:Compra e venda de produtos da 1ª necessidade Inicio: 29/02/2008 Fim: 30/06/2009 Isabel Salvador D., nasceu a 23de Agosto de 1958 em Boane, solteira mãe de 3 filhos. Ficou órfã de pai muito cedo mas com esforço próprio e da sua mãe conseguiu fazer o nível Médio e trabalha no Ministério do Interior desde 1980. Visto que o salário não correspondia com as suas necessidades, viu-se obrigada a abrir um negocio como forma de reforçar a ajuda para as necessidades do dia a dia . Começou por vender roupas estrangeiras em 1993 e mais tarde teve um negocio fixo. Construiu 2 pequenos estabelecimentos comerciais (barracas), uma na gerência do seu filho e outra na sua própria responsabilidade. Soube da existência da Hluvuku-adsema em 2006 e no ano seguinte solicitou o seu 1º empréstimo para ampliação do seu negocio o qual pagou-o em tempo recorde e sem dificuldades. Com os rendimentos do negocio já conseguiu comprar uma viatura e suporta os encargos familiares sendo uma mãe solteira. A sua actividade tem um impacto positivo na comunidade pois fornece refrigerantes aos moradores do bairro 4 e alguns produtos básicos .Com este empréstimo de 25.000,00 MT pretende reforçar o volume de mercadoria de forma a evitar roptura do stock e evitar também viagens regulares a cidade para efectuar compras . Tem como perspectiva construir mais uma casa para poder deixar a casa antiga com a sua mãe e as suas irmãs.

loans.use: To increase stocks in her shop

loans.name: Gwali Mutala Women's Group

texts.en: Macrene, age 54, is the chairperson of Gwali Mutala Women’s Group in Kasanje. She is a farmer growing sweet potatoes and cassava on her family land; and at the same time she buys produce from other farmers, including bananas, Irish potatoes, tomatoes, and green pepper, which she takes to Kibuye farmers’ market every Wednesday for sale. She has been doing this with the help of her husband, who is also a farmer, for the past 20 years; and so far she is not regretting the path she took, especially with the loans she has been getting together with her members for 8 years now. Her dream is to buy a motorcycle to help her with the transportation of her produce from the villages, where she buys most of the produce. She is married with 8 children, the eldest being 35 years old and the youngest being 19. She also helps to look after 4 grandchildren who are still in school.

loans.use: Macrene intends to use the loan to buy more green bananas, Irish potatoes, tomatoes, onions, and green pepper so as to expand her business.

loans.name: Rosalina Francisco

texts.pt:
Rosalina Francisco M. was born in Maputo in 1964. She had to drop out of school after completing the 7th grade due to a asthma condition. She lived with her parents until 1982 when she got married and had one daughter who is now 23 years old. In 1984, she divorced her husband and, along with her daughter, moved in with her parents. A war broke out in 1985 and the Secondary School in Manhica, where she worked as a tailor, had to shut its doors. Two years later, she married her second husband, with whom she had 5 children - the oldest is now 20 years old. She has held a tailor position at the Boane's orphanage since 2001. She found out about HLUVUKU- ADSEMA through co-workers and community leaders from Mahelane. They told her about the services that were available and she decided to request a credit line in the amount of 16,000.00 MT, which would be used to build her home. Plans for the future include taking out a credit line to continue building her home.

Translated from Portuguese by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer

Rosalina Francisco M., Nasceu em Maputo em 1964 e estudou apenas ate a 7ª classe pois a saúde dela não era das boas, pois sofria de asma.through co-workers and community leaders from Mahelane. They told her about the services that were available and she decided to request a credit line in the amount of 16,000.00 MT which would be used to build her home. Viveu sob a responsabilidade dos pais ate 1982 quando contraiu o matrimónio, o qual resultou em uma filha que actualmente tem 23 anos de idade. Em 1984 divorciou se do marido tendo levado com ela a filha para a casa dos pais. Em 1985 trabalhou na Escola secundaria da Manhiça como costureira, mas porque era tempo da guerra fecharam a instituição. Em 1987 juntou com outro marido com o qual teve 5 filhos, sendo a mais velha de 20 anos de idade. Trabalha na Casa de acolhimento de crianças orfãs em Boane, desde 2001 como costureira ate então. Conhece a HLUVUKU- ADSEMA graças aos colegas de trabalho e os lideres da comunidade de Mahelane Que lhes falarão sobre os serviços da mesma e teve a coragem de aproximar e pedir um credito no valor 16.000,00MT para aplicar na continuidade de construcao da sua habitação. A perspectiva futura e ter um credito para aplicar nos acabamentos da sua obra.

loans.use: To buy construction materials to build families house

loans.name: Amy

texts.fr:
Amy N. has a restaurant located near a city taxi garage in Guediawage, where she serves her customers, primarily taxi drivers and their apprentices. She started her business in July 2005 with a loan of 200,000 CFA francs.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Amy N. est une restauratrice installe pres du garage de taxis urbains de guediawage ou elle exerce son activite aupres d'une clientele compose de chauffeurs et d'apprentis. Elle a demarre en juillet 2005 son activite avec un pret de 200000 Fcfa.

loans.use: Restaurant

loans.name: Toribia

texts.en:
Toribia is fifty years old and the proud mother of six children, all of whom are in their twenties. Toribia sells curtains, tablecloths, bedspreads, and the like in the Buenos Aires community of Santo Domingo. The entrepreneur operates her business predominantly within her house, but from time to time she also visits friends and other people in the close-by neighborhood to sell off her goods.

Toribia explains that being a well-established provider of these goods in the community is very challenging, but she expects that her new styles of curtains and bedspreads will help her increase her revenue as well as repay her loan. She wants to keep working hard for the sake of her family.

loans.use: To invest in the purchase of new styles of tablecloths, curtains, bedspreads and the like.

location.town: Buenos Aires community of Santo Domingo

loans.name: Joao Francisco

texts.pt:
Localização: Bairro 7 - Boane Cliente: João Francisco C. Actividade: Habitação Mantante:15.000,00MT Aplicação: Compra de material de construção Inicio: 29/02/2008 Fim: 30/06/2009 Localização: Bairro 7 - Boane Cliente: João Francisco C. Actividade: Habitação Mantante:15.000,00MT Aplicação: Compra de material de construção Inicio: 29/02/2008 Fim: 30/06/2009 João Francisco C. was born in the Province Majacaze, Gaza, in 1978. He is the seventh of 9 siblings. He is attending his second year at the Tutoring University in Maputo. He lived with his parents up until 1999 when he moved in with his brother in Boane for 5 years. In 2000, he started working at the Umpala's Junior High School as a teacher. In that same year he got married and had two children - the eldest is now 7 years old. Currently he works at the Primary School in the district of Boane. He has worked with other credit institutionsin the past, such as Tchurma and Procredito. He stoped working with those companies because he realized that HLUVUKU's services were better, their interest rate was lower and it was located closer to his residence. He found out about HLUVUKU ADSEMA through friends and co-workers. He was awarded a loan in the amount of 12,000.00 MT for housing purposes, which was repaid without any problems. He intends to use the loan amount of 15,000.00 MT to continue the construction project, more specifically to purchase cement and sand to build walls. In the future, he plans to seek more credit so that he can continue to improve his quality of life.

Translated from Portuguese by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer

João Francisco C. nasceu em Majacaze Província de Gaza em 1978. Tem 9 irmãos sendo ele o sétimo filho. Esta a estudar ate então na Universidade Pedagógica em Maputo frequentando o segundo ano de licenciatura. Viveu na responsabilidade dos pais ate 1999 altura em que veio viver com o irmão em Boane durante 5 anos . Em 2000 começou a trabalhar na Escola Primaria de Umpala como professor. No mesmo ano juntou se maritalmente tendo gerado 2 filhos sendo o mais velho com 7 anos de idade. Actualmente trabalha na Escola Primaria na sede do Distrito de Boane. Já trabalhou com algumas instituiçoes de credito como Tchuma e Procredito. Deixou de trabalhar com os mesmos porque viu que os serviços HLUVUKU são melhores e que a taxa de juros é baixa, também porque esta mas próximo da sua residência. Conhece a HLUVUKU ADSEMA graças aos vizinhos e colegas de serviço. Já teve o primeiro credito no valor de 12.000,00 MT para Habitação, tendo reembolsado sem grandes dificuldades. Com emprestimo de 15.000,00MT pretende dar continuidade com os trabalhos da obra, concretamente compra de cimento e areia para rebocos das paredes. A perspectiva futura e ter um credito para dar continuidade com os trabalhos de melhoramento da sua obra.

loans.use: To buy materials to build families house

loans.name: Maty

texts.fr:
Maty M. has a business at the Ndiareme market in Guediawaye, where she sells various products such as empty bottles, beads, traditional medicines, cooking stoves, incense holders, and others.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Maty M. exerce son activite au marche NDIAREME de Guediawaye ou elle vend des produits divers tels des bouteilles vides , des perles , des produits de medecine traditionnelle , des fourneaux et encensoirs...

loans.use: Retail sales

loans.name: Gloria De Fatima

texts.pt:
Gloria da Fátima D. was born in Upper Mulocue district, in the province of Zambézia on May 7, 1955. She is currently in her 12th year at Joaquim Chissano Secondary School, in Boane, where she takes night classes.

Gloria had 5 brothers, but only 2 are alive today. She lived with her parents until the age of 15. She married in 1971 and had 3 children. Her oldest is 38 years old. In 1973 she separated from her first husband and in 1974 she re-married and had 5 more children.

Gloria left Mulocue 1966 to live in Maputo with her parents. In 1976 she worked as a teacher in Massagen in the province of Gaza for 2 years. She was forced to abandon teaching during the war because her life was at risk. From 1984 to 1990 she worked in Mahubu. Since then she has worked at the Primary School and teaches former soldiers in Boane.

Gloria had never applied to a credit institution until now. She got to know Hluvuku-Adsema through some co-workers. With her loan of 10,000.00 MT she intends to buy cement to finish the walls of her house, which has never been completed. Her future goal is to acquire further credit to improve her home.

Translated from Portuguese by Jill Haring, Kiva Volunteer.

Localização: Bairro Antigos Combatentes - Boane Nome: Gloria Da Fátima D. Actividade: Habitação Montante:10.000,00MT Aplicação: Compra de material de construção Inicio: 29/02/2008 Fim: 30/06/2009

Gloria Da Fátima D., Nasceu no distrito de alto Mulocue, Província da Zambézia aos 07/05/1955. Esta a estudar ate então, frequenta actualmente a 12ª classe na Escola Secundaria Joaquim Chissano de Boane no periodo nocturno.

Teve 5 irmãos, mas actualmente so estao vivos apenas 2, pois os outros 3 irmãos faleceram. Viveu soba responsabilidade dos pais ate aos 15 anos. Juntou se maritalmente em 1971 tendo gerado 3 filhos o mas velho tem actualmente 38 anos.

Em 1973 separou se do primeiro marido e de seguida juntou se em 1974 tendo gerado outros 5 filhos. Em 1966 saiu do Alto Mulocue para Maputo na casa dos pais.

Em 1976 Começou a trabalhar em Massagene na Província de Gaza como Professora durante 2 anos. Por causa da Guerra teve que abandonar o sector de serviço porque corria risco de vida.

De 1984 a 1990 trabalhou em Mahubu durante 06 anos. A partir dos meados de 1990 ate então encontra se a trabalhar na Escola Primaria e Completa Antigos Combatentes em Boane.

Nunca trabalhou com instituições de credito e pela 1ª vez que trabalha com instituições desse género . Conhece a HLUVUKU-ADSEMA graças aos colegas de trabalho. Com o emprestimo de 10.000,00MT pretende comprar cimento para rebocos das paredes da casa onde ela reside, mas que ainda nao estava terminada.

A perspectiva futura e ter outro credito para aplicar no melhoramento da sua residencia.

loans.use: To buy construction materials to build family home

loans.name: Azarias

texts.pt:
Azarias O. was born second of 3 brothers in 1961, in the Macia district of Gaza province. He studied until the 9th grade, and lived with his parents until 1984, after which he married and had 2 children. After separating from his first wife, he married again in 1991 and had 4 more children.

Azarias began working at a glassware company, Companhia Vidreira de Moçambique, in 1982 as an electrician, and remained there 21 years. Since 2005 he has worked at BananaLândia, a banana-producing company, also as an electrician.

The first time Azarias applied to a credit institution he requested 10,000.00 MT to build his home. With this loan of 15,000.00 MT, he intends to continue the construction of the house where he and his wife and 4 young children are living. In the future he intends to have more credit to build a protective wall around his yard for more privacy.

Translated from Portuguese by Jill Haring, Kiva volunteer.

Localização: Bairro 03 - Boane Cliente: Azarias O. Actividade: Habitação Aplicação: Compra de material de construção Montante: 15.000,00MT Inicio: 29/02/2008 Fim: 30/06/2009

Azarias O. nasceu no distrito da Macia província de Gaza em 1961. Tem 3 irmãos e ele é o segundo. Estudou ate a 9ª classe. Viveu sob a responsabilidade dos pais ate 1984 altura em que casou-se e do mesmo matrimónio gerou 2 filhos tendo depois separado se da 1ª esposa. Em 1991 Juntou se maritalmente e teve outros 4 filhos.

Começou a trabalhar na companhia vidreira de Moçambique em 1982 como electricista industrial durante 21 anos.

De 2005 ate então trabalha na BananaLândia uma empresa de producao de Banana, também como electricista.

Nunca antes havia trabalhado com uma instituições de credito, mas sim esta e a 1ª com quem ele trabalha, tendo solicitado o primeiro emprestimo no valor de 10.000,00MT para a actividade de construcao da sua moradia.

Com o emprestimo de 15.000,00MT, pretende dar continuidade com os trabalhos da obra na qual ele vive com a esposa e 4 filhos menores.

Futuramente pretende um credito para construir o muro de vedação do seu quintal para maior privacidade familiar.

loans.use: To buy construction materials to build family home

loans.name: John's Group

texts.en: John, age 44, has a retail shop in his home village called Golola in Kiriri town, and it has been operational since 1997. He is married with 7 kids and cares for 1 grandson. This is the second time he is asking for a loan, and he is prompt with repayments. He plans to use the loan to buy bags of sugar, rice, baking flour, Vaseline, dry cells, airtime, cooking oil, and maize flour for his shop. His dream is to see his shop transform from stock of $800 to $2000 in the near future, and he believes he can only achieve this through your support.

loans.use: John plans to use the Kiva loan to buy bags of sugar, rice, baking flour, Vaseline, dry cells, airtime, cooking oil, and maize flour for his shop.

loans.name: Abeli's Juhudi Group

texts.en:
Abeli, age 28, is married with 3 children (ages 5, 4, and 1). He is a very busy man running 3 businesses. He works daily from 10am to 11pm and sells chips, does masonry work, and also runs a pool table business. He started these businesses 2 years ago and makes a total monthly profit of about $170 from his work.

In the past, Abeli took 2 loans from Tujijenge Tanzania to purchase stock for his businesses. He also used the loans to support his wife's business. He now hopes for a new loan to buy another pool table and to also buy more chips. He will share this loan with his subgroup whose members own small general stores.

In the picture, Abeli is second from the left.

loans.use: To buy another pool table and chips

loans.name: Carolina Fernando

texts.pt:
Carolina Fernando Matusse was born on March 17, 1982, in Bela Vista, district of Matutuine, in the province of Maputo. She finished the 7th grade in 1997. Between 1998 and 2000 Carolina completed primary school teacher training in Namaacha. In 2001 she began working as a teacher at Mahubo Primary School #10, and in 2006 she married and had a son.

Carolina and her husband began building their home, but have found it difficult to bring together enough money to finish the job. She heard about Hluvuku-Adsema through friends, and applied for her first loan of 10,000.00 MT to buy construction material. This credit will greatly benefit Carolina’s whole family, will create jobs for the bricklayers that will be contracted, and will generate business for the small local hardware store. Carolina intends to increasingly improve and equip her building project.

Translated from Portuguese by Jill Haring, Kiva volunteer.

Localizaçao :Bairro 7 Fish - Boane Cliente :Carolina Fernando Matusse Actividade :Habitação Valor de empréstimo:10.000,00 MT Aplicação :Compra de Material de construção Inicio: 29/02/2008 Fim: 30/06/2009

Carolina Fernando Matusse, nasceu em Bela-Vista, distrito de Matutuine, Província de Maputo em 17 de Março de 1982, frequentou a escola até 7ªclasse em 1997. Em 1998-2000 teve uma formação de professores primários em Namaacha . Em 2001 começa a trabalhar como professora na Escola Primaria de Mahubo-10 e em 2006 conheceu o seu marido e tiveram um filho.

Junto com o marido iniciaram uma construção da residencia familiar e segundo ela nao tem sido facil reunir recursos financeiros suficientes para terminar a obra. Foi neste contexto que conhece a Hluvuku-Adsema através de amigas e dai aproximou para solicitar o seu primeiro empréstimo no valor de 10.000,00MT para compra de material de construção.

O impacto deste credito vai beneficiar toda a familia e vai criar emprego para os pedreiros que serao contratados para os trabalhos da obra, assim como como para o pequeno comercio de venda de material de construcao. Futuramente pretende ampliar cada vez mais a sua obra e apetrechar.

loans.use: To buy construction materials to build family home

loans.name: Ailina Julia

texts.pt:
Ailina Júlia Parkin was born in the city of Maputo. She is 25 years old, married and mother of a 2 year old girl. She was able to study until the 12th grade. From 1994 to 1995 she worked at Tiger as a sales associate. In 2004, she worked at Petromoc as a cashier for 1 year. Since 2006 she has been working at GALP as a cashier. Ailina’s life has been difficult because of her low salary, but with her husband’s help they have been able to support the family.

She was introduced to HLUVUKU ADSEMA through friends and neighbors. She is requesting a loan of 15.000mt to buy construction material for her home. In the future she plans on requesting another loan to buy furniture and improve the home.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Komatsuzaki Fraga, Kiva Volunteer.

Localização: Bairro 07 - Boane Cliente: Ailina Julia Parkin Actividade: Habitação Valor de empréstimo: 15.000,000 Aplicação: Compra de Material de Construção Inicio: 29/02/2008 Fim: 30/06/2009 Ailina Júlia Parkin Nasceu na Cidade de Maputo a 25 anos, casada e mae de uma filha de dois anos, teve oportunidade de estudar ate a 12ª classe. De 1994-1995 trabalhou na TIGER como promotora de vendas. Em 2004 trabalhou na Petromoc como caixa durante 1 ano. De 2006 ate então trabalha na GALP com a função de caixa e servente. Explica que a vida tem sido muito dificil, devido o nivel salarial que as empresas tem oferecido, mas com ajuda do esposo, ambos tem conseguido superar as dificuldades maiores. Conhece a HLUVUKU ADSEMA graças a conversa com vizinhos e amigos.

Nunca havia trabalhado com instituições de credito e pela 1ª vez solicita um emprestimo de 15.000,000MT cuja aplicaçao sera na compra de materiais diversos para conclusao da residencia familiar. A perspectiva futura e ter outro credito para a compra de bens de apetrechamento da sua residencia.

loans.use: To buy construction materials

loans.name: Rita

texts.pt:
Rita Vasco T. was born in the district of Boane in the province of Maputo in 1971. She was married at 20, and had 3 children. She studied until the 5th grade, but this was a time when women were discriminated against and she was not allowed to continue her education. She started her business in 2002 to help support her family.

Rita was introduced to HLUVUKU through her neighbors. With the loan of 15.000mt she plans on buying more chicks. The income from the business complements her husband’s income in providing for the family. She plans on growing her business from 250 chicks per lot to 500.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Komatsuzaki Fraga, Kiva Volunteer.

Localização: Bairro 07 - Boane Cliente: Rita Vasco T. Actividade: Avicultura – Engorde de Pintos Aplicação: Compra de pintos e Ração Valor de Empréstimo:15.000,00MT Inicio:29/02/2008 Fim: 30/06/2009 Rita Vasco T. Nasceu no Distrito de Boane Província de Maputo em 1971. Casada Maritalmente aos 20 anos de idade e mãe de 3 filhos. Estudou ate a 5ª classe, mas era numa época em que as mulheres eram descriminadas pelos pais, favorecendo mais os homens, dizia-se que o lugar da mulher é na machamba e em casa para cuidar dos filhos. Começou a praticar o negocio em 2002, devido as dificuldades de conseguir ingresso para o sustento da familia. Descobre a HLUVUKU graças as vizinhas e amigas que também são clientes.

Com o emprestimo de 15.000,00MT pretende comprar pintos para engorde com ração, vacinas e vitaminas. A actividade avicola ajuda a proponente a ganhar receitas para ajudar o marido no sustento dos 3 filhos. Tem como perspectiva fazer crescer o seu negocio de 250 para 500 pintos por lote.

loans.use: Chickens Production

loans.name: Alberto

texts.pt:
Alberto Francisco M. is 42 years old. He was born in Boane. He has 4 brothers and studied until the 7th grade. When he was 15 years old he fathered 4 children by different women and the oldest is now 19 years old. In 1986 he married and had 3 additional children, in 1994 he was divorced. In 1996 he married for the 3 rd time and had 2 more children.

Alberto started working when he was 19 years old as a civil ministry employee. He was directed to HLUVUKU ADSEMA by his co-workers. It is the second time he is requesting a loan. The first one was of 11.600mt to expand his business of raising chicken.

He is now requesting a loan of 15.000mt to and add a bedroom for his son in his home. With the income from his business he supports his family. In the future he hopes to be able to improve his home.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Komatsuzaki Fraga, Kiva Volunteer.

Localização: Bairro 3 - Boane Cliente: Alberto Francisco M. Actividade: Habitação Aplicacao:Compra de material de construção Montante: 15.000,00MT Inicio: 29/02/2008 Fim: 30/06/2009 Alberto Francisco M., 42 anos de idade, nasceu em Boane. Tem 4 irmãos todos paternos, estudou ate a 7ª classe, teve de parar cedo porque não reunia condições necessárias para continuar com os seus estudos. Aos 15 anos casou se e gerou 4 filhos de mães diferentes e mas velho conta com 19 anos de idade. Em 1986 casou se com a 2ª esposa donde gerou 3 filhos e em 1994 separou se da mesma pôs havia muito desentendimento no seio da família.

E em 1996 casou se com a 3ª esposa e tem 2 filhos com quem vive ate então. Começou a trabalhar com 19 anos de idade, como funcionário civil do Ministério da Defesa em Boane onde esta a trabalhar ate então. Conhece a HLUVUKU ADSEMA graças a conversas com colegas de serviço. Ė pela 1ª vez que trabalha com uma instituição de credito, mas 2ª vez que solicita emprestimo na HLUVUKU, o seu primeiro credito foi no valor de 11.600,00MT para aplicar na criação de frangos, cujo negocio esta decorrendo num ritmo normal. Com o emprestimo de 15.000,00MT, pretende melhorar a sua residencia, ampliando mais um quarto para os filhos, uma vez que a actual apenas so tem um quarto e as crianças dormem na sala. Com os lucros da actividade avicola vai suportar as despesas do credito e o salario serve para despesas familiares. A sua perspectiva futura e ter um credito para aplicar no apetrechamento da sua residencia.

loans.use: To buy construction materials

loans.name: Yagubov

texts.en: S. Yagubov lives in Beylagan, a small city in southwestern Azerbaijan. He is 23 years old and is single. S. has rented a very small place near the market and has been busy with repair of mobile phones and sales of phone accessories. He has applied to Normicro's Beylagan Branch for a KIVA loan in the amount of $1200. He plans to purchase some equipment which he needs for his shop and to improve the quality of his business.

loans.use: To expand his little phone repair business

loans.name: Graciela

texts.en:
Graciela G. L. runs a general store in a rural suburb near the city of Pucallpa, Ucayali. Graciela sells candy, fruits, vegetables, and sodas. She runs her shop in the afternoon and in the morning teaches at a primary school. Graciela is 32 years old with two children and is happily married. She is happy with her little store because she now has a better relationship with her neighbors, an increased income, and, in turn, greater independence.

A member of the community bank Las Lumbreras, Graciela is requesting a loan of s/1500 to repay over 6 months. She will use the loan to restock her shop with sodas, candy, and snacks. Graciela owns a chicken coop and in the future is considering raising chickens to sell at the local market.

loans.use: To restock a general store

loans.name: Lelis

texts.en:
Lelis P. F. runs a general store near the city of Pucallpa, Ucayali. There she sells goods that are popular with her neighbors and purchased daily. Lelis has a well-placed central location in her neighborhood. Her many loyal clients enjoy purchasing their everyday goods from her instead of traveling a longer distance to the main market.

Lelis is a mother of 3 and is happily married. She is proud of her business. Now Lelis has greater independence and doesn’t need to ask her husband when she wants to buy something for herself or her children. Lelis will continue to save and invest in her store and the children’s future.

A member of the community bank Las Lumbreras, Lelis is requesting a loan of s/1200 to repay over 6 months. She will use the loan to restock her store with rice, sugar, salt, oil, eggs, beer, and sodas.

loans.use: To restock a general store

loans.name: Meti Piedad

texts.en:
Meti Piedad I. S. runs a general store near the city of Pucallpa, Ucayali. From a room she built onto her home, she sells fruit, vegetables, toiletries, and other products to the people of her neighborhood. She has a good location on the corner of a small plaza with many neighbors.

Meti is 26 years old, a mother of two and is happily married. With her little store, she can earn money and take care of her children. Meti is very hard working; she wakes up early in the morning to purchase goods from the main market of Pucallpa and prepare for the day. She dreams of sending her children to university and so she saves carefully daily.

A member of the community bank Las Lumbreras, Meti is requesting a loan of s/1500 to repay in 6 months. With the loan Meti would like to restock her store with rice, milk, sodas, oil, and more.

loans.use: To restock a general store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Invest in provisions for farming

loans.name: Flor De Maria

texts.en:
Flor De Maria F. T. has a general store in a rural suburb of Pucallpa, Ucayali. From the store she built onto her house, she sells fruit, vegetables, candies, sodas, oil, sugar, eggs, and much more. Flor has a good location in a safe neighborhood with little competition.

Flor is 49 years old with 6 children and is happily married. Flor manages her shop and takes care of her family while her husband has a business raising chickens. She is happy to have an income and help provide for her family. Because of the business, she has a better relationship with her neighbors, is better known in the community, and is more independent.

A member of the community bank Las Lumbreras, Flor is requesting a loan of s/1200 (US$ 450) to repay over 6 months. She would like to use the loan to restock her shop and buy cloth to start a business making clothes, bed covers, and pillow covers. She is an excellent seamstress.

loans.use: To restock a general store and start a sewing business

loans.name: Coni

texts.es:
Mrs. Coni L. I. is a member of the group called "Mientras Tanto Mas Que Vencedoras" (In the meantime, more than winners), she lives in her own house located in the Jiron Tupac Amaru Nº 533, del Pueblo Joven 9 de Abril. She sells general goods, candy, and everyday consumables.

The loan of S/. 1000.00, which will be repaid in 4 equal installements, will be used to purchase noodles of different sizes and varieties, canned fish, rice and sugar in big bags, liters of oil, wide variety of sodas, candy and personal hygene products.

She is 24 years old and is very sure of herself and what she wants to accomplish in life. She dreams of owning her own place, increase the size of her business and improve her family's lifestyle.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Peterson, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Coni L. I.,es socia del Grupo Mientras Tanto “Mas que Vencedoras” vive en la Región San Martín , provincia de San Martín ,distrito de Morales,su negocio está ubicado en su propia casa situado en el Jirón Tupac Amaru Nº 533, del Pueblo Joven 9 de Abril, en el vende abarrotes en general, golosinas y otros productos comestibles de consumo diario. El préstamo de S/. 1000.00, el cual será pagado en 4 cuotas, comprará fideos en paquetes de distintas variedades, conservas de pescado en cajas, arroz y azúcar en sacos en sacos, aceite en litros, , además de surtir con gaseosas, golosinas y productos de aseo personal. Ella tiene 24 años se siente muy segura de si misma y de lo que quiere lograr en la vida, es así que sueña con tener su casa propia y en ella implementar un negocio mas grande y asegurar el bienestar de su familia.

loans.use: Items for her store in order to have a wide variety of goods

loans.name: Maria Mercedes

texts.es:
Mrs. Maria Mercedes S. R. is a member of the Community Bank "Los Eucaliptos" located in the district of Tarapoto in San Martín province in the San Martín region. She works preparing and selling food in a specially adapted area of her home, located in the housing development Pueblo Joven 9 de Abril . She tends daily to her clients, many of whom are students of the national university, which is located very close to her home.

Her experience preparing a wide variety of dishes, her talent for seasoning her tasty dishes and her need to generate her own income in order to ensure her only daughter's education motivated her to launch her own business selling lunchtime meals as a daily menu: 2 courses, a beverage and dessert for a set price.

With the loan of 2000 soles(Peruvian currency), which will be repaid in 4 months, she will invest in the purchase of chairs, tables, tablecloths and a variety of cooking utensils. This purchase will allow her to offer more comforts and better service to her clients. She will also buy nonperishable ingredients for the preparation of her dishes.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Maria Mercedes S. R., es socia del Banco Comunal ”Los Eucaliptos” ubicado en el distrito de Tarapoto, provincia de San Martín, departamento de San Martín, se dedica a la preparación y venta de comida, en un ambiente acondicionado especialmente en su propia casa, ubicada en el Pueblo Joven 9 de Abril, atendiendo diariamente a alumnos de la Universidad nacional ya que su local se ubica cerca de esta institución educativa. Su experiencia en la preparación de diversos platos de comida, su buena sazón y la necesidad de tener un ingreso propio para asegurar la educación de su única hija la impulsaron a poner su propio negocio de venta de comida diaria tipo menú.

Con el préstamo de S/. 2,000.00,el cual será pagado en 4 meses lo invertirá en la compra de sillas, mesas, manteles y diversos utensilios de cocina para así dar una mejor comodidad y atención a sus comensales. asimismo comprara insumos no perecibles, para la elaboración de los platos de comida.

Maria Mercedes es una mujer muy amorosa y decidida, tiene 36 años y una hija, vive con su actual pareja y sueña con tener un Restaurante.

loans.use: She will use the loan to buy products for her business.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es:
Mrs. Nelly C. P. is a member of the Community Bank "Los Eucaliptos". She lives in the San Martín region, in the province of San Martín and the district of Morales. Her business is located in her own home in the housing development Pueblo Joven "9 de Abril". She has been working for 20 years selling perfume and cosmetics of many brands including Esika, Avon and Unique. She sells her products on order and by catalog. Her most important clients are the workers in public and private institutions.

With this loan of 1200 soles (Peruvian currency), which she will repay in 4 months, she will buy a variety of articles such as perfumes, creams, shampoos, make-up, deoderant and other products of brands that offer discounted prices during this season of the year. With this purchase her business will be well-stocked with a wider range of products and she will be able to satisfy her clients.

She is 40 years old and lives with her husband and 2 sons. She dreams of seeing her sons grow into professionals. That dream motivates her to work every day with a lot of perseverance. She hopes to have a grocery business in the future.

Translated by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Nelly C. P., es socia del banco comunal “Los Eucaliptos” vive en el departamento de San Martín, provincia de San Martín, distrito de Morales , su negocio esta ubicado en su propia casa del Pueblo Joven 9 de abril, se dedica hace 22 años a la venta de artículos de perfumería y cosméticos de diferentes marcas como Esika, Avon, Unique, que lo vende a través de pedidos y por catalogo,siendo sus principales clientes los trabajadores de instituciones públicas y privadas.

Con el crédito de S/. 1,200.00, el cual pagara en 4 meses, comprará diversos artículos como perfumes, cremas, champús, jabones, maquillajes, desodorante y otros productos mas, de estas marcas que salen en ofertas en esta temporada para tener en stock y variar sus productos para así satisfacer los gustos de sus clientes.

Tiene 40 años vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos a quienes desea verlos profesionales, razón por el que día a día trabaja con mucha perseverancia, anhelando mas adelante tener un negocio de venta de abarrotes.

loans.use: She will use the loan to buy products for her business.

loans.name: Malena Magdalena

texts.es:
Mrs. Malena Magdalena Sánchez D. Córdova is a member of the Community Bank "Los Eucaliptos". She lives in the San Martín region, in the province of San Martín and the district of Tarapoto, in the housing development "10 D. Agosto". Her shoe repair shop is located in a kiosk on one of the principal streets of the city, where together with her husband she makes and repairs men's, women's and children's shoes, slippers and sandals.

With this loan of 800 soles (Peruvian currency), which will be repaid in 4 months, she will buy the materials she uses to make and repair shoes, including leather by the meter, shoe inserts, soles for shoes, thread, glue, dyes for shoes, clasps, buckles and other materials. The purchase will allow her to satisfy her clients' orders.

Malena is 49 years old. She lives with her husband and her two youngest children. Because she wants her children to have a better future, she works every day with a lot of enthusiasm. She hopes to one day own a shoe store.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Malena Magdalena Sánchez D. Córdova es socia del Banco Comunal “Los Eucaliptos” vive en el departamento D. San Martín, provincia D. San Martín, distrito D. Tarapoto, Asentamiento Humano 10 D. Agosto, su Renovadora D. Calzados se ubica en su kiosco ubicado en una D. las principales calles D. la ciudad, donD. junto a su esposo se dedican a la confección y arreglo D. zapatos, zapatillas, sandalias D. damas, caballeros y niños.

Con el crédito D. S/. 800.00 el cual será pagado en 4 meses , comprará materiales para la confección y arreglo D. zapatos como: cuero por metros, plantillas, suelas, hilos, pegamento, tintes para zapatos, broches, hebillas entre otros materiales, y así satisfacer los pedidos D. su clientes.

Malena tiene 49 años, vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos menores, para quienes quiere un futuro mejor por lo que trabaja día a día con mucho entusiasmo, esperando en el futuro tener una zapatería.

loans.use: She will use the loan to buy thread, soles, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Reydelinda

texts.es:
Mrs. Reydelinda C. C. is a member of the Community Bank “Santa Rosa de Lima”. She lives in the San Martín region, in the province of Mariscal Cáceres and the district of Juanjui. Her business is located in the street Alfonso Ugarte in a stall in the Las Brisas de Huallaga market. She sells fruit grown locally, which is purchased daily by the city's inhabitants.

Thanks to the support of her husband and daughters, and to her own effort , she has succeeded in growing her business and has won a warm welcome and the esteem of a large clientele.

With this loan of 2000 solos (Peruvian currency) which will be repaid in 6 months, she will buy diverse fruits from the region such as oranges, bunches of bananas and guineos (fruit similar to bananas), sacks of fresh and dried coconut, crates of papaya and large quantities of exotic local fruits such as taperuvas, coconas and shica shica in order to stock her market stall and satisfy her clients’ demands.

Miriam is 60 years old. She works daily, showing herself to be an enterprising woman for whom, when it comes to meeting her goals, there are no limits. She rises to the occasion to meet her goals with effort and dedication. She is making plans to one day have her own grocery store.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Reydelinda C. C. pertenece al Banco Comunal “Santa Rosa de Lima,” vive en la región San Martín, provincia de Mariscal Cáceres, distrito de Juanjui, su negocio está ubicado en el Jr. Alfonso Ugarte, en un puesto del mercado “Las Brisas del Huallaga”, se dedica a la venta de frutas propias de la zona, que diariamente es comprado por los moradores de la ciudad.

Gracias al apoyo de su esposo y sus hijas y al esfuerzo propio ha logrado incrementar su negocio, habiendo ganado el aprecio y la acogida de una gran clientela.

Con el crédito de S/.2,000.00,el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprará diversas frutas de la región como: naranjas, taperivas, coconas en cientos, shica shica en kilos, plátanos y guineos en racimos, cocos fresco y seco en sacos , papayas en jabas para así tener abastecido su puesto y satisfacer la exigencia de sus clientes.

La señora Miriam tiene 60 años, trabaja diariamente demostrando de esa manera, que es una mujer emprendedora y que para cumplir sus metas, no hay límites y se pueden alcanzar con esfuerzo y dedicación, es así que en el futuro piensa tener una tienda de abarrotes.

loans.use: She will use the loan to buy more fruit to sell.

loans.name: Adela

texts.es:
Mrs. Adela V. L. is a member of the Community Bank “Sarita Colonia”. She lives in the San Martín region, in the province of Mariscal Cáceres and the district of Juanjui. She sells groceries, vegetables, candy, sewing notions and accessories and soft drinks in a store located in her home, where the neighbourhood's inhabitants do their daily shopping.

She decided to start her business with the support of her husband. She wanted to generate her own income and raise the family's economic level so that her children would be able to stay in school.

With this loan of 1500 soles (Peruvian currency) , which will be repaid in 4 months, she will buy convenience products such as sacks of rice, sugar, boxes of milk, oil, canned food, packages of noodles, detergents and toilet paper among other items, in order to sell them wholesale and retail to her clients.

She is 52 years old with 3 children who still depend on her. They support her in the house and in the business. Her goal for the future is to increase her sales and launch a second business: wholesale soft drink sales.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

La Señora Adela V. L. es socia del Banco Comunal “Sarita Colonia”, vive en la región San Martín, provincia de Mariscal Cáceres, distrito de Juanjui, se dedica a la venta de abarrotes, verduras, pasamanería, golosinas y bebidas gaseosas, ubicado en su propia casa del Jr. La Merced cuadra 5. donde acuden diariamente a comprar los moradores del barrio.

Decidió iniciar su negocio con el apoyo de su esposo con la finalidad de manejar sus propios ingresos y aumentar su nivel económico, para poder ayudar a sus hijos para que sigan estudiando.

Con el préstamo de S/. 1500.00, el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprara productos de primera necesidad como sacos de arroz, azúcar, cajas de leche, aceite, conservas, paquetes de fideos, detergentes y papel higiénico entre otros, para poder venderlos al por mayor y menor a sus clientes.

Tiene 52 años y 3 hijos que todavía dependen de ella quienes la apoyan en la casa y en el negocio, su meta en el futuro es ampliar sus ventas y poner otro negocio de bebidas gaseosas al por mayor.

loans.use: She'll use the loan to buy more products for her business.

loans.name: Elia Rosa

texts.es:
Elia Rosa Dávila R., a member of the communal bank “Tesoro Escondido” (Hidden Treasure), makes and sells clothing and she also sells perfumes and sewing notions. Her business is situated in her home, which is located in Juanjui district, Mariscal Cáceres province, San Martín department.

She began working as an assistant in a sewing shop and later, with her own savings and with a loan from the communal bank, she opened her own sewing shop. Little by little, she has been buying sewing machines and a seam finisher. She now has a good clientele.

With a loan of S/. 1300.00, which she will pay back in 6 months, she will buy various fabrics by the meter (for making women’s, men’s, and children’s clothing), decorative items by the dozen (buttons and laces in various colors) for the finishing details for the clothing, and threads in various colors. She will also stock her line of perfumes and cosmetics.

She is 42 years old and is a single mother with one child. She is content because she is able to do a job that she has always liked.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra. Elia Rosa Dávila R., socia del Banco Comunal “Tesoro Escondido” se dedica a la confección y venta de prendas de vestir, también vende perfumes y mercería, su negocio está instalado en su propio domicilio ubicado en el Jr. Leticia cdra 9 del distrito de Juanjui, provincia de Mariscal Cáceres y departamento de San Martín. Se inicio trabajando como ayudante en un taller de costura, luego por iniciativa propia ahorrando su dinero y con el préstamo del Banco Comunal puso su taller de costura que poco a poso lo fue implementando con maquinas de coser y con una remalladora, actualmente tiene una buena clientela. Con el préstamo de S/. 1300.00 el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprará telas diversas en metros para la confección de prendas de vestir para damas, caballeros y niños, artículos de pasamanería en docenas (botones, blondas, en variadas formas y colores) para el acabado de sus confecciones, e hilos en variados colores, también implementar su línea de perfumería y cosméticos. Tiene 42 años, es madre soltera de un niño se siente una mujer realizada y contenta, por realizar una actividad que siempre le ha gustado

loans.use: To buy fabrics for her business

loans.name: El Rosario Nahuala Group

texts.es:
Ten minutes before the ”Rosario Nahuala” embroidery group begins, one can see groups of women, in typical dress, running through the streets of Nahuala shouting the names of their friends in the native Quiche language. What is happening is that the members of the group are looking for their friends who are not present in the Friendship Bridge office for the payment. Until all the clients of the communal bank are present, the loan cannot be repaid. For many of the clients, the repayment of the loan is one of the most important events of the month.

The meeting begins five minutes late, but with all members of the group in the office. Many are a little anxious but happy to receive their first loan. Others reflect the shyness typical of new clients. This shyness will fade away in time, as the group consolidates and they all receive training about self-esteem and women’s rights, among other themes of interest.

All the clients work in the textile industry. The majority work in traditional fabrics. Meanwhile others embroider flowers and birds in the typical blouses of the region. Finally, the rest of the group buys and sells clothes and traditional dress. They are going to use the loan to buy the thread and clothes of their respective resale.

It is believed that once the clients start to receive a loan their opportunities and dreams will begin to flourish. The women would like to learn about administration of their business. By luck, Friendship Bridge offers training in the themes in which the clients have interest. This basic training helps the women very much, especially those who are new to microfinance.

Surprisingly, the common dream among everyone is that their respective business can grow so that they can support and send their children to school. It is in our hands to support these women with their noble goals. Few people spend so much effort for the benefit of others. It is an admirable characteristic that people worldwide should imitate, and with our help these women can realize their dreams.

Translated from Spanish by Katrina H, Kiva volunteer.

Diez minutos antes de empezar la reunión de desembolso del grupo “el Rosario Nahuala” uno podía ver grupos de señoras, en sus trajes típicos, corriendo por las calles de Nahuala gritando los nombres de sus compañeras en el idioma Quiché. Lo que pasaba era que las integrantes del grupo estaban buscando a sus compañeras que no estaban presentes en la oficina de Friendship Bridge para el desembolso, y hasta que no estén todas las clientas del banco comunal el préstamo no se puede desembolsar. Para muchas de las clientas el desembolso del préstamo es uno de los acontecimientos más importantes del mes.

La reunión empezó cinco minutos tarde, pero ya con todas las integrantes del grupo en la oficina. Muchas de ellas estaban un poco ansiosas pero felices por ¡recibir su primer préstamo! Otras, reflejaban aquella timidez típica de clientes nuevas. Esa timidez se va borrando a través del tiempo conforme el grupo se vaya consolidando y ellas vayan a recibiendo capacitaciones sobre autoestima y derechos de la mujer entre otros temas de su interés.

Todas las clientas trabajan en la industria textil. La mayoría trabaja en tejidos tradicionales. Mientras que otras bordan flores y aves en las blusas típicas de la región. Finalmente, el resto del grupo compra y vende ropa y trajes tradicionales. Ellas van a utilizar su préstamo para la compra de hilo y ropa para su respectiva reventa.

Se cree que una vez las clientas empiezan a recibir préstamos sus horizontes y sueños empiezan a agrandarse. A las señoras les gustaría aprender más sobre administración de sus negocios y medicinas. Por suerte, Friendship Bridge ofrece capacitaciones en los temas que las clientas están interesadas. Este tipo de capacitaciones básica ayuda mucho a las mujeres, especialmente a las que recién empiezan en las microfinanzas.

Sorprendentemente, el sueño común de todas es que su respectivo negocio pueda crecer para que así puedan alimentar y mandar a sus hijos al colegio. Está en nuestras manos apoyar a estas señoras con sus nobles metas. Pocas personas avocan todos sus esfuerzos para el beneficios de otros. Esto es una característica intachable de la cual muchas personas en el mundo deberían de imitar y solo con su apoyo estas señoras van a poder cumplir sus sueños.

loans.use:
Purchase of thread for embroidery of typical blouses

Compra de hilo para bordados en blusas típicas

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: TO PURCHASE MATERIALS NEEDED FOR A SUCCESSFUL HARVEST

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: TO PURCHASE MERCHANDISE TO STOCK HIS SMALL GENERAL STORE, ESPECIALLY SUPPLIES TO GET READY FOR THE UPCOMING SCHOOL SEASON.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: TO INVEST IN MATERIALS NEEDED TO HAVE A SUCCESSFUL HARVEST

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: TO STOCK HER GENERAL STORE AND CONTINUE TO GROW HER BUSINESS.

loans.name: Mujeres Rukux Ulew Group

texts.en:
The Rukux Ulew trust bank is composed of 14 women, most of them mothers with young children. They all live in Aldea Saquitacaj, which is an isolated rural village deep in the department of Chimaltenango. Impressively, the majority can read and write. Together, they are more than just a “Banco Comunal,” but a tightly knit social group. They chat freely in both Spanish and their native tongue, Kaq’ichel. Hope for a better tomorrow is a common theme. It has united them.

Today is a day of excitement for this group of clients because they are going to receive their first loan at Friendship Bridge. Finally, the women of Rukux Ulew are going to have a chance to expand their business and, at least, attempt to have a sustainable source of income.

Almost all of the women have sustained themselves by raising animals and tending crops. These ladies believe that their 1350 Quetzales loan (an average of US $178), can launch them into the more lucrative business of Guatemalan weaving.

The loan would be used to buy fabric for their weaving. The women plan to do all the weaving themselves, and the finished fabrics would be sold in the nearby market in San Jose Poaquil.

It is impressive how most of these women have more than one business. Portfolio diversification is a strategy they are currently managing. This shows that, even though these women live in a remote area, they have managed to learn updated and sophisticated managerial skills.

These women hope that their future investment will increase their daily income and will help them achieve a better future, a future in which education for their kids is not just a dream, but a possibility.

loans.use: To buy thread and fabric to weave traditional Guatemalan blouses

loans.name: Joyas 1 Group

texts.es:
Cristina is 29 years old and has 2 children. She contibutes to the household expenses with the money she earns making typical skirts and blouses. They are sold at handicrafts stores in the city of San Cristobal. She hopes that her loan will increase her production and have a better distribution of money between the contribution to the household expenses and buying raw material (threads, fabrics, and dyes). The other group members are: Gloria M. P. and Pascuala S. S. who are artisans, Maria M. T. who raises chickens, and Juana P. M. who raises sheep to sell the wool.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Ramirez-Gregg, Kiva Volunteer

CRISTINA TIENE 29 AÑOS DE EDAD, 2 HIJOS ES UNA MUJER QUE CONTRIBUYE CON EL GASTO FAMILIAR CON EL DINERO QUE OBTIENE DE LA CONFECCION DE BLUSAS Y FALDAS TIPICAS LAS CUALES SON VENDIDAS EN LA CIUDAD DE SANCRISTOBAL CON LAS PERSONAS QUE TIENEN TIENDAS DE ARTESANIAS, ESPERA SU CREDITO PARA INCREMENTAR SU PRODUCCION Y CONTAR CON UNA MEJOR DISTRIBUCION DEL DINERO ENTRE LA APORTACION ECONOMICA FAMILIAR Y LA COMPRA DE SU MATERIA PRIMA (HILOS, TELAS, TINTAS), LAS OTRAS INTEGRANTES DEL GRUPO SON: GLORIA M. PÉREZ, PASCUALA S. S. SON ARTESANAS, MARIA M. T. CRIA POLLOS Y JUANA PÉREZ M. CRIA BORREGOS PARA VENDER LANA.

loans.use: Buying raw materials (Fabrics and threads)

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.es:
Eduardo is a 29 year old entrepreneurial man who got married at a very young age and had to shorten his education. With the educational level that he had he was not able to find good work that would compensate him with an adequate salary to cover necessities. It was at this time that he received an opportunity and began to work in a veterinary clinic. Thanks to his discipline, he learned the skill of cutting the hair of different breeds of dogs. He decided later to quit this job and start his own business. With effort he was able to buy the tools needed for his business.

As a result of good customer service and a low price for his quality service, he was able to increase his list of clients. Now he has included the sale of fish to his canine grooming business.

He needs a loan of US$475 that he will pay back over the course of 6 months. With this loan he will acquire a large batch of fish in order to reduce the cost, and will better supply the store with dog accessories. Let's support Eduardo so that he can reach his goal.

Translated from Spanish by Katrina, Kiva volunteer.

El Sr. Eduardo es un hombre emprendedor de 29 años, se caso muy joven y tuvo que truncar sus estudios, con el nivel que tenía no encontraba un buen trabajo que le otorgara un sueldo que pudiera cubrir sus necesidades, fue entonces que recibió una oportunidad y empezó a trabajar en una veterinaria gracias a su disciplina aprendió el oficio de cortes de cabello de las diferentes razas de mascotas, hasta que decidió renunciar y poner su propio negocio, con esfuerzo logro comprar las herramientas y utensilios necesarios para su negocio. Debido al buen trato a sus clientes y un precio bajo por un servicio de calidad, fue que logro aumentar su cartera de clientes, ahora ha incluido en la estética canina la venta de peces,

Actualmente necesita un crédito por US $475 que pagara en 6 meses para adquirir un lote grande de peces para disminuir el costo, además de surtir mejor la tienda con accesorios para mascotas. Apoyemos a Eduardo para que alcance su meta.

loans.use:
Buy merchandise

Comprar mercancia

loans.name: Joyas 3 Group

texts.es:
Rosa is 26 years and she works in making regional typical clothes. She makes skirts and blouses and dedicates a lot of time to them. She doesn't makes them but she also embroiders them by hand. This merchandise is sold with and by other women of her own area. With the small amount of money that she obtains from her sales, she is able to sustain her 2 children. Her husband works out on the countryside and what they harvest is for their own consumption. With the loan that he is applying for, Rosa will like to get more fabrics and threads to manufacture more clothes. The other group members are: Juana R. Nuñez, Cornelia R. Nuñez and Micaela H. H. all of them artisans.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Ramirez-Gregg, Kiva Volunteer

ROSA TIENE 26 AÑOS, SE DEDICA A CONFECCIONAR ROPA TIPICA DE LA REGION, ELABORA FALDAS Y BLUSAS A LAS CUALES LES DEDICA MUCHO TIEMPO YA QUE TAMBIEN LAS BORDA, ESTA MERCANCIA ES VENDIDA CON MUJERES DE SU MISMA LOCALIDAD , CON EL POCO DINERO QUE OPTIENE DE ESTO MANTIENE A SUS 2 HIJOS, YA QUE SU ESPOSO SE DEDICA A TRABAJAR EL CAMPO Y LO QUE COSECHAN ES PARA COMER, CON EL CREDITO LE GUSTARIA ADQUIRIR MAS TELA E HILOS PARA CONFECCIONAR MAS ROPA. LAS OTRAS INTEGRANTES DEL GRUPO SON: JUANA R. N., CORNELIA R. N. Y MICAELA H. H. SON ARTESANAS.

loans.use: Buying fabrics, threads, and dyes.

loans.name: Joyas 2 Group

texts.es:
Sra. Juana Nunez L. is 33 years old. She makes and embroiders typical blouses and helps her husband with his tailoring business. They design and make men's pants. With this income, they are able to sustain their 2 children. They will like to get a sewing machine with the loan that they are soliciting. The other group members are: Sra. Micaela C. C., who raises and sells chicken, Sra. Sebastiana C. C., who raises sheep to sell the wool,and Sra. Andrea L. Nuñez and Sra. Manuela Perz C. who are artisans.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Ramirez-Gregg, Kiva Volunteer

JUANA TIENE 33 AÑOS, SE DEDICA A ELABORAR BLUSAS TIPICAS Y AYUDA A SU ESPOSO EN EL OFICIO DE LA SASTRERIA, CONFECCIONAN PANTALONES PARA CABALLERO, CON ESTE INGRESO MANTIENEN A SUS 2 HIJOS, CON EL CREDITO LE GUSTARIA ADQUIRIR UNA MAQUINA DE COSER, LAS OTRAS INTEGRANTES DEL GRUPO SON MICAELA C. C., CRIA Y VENDE POLLOS, SEBASTIANA C. C., CRIA BORREGOS PARA COMERCIALIZAR LA LANA, ANDREA L. N. Y MANUELA PÉREZ C. SON ARTESANAS.

loans.use: Buying a sewing machine.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: TO PURCHASE MATERIALS NEEDED FOR A SUCCESSFUL HARVEST, AS WELL AS STOCK FOR HIS SMALL GENERAL STORE.

loans.name: Semperillo 3 Group

texts.es:
Sra. Martha, the leader of the group, is 22 years old. Since she was only 7 years old, she has worked on making typical blouses. She dedicates a lot of time and care on the process because she embroiders the collar and the sleeves with typical designs of the Larrainzar region. With her loan, she wants to buy fabrics and lots of threads to continue doing the embroidery and be able to sustain her 3 children.

The other members of the group are: Sra. Apolonia P. H., Sra. Petrona H. H. and Sra. Maria Elena P. H.. All of them are dedicated artisans

Translated from Spanish by Maria Ramirez-Gregg, Kiva Volunteer

DOÑA MARTHA DE 22 AÑOS DE EDAD, DESDE QUE TENIA 7 AÑOS DE EDAD SE DEDICA A CONFECCIONAR BLUSAS TIPICAS A LAS CUALES LES DEDICA MUCHO TIEMPO YA QUE LAS BORDA DEL CUELLO Y MANGAS CON BORDADOS TIPICOS DE LA REGION (LARRAINZAR), CON SU PRESTAMO QUIERE COMPRAR TELA Y MUCHO HILO PARA SEGUIR REALIZANDO LOS BORDADOS Y PODER SEGUIR MANTENIENDO A SUS 3 HIJOS, LAS OTRAS INTEGRANTES DEL GRUPO SON. APOLONIA PÉREZ H., PETRONA H. H. Y MARIA ELENA PÉREZ H. SON ARTESANAS.

loans.use: Buying threads, fabrics, and dyes for embroidery.

loans.name: Ana Luisa

texts.en:
Mrs. Ramirez lives in the Liberty and for eight years she has dedicated herself to the making and sale of tortillas. She lives in a house she owns and has used the financing of other institutions to invest in corn, which is the main ingredient she uses. This business helps her and her four kids to be able to get ahead. Her life partner also helps out with the bills and supports her and her business. This financial assistance will help her to buy more raw materials for her business. This will be her first loan with this institution, but her credit history is very good. Her objective is to continue generating income and to help her family by providing what is necessary.

Translated from Spanish by James Lombardo, Kiva volunteer

La Sra. Ramirez, vive en la Libertad durante ocho años se a dedicado a la elaboración y venta D. tortillas, vive en casa propia y los financiamientos que a ido teniendo con otras instituciones los a ido invirtiendo en compra D. maíz, que es la materia prima , este negocio le a ayudado a poder sacar adelante a sus hijos que son cuatro actualmente su compañero D. vida aporta una ayuda al grupo familiar pero se era necesario el poder conseguir un ingreso extra para mantener a la familia D. ahí que ella decidió el poder emprender este negocio , los financiamientos le ayudaron a poder ir comprando ganado comenzaron con uno hasta la fecha tienen tres que están en periodo D. pasto y que muy pronto los venderán para obtener su ganancia y seguir e la cría D. los mismos . Este seria su primer crédito con la institución pero su récord crediticio con las demás instituciones es muy bueno, su objetivo es seguir generando ingresos y ayudar a su grupo familiar y proporcionarle lo necesario a sus hijos.

loans.use: Purchase of corn and fire wood which are the principle materials for her business.

loans.name: Victoria Guadalupe

texts.es:
Victoria is a young woman who has enjoyed sales since she was a girl. She has met many people through her business, traveling to the interior of the state and visiting other churches to practice her religion. This is how she started her small business selling religious goods she brought to each place. Now she is a distributor and her business has improved, since she supplies other retailers in the interior of the Yucatan. As a result, she needs a place to display her products and to sell to the general public. Since she does not have sufficient capital to rent a place, her mother is supporting her by allowing her to set up a presence in her own home but she needs to make adaptations to the front of the house for this purpose.

She needs a loan of US $950 over the course of 6 months in order to realize her dream of having a place where she can sell her products to the general public. Through this business she will be able to help her mother with the common household expenses. With your contribution, Vicky will be able to realize her goals.

Translated from Spanish by Katrina H, Kiva volunteer.

Victoria, es una mujer joven que desde niña le ha gustado las ventas, y ha logrado conocer mucha gente a través de ellas, desde la religión que profesa viaja al interior del estado y visita otras iglesias, fue así como inicio hace 2 años su pequeño negocio vendiendo material religioso llevando a cada lugar sus productos. Ahora ha es distribuidora y sus ventas han mejorado, ya que surte hacia el interior de Yucatán a otros vendedores, por esto requiere de un local amplio para exhibir su material y que sea para venta al publico en general, como no cuenta con el capital suficiente para rentar uno, su madre la esta apoyando permitiéndole instalarse en su propia casa para ello necesita realizar adecuaciones al frente de la misma.

Ella necesita un crédito de US $950 que pagara en 6 meses para ver logrado su sueño de tener un local donde vender sus productos al público en general y así poder ayudar a su mama con los gastos familiares. Con tus contribuciones Vicky podrá realizar sus metas.

loans.use:
Remodel premises

remodelar local

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Invest in cell phone cards and improve his sales carts

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy shellfish wholesale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Fix up one of his business locations

loans.name: Rosa Edy
