texts.en:
Her business is located at the outsides of a school where the majority of her clients are children. The business is family run, and all of her siblings take part in commercial activities. They inherited it from their mother. The business was started with ten dollars, and that has been multiplying to this day. Her family is comprised of two people, her daughter and her husband. Her daughter is in grade school, which makes it hard for her to help her family financially. Her husband helps with food expenses, but not for education and other family expenses. The endorsement of Mrs. Echerria would help her greatly by allowing her to be able to get ahead, especially in ways which the employment of her husband has lacked. What she is looking for in this financing is the ability to sell a broader range of products to her clients.

Translated from Spanish by James Lombardo, Kiva volunteer

Su negocio esta ubicado alas afueras de una escuela por lo que en su mayoría sus clientes son los niños que vienen a la misma, el negocio es algo de familia ya que todos sus hermanos se han dedicado a actividades de comercio, y pues fue su madre de quien lo heredaron , su negocio lo inicio con diez dolares lo cual a multiplicado hasta la fecha , su grupo familiar lo componen dos personas una hija y su compañero de vida, su hija actualmente se encuentra en etapa escolar lo cual le dificulta el poder tener un empleo y a la misma vez el poder dar la atención necesaria , no asi en el caso del negocio, su compañero da un aporte lo cual ayuda para la alimentación pero no para educación y otros gastos del grupo familiar , el aporte de la señora Echerria le a ayudado en gran manera para poder salir adelante incluso en periodos en los cuales el empleo de su esposo a faltado, lo que busca con su financiamiento es el poder surtir mas con artículos que buscan los niños que son sus clientes.

loans.use: Buy candies and cloths that are the most distributed products in the region.

payments.comment: Rosa was able to pay back her loan early. Thank you for your support!

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Increase her production in order to be able to sell more wholesale lunches.

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.en:
Mrs. E. has had her store near where she lives, and thanks to that she is able to give more attention to her kids and to provide an income for her family. She has had the business for more than ten years which has benefited her and her children. Her husband works in agriculture and he contributes with a small income, this is why she assumes the great responsibility of the familiar expenses with respect to food and clothing. Her credit history is very good and it is very evident that her store is doing well. Mrs. E. is business savvy, because aside from attending to store, in the afternoons she makes traditional food and sells it around the same area where her store is located. She understands and recognizes that a loan is needed in order for her to have the products that her clients request.

Translated from Spanish by James Lombardo, Kiva volunteer

La Sra. E. tiene una tienda en su vivienda de habitación esto a raíz de poder dar mas atención a sus hijos y poder proporcionar un ingreso a su familia el negocio lo a tenido ya por mas de 10 años lo cual le a beneficiado ya que a podido sacar adelante a dos hijos y le sigue proporcionando lo necesario para ayudar a otros dos que están actualmente en la etapa escolar, Su compañero de vida trabaja en la agricultura aporta un ingreso mínimo a la vivienda por lo cual ella asume la mayor responsabilidad de los gastos familiares con respecto a alimentación y vestuario que son muy necesarios . Su historial con los créditos es muy bueno y la mejoría en su negocio es muy evidente, es muy emprendedora ya que aparte de el negocio de la tienda por las tardes hace comida típica la cual la distribuye en el mismo sector, la señora reconoce que los financiamientos han sido muy necesarios para poder surtir con los productos que sus clientes demandan.

loans.use: Purchase of raw materials needed from corn, rice, and products sold in the store like milk, oil, and others

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Mrs. C. decided to start her business because of the support she received from this micro business. It helped her to be able to make the decision to start with a loan of three hundred dollars, which has multiplied to this day. This has helped her to have a solid base over the administration of the business. She has been running for 6 years in the same place and this helps her to be a able to proviD. her son with an education, and her other with his bachelor degree. Her efforts go towards giving them a better life. The solicitation of funds with go towards helping her business and will continue to contribute the its growth. We hope she will receive what is necessary to keep surviving

Translated from Spanish by James Lombardo, Kiva volunteer

La Sra C. decidió iniciar su negocio a raíz D. unas capacitaciones que recibió D. microempresa esto le ayudo a poder tomar la decicion D. emprender el negocio inicio con un capital D. trecientos dolares los cuales a multiplicado hasta la fecha las capacitaciones le ayudaron a tener una base solida sobre la administración del negocio y como atender al cliente, su negocio tiene seis años D. tenerlo en el mismo lugar esto le a ayudado para poder darle el estudio universitario a un hijo y poder ayudar a su otro hijo a que se supere actualmente esta cursando un bachillerato,sus esfuerzos van encaminados a darle una vida mejor a ellos. La solicitante reconoce que los financiamientos le ayudaron en sus inicios y siguen contribuyendo a que su negocio crezca y que le D. lo necesario para seguir sobreviviendo.

loans.use: She will invest in corn since they are in season and cheap.  This is done to be able to have the product in times when it is not readily available.

loans.name: Mercedes Lilian

texts.en:
She lives in the The Liberty with her family that is composed of four people who depend on her financially. She is dedicated to the making of typical food such as tamales (stuffed corn breads), and others that she distributes to her neighbors and plant workers. It is near her home and has been running for five years. Her clients know the restaurant and search it out. The income she earns from this works provides her children with an education and helps to get more products to prepare and sell. This is her first loan with the institution, and it will help her to be able to buy materials to diversify the range of products she offers her clients. Investments like this have helped her in the past and will give her what is necessary to help her continue.

Translated from Spanish by James Lombardo, Kiva volunteer

Actualmente vive en La libertad su grupo familiar lo componen cuatro personas que dependen económicamente de la solicitante, la señora se dedica a la elaboración de comida típica tales como tamales pasteles y otros que distribuye con vecinos y trabajadores de una planta asfáltica que esta pegado a su vivienda tiene aproximadamente cinco años de dedicarse al negocio, su clientes ya la conocen y la buscan, el negocio le a aportado los ingresos necesarios para poder dar educación a sus hijas que son dos ellas le ayudan en la preparación de materiales y la venta de los mismos , este es su primer crédito con la institución , el crédito le ayudara a poder comprar mas materia prima y poder surtir a la misma vez con otros productos que vende tales como ropa para dama y caballeros, estas inversiones son las que le han ayudado durante estos años atrás y le darán lo necesario para seguir adelante.

loans.use: Credit to buy raw materials to make tamales (corn bread stuffed with meat)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To invest in new products, specifically small kitchen appliances

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Increase her stock of products to sell

loans.name: Etna

texts.es:
Etna P. Arévalo belongs to the “Santa Rosa de Lima” communal bank. She lives in the Juanjui district, Mariscal Cáceres province, San Martín department. She sells sweets from the coastal region of the country such as kinkones and manjares. She runs her business from her home, since she distributes the products by order to stores and other commercial outlets.

She decided to start her business based on her own initiative and because she likes to work with people. She also wanted to generate her own income and grow as a person and as a woman.

With a loan of S/. 1000.00, which she will pay back in 6 months, she will buy the sweets by the box. She is also thinking of expanding the business by selling other sweets from the mountain regions, such as rosquillas from Cajamarca, cookies, and cakes, so that she can meet the demand from her customers. Etna is 46 years old and has three financially independent children who are responsible and capable of making their own decisions. She is content with the job she does. She has the support of her husband, is very well known, and has a good clientele because of the quality of her products and her friendly sales manner.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Etna P. Arévalo pertenece al B.C. “Santa Rosa de Lima”, vive en la Región San Martín y Provincia de Mariscal Cáceres y distrito de Juanjui, se dedica a la venta de dulces triados de la costa del país como: kinkones, y manjares, desarrolla su negocio en su propia casa, ya que sus productos los reparte por pedidos a las bodegas y otros centros comerciales Decidió iniciar su negocio por su propia iniciativa y por que le gusta estar en contacto con la gente, así mismo generar sus propios ingresos y crecer como persona y mujer. Con el crédito recibido de S/. 1000.00 a ser pagado en 6 meses comprará estos dulces por cajas. También piensa incrementar este negocio con la venta de otros dulces triados de la sierra del país como: rosquillas cajamarquinas, galletas y tortas y así satisfacer la gran demanda de sus clientes. Tiene 46ños y 3 hijos independientes, responsable y capaz de tomar sus propias decisiones, esta contenta con lo que hace, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo, es muy conocida y tiene una buena clientela por la calidad de sus productos y la amabilidad que brinda al vender.

loans.use: To buy sweets for resale

loans.name: Estefita

texts.es:
Estefita R. S. is a member of the “Tesoro Escondido” (Hidden Treasure) communal bank. She lives in Juanjui district, Mariscal Cáceres province, San Martín department. She sells food, mainly foods prepared on the grill. Her kiosk is located in the market N° 2 in the city of Juanjui. In the afternoons, she runs the same business from her home.

With the loan of S/. 1300.00, which she will pay back in 6 months, she will buy on a daily basis the ingredients she needs to prepare the different kinds of food, such as plantains by the bunch, chicken meat, pork, and fish, both dried and fresh, by the kilo, and other necessary ingredients.

She is 43 years old and lives with her 5 children. She feels encouraged by the support of her family and is grateful for the support of the communal bank; these give her the strength to continue in life. She is sure that her business is a great opportunity to grow and to be able to fulfill all of her goals. In the future, she would like to have a kiosk where she could sell snack foods.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Estefita R. S. pertenece al Banco Comunal “Tesoro Escondido”, vive en la Región San Martín, Provincia Mariscal Cáceres y distrito de Juanjui, se dedica a la venta de comida, principalmente de platos preparados a la parrilla, su puesto de ventas se ubica en el mercado de abastos N° 2 de la ciudad de Juanjui. Por las tarde también desarrolla este mismo negocio en su propia casa. Con el crédito recibido de S/. 1300.00 el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprara diariamente los insumos necesarios para la preparación diaria de sus diferentes platos de comida como: plátanos en racimos, carne de pollo, chancho y pescado seco y fresco en kilos y otros ingredientes necesarios. Tiene 43 años de edad, vive junto a sus 5 hijos, ella se siente alentada por el apoyo de su familia y agradecida del apoyo del Banco Comunal que le dan fuerzas para seguir adelante, está segura que su negocio es una gran oportunidad para crecer y poder cumplir con todas sus metas. En el futuro quiere tener un puesto de venta de refrigerios

loans.use: To buy products for the preparation of the foods she makes.

loans.name: Martina

texts.es:
Martina M. S., a member of the “Santa Rosa de Lima” comunal bank, lives in Juanjui district, Mariscal Cáceres province, San Martín department. She sells coconut water from coconuts that are produced in the region. She locates her sales cart on one of the main streets in front of the city plaza.

It was 17 years ago that, through her own initiative and with the help of her husband, she decided to start this business and use it to help her children get ahead and become professionals.

With the loan of S/. 1500.00, which she will pay back in 6 payments, she will buy coconuts everyday by the hundreds, and ice, so that she can sell cold coconut water and thereby quench the thirst of the clients during the hot weather in this jungle part of the country. She also plans to repair the shade cover on her cart.

She is 43 years old and lives with her 2 minor children and her husband. She is a responsible person and it was her desire to help her children get ahead in life that motivated her to become a small business owner. She considers herself a fighter and perseverant. She feels that she is a good example to her children because of her dedication to her business and her unconditional support for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Martina M. S., socia del Banco Comunal “Santa Rosa de Lima” vive en la Región San Martín y Provincia de Mariscal Cáceres y distrito de Juanjui se dedica a la venta de cocos frescos (agua de coco) producidos en la región, ubicando su carretilla de ventas en una de las calles principales frente a la plaza de armas de la ciudad Fue hace 17 años y por iniciativa propia y con la ayuda de su esposo que decidió dedicarse a este negocio y así sacar adelante a sus hijos y convertirlos en profesionales. Con el préstamo de S/. 1500.00 para pagar en 6 cuotas, comprará cocos diariamente por cientos. y hielo en barras, para vender los cocos helados y saciar la sed de sus clientes, ante el sofocante calor de esta parte de la selva del país, también piensa renovar la carpa de su carretilla. Ella tiene 43 años de edad, vive junto a sus 2 hijos menores y su esposo, es una mujer muy responsable, sus deseos de sacar adelante a sus hijos le impulsó a desarrollarse como pequeña empresaria. Se considera luchadora, perseverante y siente que es un gran ejemplo para sus hijos por su dedicación a su negocio y apoyo incondicional a su familia.

loans.use: To buy coconuts and ice

loans.name: Elida Angelica

texts.es:
Elida Angélica R. Cárdenas belongs to the “Santa Rosa de Lima” comunal bank. She lives in Juanjui district, Mariscal Cáceres province, San Martín department. She has a phone booth business with two phone booths, which is located at Number 880 Jr. Triunfo Street. People who live in the community come everyday to make their local, long-distance, and international phone calls, to both land lines and cellular phones.

Thanks to her hard work and a loan she received, she was able to open this business. She currently has many customers, thanks to the good way she treats people and her charismatic character.

With a loan of S/. 1,700.00, which will be returned in 6 months, she will buy more telephone cabins and sell more sweets.

Elida is 25 years old and lives with her husband and young child. She works tirelessly to have good results from her business and to feel useful in life, with many opportunities in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Elida Angélica R. Cárdenas pertenece al Banco Comunal “Santa Rosa de Lima”, vive en la región San Martín, provincia Mariscal Cáceres y distrito de Juanjui, tiene un Locutorio con dos cabinas telefónicas que está ubicado en Jr. Triunfo N º 880 a la que diariamente acuden los moradores de la comunidad a realizar sus llamadas locales, naciones o internaciones , hacia teléfonos fijos y celulares. Gracias a sus esfuerzos y al préstamo recibido logró tener ese servicio, actualmente tiene varios clientes gracias al buen trato y a su manera carismática. Con el reciente crédito recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 1,700.00, el cual será devuelto en 6 meses, comprará más cabinas telefónicas e implementar mejor su negocio de golosinas. La señora Elida tiene 25 años, vive con su esposo y su pequeño hijo, trabaja incansablemente para poder ver los resultados y sentirse útil en la vida con muchas perspectivas en el futuro.

loans.use: To buy more telephone cabins

loans.name: Emperatriz

texts.es:
Emperatriz Calderón Chávez is a member of the “Sarita Colonia” comunal bank. She lives in Juanjui district, Mariscal Cáceres province, San Martín department. Her business is selling grocery items, clothing, and sodas. It is located in the city of Juanjui in her own house, where she has prepared a large and charming space for her business.

With a loan of S/. 1300.00, which she will pay back in 4 months, she will buy merchandise such as clothing for women, men, and children in different sizes. She will buy grocery items such as: milk and tuna by the box, rice and sugar in sacks, toilet paper, different types of canned fish, and other products that have high demand among her clients.

She is 40 year old and is an enterprising woman. She feels good about her job and the fact that can she can rely on the support of her husband and children. She plans to one day build a house in which she would rent out a room.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Emperatriz Calderón Chávez es socia del Banco Comunal “Sarita Colonia,” vive en la región San Martín, provincia de Mariscal Cáceres, distrito de Juanjui, su negocio de venta de abarrotes, prendas de vestir, bebidas gaseosas, está ubicado en el Jr: Lima Nº 648 del Asentamiento Humano 28 de Julio, de la ciudad de Juanjui en su propio domicilio y en el cual ha acondicionado un lugar bastante amplio y acogedor. Con el crédito de S/. 1300.00, el cual pagará en 4 meses, comprará mercadería como ropas para damas, caballeros y niños en diferentes tallas, abarrotes como: leche y atunes en cajas, arroz y azúcar en sacos, papel higiénico en paquetes, conservas de pescado en diferentes marcas, y otros productos que tienen gran demanda entre sus clientes. Tiene 40 años es una mujer emprendedora, se siente bien con el trabajo que realiza cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo y sus hijos y en el futuro piensa construir en su misma casa habitaciones para que alquilar.

loans.use: To buy products for her busiess.

loans.name: Juana

texts.en:
Juana I. H. has a successful business raising and selling chickens in a rural suburb of Pucallpa, Ucayali. Chicken is the most popular food in this tropical region of Peru. Juana has no problem selling her poultry and is always thinking for ways to increase production.

Juana is 42 years old, has 4 children, and is happily married. She loves her business because she can work from home and earn an income. Previously, she did not have much to do and had low self-confidence. She is now more independent and loves building relationships with customers.

A member of the community bank Las Lumbreras, Juana is requesting a loan of s/1500 (US$ 550) to repay over six months. She will use the loan to buy baby chickens and necessary antibiotics.

loans.use: To expand her flock of chickens

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina S. G. prepares meals from her home in a rural suburb of Pucallpa, Ucayali. For lunch Rosalina serves homemade meals typical of the region such as chicken, beef, or fish with beans, rice, and yucca. At night she has a grill from which she sells delicious grilled meats, fried rice, and "Juane" (a street food made with rice and chicken).

Rosalina is 50 years old, has 2 children, and is happily married. Rosalina loves to cook and work. She is social and loves building relationships with her neighbors and other clients. Rosalina is happy to earn an income, be a productive and positive member of her community, and help her family.

A member of the community bank Las Lumbreras, Rosalina is requesting a loan of s/1200 to repay over 6 months to buy ingredients for her business such as rice, sugar, oil, chicken, condiments, and beef.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for food sales

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.en:
Maria Magdalena S. V. sells fresh juices and sandwiches in the city of Pucallpa, Ucayali. She owns a stand on a busy street where people stop to grab a quick meal. She always uses the best ingredients and gives the friendliest service. For this reason Maria Magdalena has many loyal customers.

Maria Magdalena is 49 years old with five children and is happily married. She enjoys working and talking with all the people in her community. Before opening her business, Maria Magdalena spent all her time at home and didn’t have much self confidence. She is now happy and proud to be a good role model for her daughters.

A member of the community bank Las Lumbreras, Maria Magdalena is requesting a loan of s/1000 to repay over 6 months. She will use the loan to buy fresh fruits and bread.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients for a sandwich shop

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
Norma belongs to the women’s marketplace group “Grupo Mientras Tanto Mujeres del Campo Ferial”, and makes her living selling crafts, sweaters, scarves, and woven ponchos. Her stand is located in the artisan market alongside the main plaza of the city of Huaraz in the Department of Ancash.

With the loan of US$125.00 (PEN 300.00) which will be paid in full in 4 payments, she will buy ceramic ornaments, ponchos, sweaters, and vests to sell to her clients.

She is 38 years old and has two small daughters. Her husband is a bricklayer and both help with the education and nurturing of their children.

Translated from Spanish by Diane Lister, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Norma, pertenece al Grupo Mientras Tanto Mujeres del campo Ferial, se dedica a la venta de artesanías, chompas, chalinas, ponchos tejidos su negocio esta ubicando al costado de la plaza de armas de la ciudad de Huaraz en la feria artesanal, de la provincia de Huaraz, departamento de Ancash.

Con el préstamo de S/. 300.00 , el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará adornos de cerámica, ponchos, chompas, chalecos para ofrecer s a sus clientes.

Ella tiene 38 años, tiene 2 hijas pequeñas , su esposo es albañil y ambos se apoyan en la educación y alimentación de sus hijos.

loans.use: With this loan she will buy more merchandise to sell

loans.name: Juana Justina

texts.es:
Juana belongs to the women’s marketplace group “Grupo Mientras Tanto Mujeres del Campo Ferial”, and makes her living selling decal T-shirts, sun hats, and ball caps. Her stand is located alongside the main plaza in the city of Huaraz, Department of Ancash.

With the loan of US$125.00 (PEN 300.00) which will be paid in full in 4 payments, she will buy T-shirts and sun hats to sell to her clients.

She is 37 years old, and is a single mother with an 11 year-old son; both work so that her business will continue to grow.

Translated from Spanish by Diane Lister, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Juana, pertenece al Grupo Mientras Tanto Mujeres del Campo ferial, se dedica a la venta de polos estampados y gorros. Su negocio se encuentra ubicado al costado de la plaza de armas de la ciudad de Huaraz, departamento de Ancash.

Con el préstamo de S/. 300.00 el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará, polos y gorro para el sol, para ofrecer a sus clientes.

Ella tiene 37 años de edad, es madre soltera tiene un hijo de 11 años de edad, ambos trabajan para que su negocio sea cada vez más grande.

loans.use: With this loan she will buy more merchandise to sell

loans.name: Mujeres Las Cristalinas Group

texts.en:
The Maya Kakchikel women that form the group “Las Mujeres Cristalinas” come from Aldea Paraxquin. Paraxquin is a village located on the outskirts of Tecpán, a town widely known for its weavings.

Even though this group of women just requested their first loans, they have already developed a refined managerial skill, portfolio diversification. The vast majority of women engage in at least two economic activities. Most of the women work as weavers, ranchers and farmers.

The loans that are being requested are going to be used to buy thread to weave. In addition, they’ll be used to buy cattle, chickens and feed. Currently, investing in animal husbandry is an interesting option, because it is a very profitable activity. Plus, it allows the women to do other activities while raising the animals.

During the disbursement meeting, one could feel the excitement in the environment because the clients were thrilled about receiving their first loan from Friendship Bridge. For them, this loan signifies a window into a world of opportunities. Additionally, they know that if they solidify a good standing relationship with Friendship Bridge, it will allow them to access greater loans in the future.

Microfinance leads to many amazing things. Poor women are given an opportunity to succeed by providing them with credit. While, at the same time, they become an important part of the local economy. Economically active women become attractive to microfiance institutions that have to compete among each other to provide a better service to them. Many a promising advance has been accomplished and, thanks to your support, many more will happen.

loans.use: To purchase thread for weaving traditional blouses, and to purchase cattle, chicken and feed.

loans.name: Gloria Soledad

texts.es:
Gloria belongs to the women’s marketplace group “Grupo Mientras Tanto Mujeres del Campo Ferial” and makes her living selling T-shirts. Her stand is located alongside the main plaza in the city of Huaraz, Department of Ancash.

With the loan of US$125.00 (PEN 300.00) which will be paid in full in 4 payments, she will buy T-shirts wholesale in order to have them printed and then sell them.

She is 31 years old, has two children, and her husband works with a company as a salesperson. Both work to keep up their household.

Translated from Spanish by Diane Lister, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Gloria, pertenece al Grupo Mientras Tanto Mujeres del Campo ferial, se dedica a la venta de polos estampados. Su negocio se encuentra ubicado al costado de la plaza de armas de la ciudad de Huaraz, departamento de Ancash.

Con el préstamo de S/. 300.00 el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará, polos al por mayor para hacerlos estampara y venderlos.

Ella tienen 31 años de edad, tiene 2 hijos su esposo es vendedor en una empresa, ambos trabajan para sacar adelante a su hogar.

loans.use: With this loan she will buy more clothing to sell

loans.name: Agripina Isabel

texts.es:
Senora Agripina is part of the group "Women of Fair Field" and is dedicated to the sale of crafts, ceramics and chompas vests. Her business is located on the side of the Parade plaza in the city of Huarez, department of Ancash.

With a loan of $125 (300 Pen), to be recieved in 4 payements, she will buy a variety of crafts, of wool, and better jewls to sell and incrase their incomes.

She is 48 years old and has been separated from her husband for 8 years. She has 3 daughters and work in order to bring her daughters and her business ahead in life.

This story has been translated from Spanish to English by Nikita Ramchandani, KIVA Volunteer.

La señora Agripina pertenece al Grupo Mientras Tanto Mujeres del Campo ferial, se dedica a la venta artesanías, cerámicas, chompas chalecos. Su negocio esta ubicado al costado de la plaza de armas de la ciudad de Huaraz, departamento de Ancash. Con el préstamo de S/. 300.00 el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará, variedad de artesanías,de lana , joyas al por mayo para venderlos y mejorar sus ingresos. Ella tiene 48 años de edad, es separada de su esposo hace 8 años, tiene 3 hijas y trabaja para sacar adelante a sus hijas y a su negocio.

loans.use: To buy materials to vend.

loans.name: Angela Pilar

texts.es:
Senora Angela is part of the group "Women and Children of Jesus." She is dedicated to the sale of footwear and food at the entrance to the EsSalud public hospital in the city of Huaraz.

With a loan of $125, (300 PEN), that will be recieved in 4 payments, she will buy 1 sack of rice and 3 pairs of children's shoes.

She is 21 years old and single. She works hard with the goal of one day opening up her own small restaurant in her house with her parents.

This story has been translated from Spanish to English by Nikita Ramchandani, KIVA Volunteer.

La señora Angela, pertenece al Grupo Mientras Tanto Mujeres Niño Jesús, se dedica a la venta de alimentos y calzados, en la puerta de Essalud (Seguro Social) Huaraz, departamento de Ancash. Con el préstamo de S/. 300.00 el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará, 1 saco de arroz y 3 pares de zapatos para niños. Ella tiene 21 años de edad, soltera trabaja con mucho con la esperaza de abrir un pequeño restaurante en la casa de sus padres.

loans.use: To buy materials to prepare products.

loans.name: Raquel

texts.es:
Mrs. Raquel belongs to the Community Bank Women to Progress and makes a living selling food. Her business is located in front of the police station of the district and province of Yungay, department of Ancash.

With the loan of S/ 3000.00 (USD$ 1075) which will be repaid in 8 installments, she will purchase 8 cases of cooking oil, 2 sacks of rice, sodas, 10 bags of noodles, and meat ( beef and chicken).

She is 54 years old is married and has 4 children. Her husband sells fish in the market of Yungay. They both work to educate their children, two are pursuing higher education.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Raquel, pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres al Progreso, se dedica a la venta de alimentos. Su negocio esta ubicado al frente de la comisaría del distrito y provincia de Yungay, departamento de Ancash.

Con el préstamo de S/. 3,000.00 el cual será cancelado en 8 cuotas, comprará, 4 cajas de aceite, 2 sacos de arroz, gaseosas, 10 bolsas de fideos y carne de res y pollo.

Ella tiene 54 años de edad, es casada tiene 4 hijos, su esposo vende pescado en el mercado de Yungay ambos trabajan para educar a sus hijos, dos de ellos están cursando estudios superiores .

loans.use: With the loan she will purchase more merchandise.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan C. is native of the rural community Francisco I. Madero in the city of Victoria in Tamaulipas. Oranges is the largest crop in this area. The majority of the people make a living in this business because there are not many other sources of employment or other opportunities.

He started his business more than 13 years ago, first selling oranges in the area and later also in the city since this increased his market. The good thing about this business is that oranges always sell and at times the orders are large. Thanks to this he has been able to move his family ahead. He has two children, which back then were 10 and 12 years old. That is the reason why upon running out of money he started his own business of selling oranges to obtain some income. Currently he does not have so many financial problems because he is only responsible for the expenses of his house and of his wife and himself.

He is requesting a loan of USD $575 which he will repay in 6 months, it will help him obtain product and help cover the cost of transporting the product. Let us help Don Juan so that he can continue working!

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva volunteer.

Juan C. es originario del ejido Francisco I. Madero en Cd Victoria, Tamaulipas en este lugar la naranja es lo que mas se cosecha, y la mayoría de la gente de allí es a lo que se dedica ya que en el pueblo no hay muchas fuentes de empleo por lo que no tienen otras áreas de oportunidad.

Su negocio comenzó hace mas de 13 años, vendiendo naranjas al principio en el ejido y después también en la ciudad porque de esa manera lograba ocupar mas mercado. Lo bueno de su negocio es que la naranja siempre se vende y en ocasiones hasta se hacen pedidos grandes. Gracias a esto he podido sacar adelante a su familia tiene 2 hijos que en ese entonces tenían 10 y 12 años, por esa razón al no haber dinero tuvo que poner su propio negocio de venta de naranjas para obtener algo de dinero. Actualmente ya no tiene tantos problemas económicos porque solo solventa los gastos de su casa y los de su esposa y el.

Requiere un crédito de US $575 que pagara en 6 meses esto le va ayudar para poder surtir producto y para el transporte del producto. Ayudemos a don Juan para que pueda seguir trabajando!!!.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Genara

texts.es:
Mrs. Genara is a member of the Community Bank Women to Progress. She has a hardware store in front of the Nation Bank of the district and province of Yungay, department of Ancash.

With the proceeds of the loan of S/ 2000 (USD $725) which will be repaid in 8 installments, she will buy 2 water pumps, 3 packages of light bulbs, 4 electric showers. She will also purchase 6 dozen notebooks, book covers, mechanical pencils, hole punchers for the students.

She is 48 years old and has 4 children. Her husband makes a living duplicating keys. They both work to improve their household.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Genara, pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres al Progreso, tiene su ferretería ubicado frente al Banco D. la Nación del distrito y provincia D. Yungay, departamento D. Ancash.

Con el préstamo D. S/. 2,000.00 el cual será cancelado en 8 cuotas, comprará, 2 bombas D. agua, 3 paquetes D. focos, 4 duchas eléctricas, también comprara 6 docenas D. cuadernos, vinifan, lapiceros, poncheras para los estudiantes.

Ella tiene 48 años D. edad, tiene 4 hijos, su esposo se dedica hacer duplicado D. llaves ambos trabajan para sacar adelante su hogar.

loans.use: With the loan she will buy more products for her business.

loans.name: Maria Esperanza

texts.es:
Maria, belongs to the "Grupo Mientras Tanto Las Rosas de Yungay". She sells candy and disposable products in the Yungay province.

With the loan of S/500.00 which will be paid back in 4 monthly payments, she'll pay for the puchase of candy and consumables.

She is 57 years old, widow, has 4 children, and works to support herself and her family.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Peterson, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Maria, pertenece al Grupo Mientras Tanto Las Rosas de Yungay, se dedica a la venta de golosinas y productos descartable en el mercado del distrito y provincia de Yungay, departamento de Ancash. Con el préstamo de S/. 500.00 el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará, 10 paquetes de gaseosas y 5 paquetes de pañales descartable. Ella tiene 57 años de edad, es viuda, tiene 4 hijos, ella trabaja para mantenerse porque sus hijos son independientes.

loans.use: Purchase items for her store

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Mrs. Maria belongs to the Warac Community Bank. She makes her living selling candy and sodas on Fitzcarrald Avenue of the district and province of Huaraz, department of Ancash.

With the loan of S/ 1300.00 ( USD $475) which will be repaid in six installments, she will purchase 50 liters of fruit nectar (Frugos) ,10 cases of mineral water, 8 cases of large containers of soda, 10 cases of small containers of soda, 2 cases of fruit nectars in boxes.

She is 50 years old, married and has 2 children. Her husband helps her in her business because he has temporary employment. They both work to improve their home.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Maria pertenece al Banco Comunal Warac, se dedica a la venta de golosinas y de gaseosas, en la Av. Fitzcarrald del distrito y provincia de Huaraz, departamento de Ancash.

Con el préstamo de S/. 1300.00, el cual será cancelado en 6 cuotas, comprará, 50 litros de frugos, 10 paquetes de agua mineral, 8 paquetes de gaseosa grande, 10 cajas de gaseosa pequeña, 2 cajas de frugos en caja,.

Ella tiene 50 años de edad, es casada, tiene 2 hijos, su esposo la apoya en este negocio porque tiene trabajo eventual, ambos trabajan para sacar adelante su hogar.

loans.use: With the loan she will purchase more products for her general store.

loans.name: Maria Asencion

texts.es:
Maria C. started her clothing and shoe business in her home 8 years ago because she needed to work and had always wanted to have and manage her own company. She likes the sale of clothing and shoes because it produces good profits. Her home expenses had been increasing and her husband’s salary was rapidly used up among the expenses of the 4 children and the outstanding bills.

In time and through her hard work she was able to start two other business locations outside of her home. She divides her time during the week among the three locales thus being able to cover the sale days in those neighborhoods. This keeps her merchandise moving and she does not have to wait for someone to come to her house to purchase it.

She needs a loan of USD $575 which she will repay in six months. This will allow her to buy more merchandise to fill outstanding orders. Let us help Maria to continue to prosper,

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva volunteer.

María C. comenzó hace mas de 8 años con el negocio de la ropa y calzado, en su propia casa dado que tenia la necesidades trabajar en algo y siempre quiso tener su propio negocio y administrarlo, y le gusta la venta de ropa y calzado porque produce buenas ganancia, además los gastos en casa eran cada vez mayores y el sueldo de su esposo se acababa muy rápido entre los gastos de sus 4 hijos y las cuentas por pagar.

Con el tiempo producto de su esfuerzo y ahorros pude poner otros 2 negocios fuera de su casa, entre los tres puntos de venta se va rotando los días de la semana, para poder cubrir los días de venta que hay en esas colonias, de esa manera su mercancía siempre tiene movimiento y no tiene que estar esperando a que alguien vaya a su casa comprar su mercancía.

Necesita de US $575 que pagara en 6 meses este crédito le va ayudar para poder comprar mas mercancía ya que tiene varios pedidos por surtir. Ayudemos a María para que pueda seguir prosperando.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Muhamadjon

texts.en: Muhamadjon U. was born in 1958 in the Spitamen region. He is married and has 3 children. He has been an active client of MLF MicroInvest-Tajikistan since 2007 and has improved his business thanks to previous loans. The business stability and the permanent family income have helped him to repay the previous loans on time and to plan for business expansion. He is engaged in the family business of livestock raising and selling. His wife does milk production. He has a small herd and dreams of a large herd. He is also a taxi driver in his spare time. Now Mr. U. is applying for a loan of 2,100 STJ to purchase a pedigree bull.

loans.use: To purchase a pedigree bull

payments.comment: Correction due to underpayment for business #40994

loans.name: Zebi

texts.en: Zebi N. lives in the Spitamen region, and she is married with three children. She sells her homegrown potatoes wholesale in the collective farm bazaar. Now Mrs. N. is applying for a loan of 2,500 STJ for the seasonal preparation.

loans.use: The seasonal preparation

loans.name: Navruza

texts.en: Navruza A. is 23 years old and lives in the Spitamen region, where she has a business selling food products. The income stability has helped her to repay previous loans on time and open a shop. She has a good assortment of meats, dairy products, sweets and grains. Now Mrs. A. is applying a loan of 2,100 STJ to purchase one more refrigerator that will permit her to increase her business turnover.

loans.use: To buy a refrigerator

loans.name: Ibodat

texts.en: Ibodat F. was born in 1954 in the Spitamen region. She is married and has 2 children.  She has been the client of MLF MicroInvest-Tajikistan since 2007 and has distinguished herself as a serious client. Today she is among our active clients. Mrs. F., like many rural women, is engaged in the home business of livestock raising and selling. She is a school teacher by training, but the love of animals motivates her to work with the livestock. Mrs. F. has worked with livestock all her life and has a good knowledge of the business. Now Mrs. F. is applying for a loan of 1,700 STJ to purchase a pedigree milk cow.

loans.use: To purchase a pedigree milk cow

loans.name: Alisher

texts.ru:
Alisher Ostonokulovich R. lives in the Varzob region of Tajikistan. He is 23 years old and single. Alisher has an incomplete college degree in ecology. He cannot continue his education since college has become very expensive and Alisher was forced to take an academic break. To earn money for his studies Alisher works as a builder for hire. He also raises calves, sheep and goats in a small barn that he owns and sells the animals after fattening them. Since the prices for livestock are currently slightly lower, he wants to buy more sheep and goats. However, Alisher needs additional funding for this purchase and he has decided to take out this loan. This way he will be able to expand his herd and increase the earnings from animal sales. Alisher is planning to pay back the loan in the next 12 months

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva volunteer

Ризоев Алишер Остонокулович проживает в районе Варзоб. Холост , ему 23 года. Образование неполное высшее. По специальности Эколог. Нет возможности учится , так как обучение стоит дорого и Алишер взял академический отпуск.Для того , чтобы заработать на учебу клиент зарабатывает работая строителем по найму. Кроме того он занимается животноводством. Имеет небольшой коровник в котором разводит бычков и мелко рогатый скот. А после откормки их продает.Сейчас , когда цены на животных немного ниже клиент хочет купить овец и коз. Но для этого клиенту нужны деньги. Поэтому он решил получить кредит. Таким путем , он сможет увеличить поголовье скота, что даст возможность увеличить доход от продаваемых животных. Погасить кредит клиент планирует в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase of goats and sheep

loans.name: Gulchehra

texts.en: K. Gulchehra was born in 1966 in the Spitamen region. She is married and has 5 children. She has been the client of MLF MicroInvest-Tajikistan since 2007 and is grateful for the loans she has taken to improve her business. She is engaged in the family business of livestock and milk production. Besides that, she is involved one more business that brings her income. It is the selling of kurut, the fermented milk product that is very popular in Central Asia. Now Mrs. Gulchehra is applying for the loan of 1600 STJ for further business development.

loans.use: Business development

loans.name: Latif

texts.ru:
Latif Sharifovich B. lives in the Vazrob region of Tajikistan. He is 39 years old, married and has 4 children. He has a high school degree and works as a builder for hire. He also farms on the plot of land that he owns, where he grows wheat and potatoes. Latif has been farming for the last 20 years. Most of his harvest Latif sells at the market, but keeps some for family needs. Currently it is planting season in Tajikistan and Latif wants to buy high quality seeds of potatoes and wheat, but they cost more then regular seeds. Planting quality seeds will ensure that Latif will collect a big harvest of quality crops which will attract new clients. Also, this will provide the local markets with quality grain and potatoes for purchase. To be able to buy the seeds Latif needs additional funding, and that is why he decided to take out this loan. He is planning to pay back the loan in the next 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva volunteer

Бобиев Латиф Шарифович проживает в районе Варзоб. Женат , 39 лет имеет 4 детей. Образование среднее. Подрабатывает строительными работами по найму. Кроме того занимается земледелием. Имеет участок земли . который засеивает пшеницей и картофелем. Занимается этим видом деятельности уже 20 лет. Урожай , который он получает клиент продает , а часть конечно оставляет своей семье с запасом. Сейчас посевной сезон и клиент планирует купить качественные семена картофеля и пшеницы, а стоят они немного дороже чем обычные семена. Это поможет ему получить хороший и качественный урожай ,что привлечет новых клиентов. Кроме того поступление на рынке качественного урожая даст возможность населению покупать хорший и качественный товар.Для этого клиент нуждается в дополнительном финансировании, поэтому он запланировал получить кредит. А погасить кредит клиент сможет в течении 12 месяцев

loans.use: Purchase of potatoes and wheat seeds

loans.name: Qurbon

texts.ru:
Qurbon R. lives in the Varzob region of Tajikistan. He is 59 years old, married and has 6 children. Qurbon has a professional degree as a driver. He works as a taxi driver on the Dushanbe-Vazrob route. He has a small income from this, but not enough for living. That is why Qurbon supplements his earnings by raising cattle. He has a small barn where he keeps cattle and goats. He purchases young calves, feeds them then sells the animals at the market at a higher price. His cattle business earnings support his family. Qurbon would like to purchase more calves to enlarge his herd and for that he requires this loan. Currently it is a good deal to buy meat cattle, since the animals are thin after the winter and are sold at a lower price. Qurbon has been raising and selling cattle for the last 20 years. He is planning to pay back the loan in the next 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva volunteer

Раджабов Курбон житель Варзобского района. Клиенту 59 лет женат , имеет 6 детей.. Образование средне-специальное. По специальности шофер. Работает водителем такси по маршруту Душанбе- Варзоб.Имеет средние доходы, но этого ему не хватает на жизнь. Поэтому клиент дополнительно подрабатывает занимаясь животноводством, путем разведения крупно-рогатого скота.Имеет небольшой коровник , в котором имеются бычки и козы.Покупает молодых бычков , откармливает и перепродает на рынках по более выгодной цене. Это помогает обеспечивать семью.Но клиент хочет купить дополнительно еще одного бычка, но для этого ему нужно получить кредит.Именно сейчас покупка бычка может быть выгодна , так как после зимы животные исхудавшие , продаются по низим ценам. Занимается этим видом бизнеса занимается уже 20 лет. Погасить кредит клиент планирует в течении 12 месяцев

loans.use: Purchase of cattle

loans.name: Shukrullo

texts.ru:
Shukrullo Ziedullaevich B. lives in the Varzob region of Tajikistan. He is 29 years old, married and has 4 children. Shukrullo has a college degree in education. Currently he works as a contractor for hire, but his salary is not enough to support his family. That is why Shukrullo supplements the family income by raising cattle for sale. He has a small barn where he keeps his animals. Shukrullo purchases young calves, feeds them then sells the animals at the market at a higher price. His cattle business earnings supplement the family income. However, he would like to purchase more calves to expand his business and for that he requires this loan. Currently it is a good deal to buy meat cattle, since the animals are thin after the winter and are sold at a lower price. Shukrullo has been raising and selling cattle for the last 10 years. He is planning to pay back the loan in the next 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva volunteer

Бобиев Шукрулло Зиедуллаевич житель Варзобского района. Клиенту 29 лет женат , имеет 4 детей. Образование высшее. По специальности преподаватель. Работает строителем по найму. Получает заработную плату , но этого ему не хватает на жизнь. Поэтому клиент дополнительно подрабатывает занимаясь животноводством, путем разведения крупно-рогатого скота.Имеет небольшой коровник , в котором имеются бычки.Покупает молодых бычков , откармливает и перепродает на рынках по более выгодной цене. Это помогает обеспечивать семью.Но клиент хочет купить дополнительно еще одного бычка, но для этого ему нужно получить кредит.Именно сейчас покупка бычка может быть выгодна , так как после зимы животные исхудавшие , продаются по низим ценам. Занимается этим видом бизнеса занимается уже 10 лет. Погасить кредит клиент планирует в течении 12 месяцев

loans.use: Purchase of cattle

loans.name: Bunnak

texts.en:
Mr. Bunnak N. is single and lives with his widowed mother. He has seven brothers and sisters. The family lives about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mr. Bunnak has been a Motor Remoque taxi driver for five years. He carries people and goods from his village to Phnom Penh City and from Phnom Penh to his village. His mother has been farming for twenty-eight years.

Mr. Bunnak is requesting a loan for the third time in the amount of $150 to repair his motor taxi trailer.

loans.use: For repairing his motor taxi trailer.

loans.name: Sokcheng

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokcheng P., age 43, lives along the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. She has been married to Sothea Kim since 1984 and has four sons and one daughter. Four of her children are in school, one of whom studies at the University in Phnom Penh and other one is still young and stays at home.

Mrs. Sokcheng is in the business of selling meal in front of her house. She started this business last year. Her husband has been a TV and radio’s repairer for twenty-four years.

She is requesting a loan for the second time in the amount of $700 to buy a computer for her son to use while studying in the university.

loans.use: To purchase a computer for her son

loans.name: Sokhorn

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokhorn D., 33, and her husband, Pheary Lay, married in 1993. They have six children; three sons and three daughters. The family lives on Koh Dach Island on the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Sokhorn is in the business of weaving silk. She learned weaving from her grandmother and started silk production in 1990. She sells her finished products in her village. Besides weaving, she also sells mangoes and other kinds of fruit (as a snack) in front of the village school. She hopes that her business will be able to support her family and allow her children to study as high as possible.

Mrs. Sokhorn is requesting a loan for the third time in the amount of $500 to purchase silk material for weaving.

loans.use: For purchasing silk material for weaving

loans.name: Shavkat

texts.en:
Y. Shavkat is 39 years old. He is married with four kids; the youngest just started school the last year.

Shavkat sells cattle. He started his business in 2002; at that time, he sold one calf per week. Now Shavkat is selling more. In an average he is making up to $115.00 per month. The business requires much effort, but does generate enough income to provide for Shavkat's family. He gets up every morning at five o’clock to feed and look after the animals.
Shavkat requests 450.00 US Dollars for the term of 6 months. The loan is required for purchasing fodder for the cattle. Shavkat has a positive credit history and promises to repay the loan on time.

loans.use: Purchasing fodder for the animals

loans.name: Muslima

texts.en:
A. Muslima is 45 years old. She is married with two children. Muslima is a market vendor. She sells fabrics for the national dress. As a rule, Muslima travels to Dushanbe to purchase goods to sell, and increase her stock. The national dresses are very popular in Tajikistan, which has allowed Muslima to run her business successfully for 8 years. She has generated a stable and significant income for her family.

Now Muslima is planning to enlarge her stock once more. With this purpose, she requests $875.00 for the term of 4 months. Muslima has taken out a loan already from IMON, and had proven herself a reliable client. She promises to repay the loan promptly and thanks all supporting her.

loans.use: To purchase new fabrics for the national dresses to increase my range of goods.

loans.name: Samoeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Samoeun S., 26, and her husband, Sok Deam, married in 2001. They have two children; one son and one daughter. Their daughter is in school and the son is still young and stays at home. The family lives on Koh Dach Island on the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Samoeun is in the business of weaving silk. She learned weaving from her mother and started silk production in 1996. Samoeun taught her husband to be a silk weaver since they have been married. They sell their finished products to the middle man in the village.

Mrs. Samoeun is requesting a loan for the fourth time in the amount of $1000 to purchase silk material for weaving. Based on her business success so far, she will have no problem repaying the loan to MAXIMA.

loans.use: For purchasing silk material for weaving

loans.name: Bibimohsharifa

texts.ru:
Bibimohsharifa Sobirovna I. lives in the Varzob region of Tajikistan. She is 47 years old, married and has 5 children. Bibimohsharifa has a high school degree and is a housewife. She supplements the family income by raising cattle. Bibimohsharifa has a small barn where she keeps calves. She purchases young calves, feeds them then sells the animals at the market at a higher price. Her business earnings supplement the family income. Bibimohsharifa would like to purchase more calves to expand her business and for that she requires this loan. Currently it is a good deal to buy meat cattle, since the animals are thin after the winter and are sold at a lower price. Bibimohsharifa has been raising and selling cattle for the last 20 years. She is planning to pay back the loan in the next 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva volunteer

Исматуллоева Бибимохшарифа Собировна жительница Варзобского района. Клиентке 47 лет замужем , имеет 5 детей.. Образование среднее. Домохозяйка. Зарабатывает клиентка путем разведения крупно-рогатого скота.Имеет небольшой коровник , в котором имеются бычки.Покупает молодых бычков , откармливает и перепродает на рынках по более выгодной цене. Это помогает обеспечивать семью.Но клиентка хочет купить дополнительно еще одного бычка, но для этого клиентке нужно получить кредит.Именно сейчас покупка бычка может быть выгодна , так как после зимы животные исхудавшие , продаются по низим ценам. Занимается этим видом бизнеса занимается уже 20 лет. Погасить кредит клиент планирует в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase of a calf

loans.name: Sharifa

texts.ru:
Sharifa A. lives in the Varzob region of Tajikistan.She is 73 years old, widowed and has 1 child. Sharifa has a high school degree and raises cattle for a living. Sharifa owns a small barn where she keeps her calves. She purchases animals at the market, fattens them and then sells for a higher price. This helps her support herself and her family. Sharifa wants to buy one more calf but for that she needs to take out a loan. Currently the prices on cattle are lower, since the animals are thinner after the winter. Sharifa has been raising cattle for the last 20 years and she is planning to pay back the credit in the next 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva volunteer

Ахмедова Шарифа жительница Варзобского района. Клиентке 73 лет , вдова имеет 1 детей. Образование среднее.Зарабатывает клиентка путем разведения крупно-рогатого скота.Имеет небольшой коровник ,в котором имеются бычки.Покупает молодых бычков , откармливает и перепродает на рынках по более выгодной цене. Это помогает обеспечивать семью.Но клиентка хочет купить дополнительно еще одного бычка, но для этого клиентке нужно получить кредит.Именно сейчас покупка бычка может быть выгодна , так как после зимы животные исхудавшие , продаются по низим ценам. Занимается этим видом бизнеса занимается уже 20 лет. Погасить кредит клиент планирует в течении 12 месяцев

loans.use: Purchase of a calf

loans.name: Maiya

texts.en:
Mrs. Maiya G. lives in a single family with her husband and two children. Both her son and daughter are studying in grade 2. Her husband name is Pinj G. and he is a laborer in house construction work. In her family only her husband's income is not enough to run family and to provide education for their children. So in order to upgrade the living standard of her family she opened a poultry farm two years ago. She sells chickens in local market. People also come to buy chicken from her farm. Now the demand for chicken is increasing rapidly in that area but due to lack of fund she cannot fulfill the demand of her customers. So Mrs. G. is requesting for her first loan to buy more chicken for her farm.
Her income is used to support her husband and fulfill the needs of her family.

loans.use: To buy chicken for her farm

loans.name: Sayfiddin

texts.ru:
Sayfiddin B. lives in the Varzob region of Tajikistan. He is 40 years old, married and has 4 children. Sayfiddin has a professional school degree and works as a driver. He supplements the family's income by raising cattle. Sayfiddin owns a barn where he keeps calves purchased at the market which he fattens and then sells for a higher price. This helps him support his family. Sayfiddin wants to buy one more calf but for that he needs to take out a loan. Currently the prices on cattle are lower, since the animals are thinner after the winter. Sayfiddin is planning to pay back the credit in the next 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva volunteer

Бегматов Сайфиддин житель Варзобского района. Клиенту 40лет , женат имеет 4 детей. Образование средне-специальное. По специальности шофер.Зарабатывает клиент путем разведения крупно-рогатого скота.Имеет небольшой коровник ,в котором имеются бычки.Покупает молодых бычков , откармливает и перепродает на рынках по более выгодной цене. Это помогает обеспечивать семью.Но клиент хочет купить дополнительно еще одного бычка, но для этого клиенту нужно получить кредит.Именно сейчас покупка бычка может быть выгодна , так как после зимы животные исхудавшие , продаются по низим ценам. Погасить кредит клиент планирует в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase of cattle

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for MLF HUMO - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Mina

texts.en:
Mrs. Mina B. is a married woman and has one daughter and two sons. Her sons are studying in grade 11 and 10 respectively. Her daughter is studying in grade 8. Her husband Shoyam B. works in a private office.

Mrs. Mina already owns one cow and she has been selling milk in the local area. In Nepal pure, fresh cow’s milk is highly valued for its nutrition. Mina lives in a growing neighborhood and in that area the demand for milk is increasing. She carries her milk containers and sells door-to-door daily in the morning and evening. In order to meet the rising demand, she wants to buy another cow to increase her production. Therefore, she's requesting for a loan of $175 to purchase a young jersey cow, which produces more milk than normal cows.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Firuz

texts.ru:
Firuz H. lives in the Varzob region of Tajikistan. He is 24 years old and single. Firuz has a college degree in engineering. He works as an engineer at the local power plant but his salary is very small and he supplement it by raising cattle. Firuz owns a barn where he keeps calves, that he purchases at the market, fattens and then sells for a higher price. This helps him support himself and his parents. Firuz wants to buy additional animals but for that he needs to take out this loan. Currently the prices on cattle are lower, since the animals are thinner after the winter. Firuz is planning to pay back the credit in the next 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva volunteer

Хафизов Фируз Абдулазизович житель Варзобского района. Клиенту 24 года , холост , детей не имеет. Образование высшее. По специальности инженер. Он работает инженером электростанции. Получает небольшую заработную плату. Подрабатывает клиент путем разведения крупно-рогатого скота.Имеет небольшой коровник ,в котором имеются бычки.Покупает молодых бычков , откармливает и перепродает на рынках по более выгодной цене. Это помогает обеспечивать семью.Но клиент хочет купить дополнительно еще одного бычка, но для этого клиенту нужно получить кредит.Именно сейчас покупка бычка может быть выгодна , так как после зимы животные исхудавшие , продаются по низим ценам. Погасить кредит клиент планирует в течении 12 месяцев

loans.use: Purchase of cattle

loans.name: Rustamova

texts.ru:
I. Rustamova is 36 years old, married and has 3 children. All three of her children are in high school. I.'s husband has been earning money in Russia for many years now. She is a housewife, but is running a mattress making business from her apartment in Khudjan. I. has been saving money to fix the apartment for a while and the repairs have finally begun, but now she needs 3000 more somoni. I. decided not to wait for her husband to send more money but to turn to Microinvest and take out a loan, so that the repairs in the apartment can proceed without interruptions. And she will be able to pay back the loan month by month.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva volunteer

Рустамова Иноят женщина в возросте 36 лет замужем имеет 3 детей.Сама хоть и домохозяйка , но на дому имеет свой бизнес шьет на заказ матрасы.Все трое детей учатся в средних школах.Муж уже много лет как на заработках в России.Иноят давно копит деньги на ремонт квартиры, начав ремонт оказалось что ей не хватило еще 3000 сомони,и она решила не ждать мужа лучше обратится в Микроинвест и взять эту сумму в кредит, чтоб ремонт продвигался не прерываясь.И каждый месяц ей приемлемо погашать сумму кредита.

loans.use: Improvement of business/personal space

loans.name: Husniya

texts.ru:
Husniya Sharipovna S. lives in the city of Vahdat. She is 46 years old, married and has 6 children. She has a high school degree. Husniya is a housewife but her main occupation as well as the main source of income for her family is agriculture. She rents a plot of land where she grows wheat and potatoes. After harvest she keeps part of the crops for her family and sells the rest. She has been doing this for the last 15 years. Currently it is planting season in Tajikistan and Husniya requires additional funding to purchase seeds of wheat, potatoes and fertilizer. That is why she has planned to take out this loan. This loan will help her buy quality seeds and harvest a quality harvest which will help her attract new clients and be able to sell all the crops she grows. Husniya is planning to pay back the loan in the next 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva volunteer

Шукурова Хусния Шариповна жительница города Вахдат. Возраст клиента 46 лет. Замужем , имеет 6 детей. Образование среднее. Домохозяйка ,но основным видом деятельности и основным источником дохода ее семьи является земледелие. Она берет землю в аренду , засеивает пшеницей и картофелем. После того как она получает урожай , часть его она оставляет своей семье, а остальную часть продает. Занимается этим видом деятельности уже 15 лет. Сейчас самое время посевных , поэтому клиентка нуждается в деньгах для покупки семян картофеля , пшеницы и удобрений.Поэтому она запланировала получить кредит. Это поможет ей закупить качественные семена и получить качественный урожай, что поможет привлечь новых клиентов и без остатка реализовать свою продукцию. Погасить кредит клиентка планирует в течении 12 месяцев

loans.use: Purchase of potato and wheat seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Mrs. Rita B. is a 40-year-old married woman with a daughter and son. They live in Bhatkepati, Lalitpur. Her husband Mr. Shyam Krishna B. works in a private office. Her son is in grade 12 and daughter is in grade 8.

Mrs. B. started selling milk one year ago. She already owns one cow. She's requesting a loan of $400 to buy another young cow to sell milk in the local area. Since their living in a growing neighborhood, she believes that there will be an increase in demand for milk. Nepal people love to drink cow's milk so demand for milk is increasing constantly. She wishes to spend her income for her children's’ education.

loans.use: To buy a cow for Dairy

loans.name: Kiriri Development Group

texts.en: Damalie, the chairperson of Kiriri Development Group, is 32 years old and married with 2 girls and 2 boys. She also helps to look after 3 cousins, including paying their school dues. She is a nursing assistant at Kanzira Health Centre II, and she has a 6-year-old clinic at home that sells mostly herbal medicines like Chlorophyll, Gano Coffee, and Diana tonic in syrup form, which help reduce fats and pressure in the body. She buys the medicine from DianaPharm at the Royal Complex building in Kampala. Members of her group really love the group and would love to see it grow, this being their second time asking for a loan. Thank you for your kind hearts.

loans.use: Damalie intends to buy more Chlorophyll, Gano Coffee, and Diana tonic in syrup form for her clinic, as well as cover the transport costs to Kampala, once she gets the Kiva loan.

loans.name: Jotma

texts.en:
Mrs. Jotma S. is a 18-year-old women, and newly married. She lives in Bijeswori,which is located within the Kathmandu valley. Most of the people living in this locality are involved in business. Her husband Dipak S. works in his own meat shop.

Mrs. S. has been in the handicraft profession for 2 years. She sells different types of bangles and key rings in her shop. In addition, she sells things like thread, stone, bead of chandan, bone, key ring of mobile sets etc. She is requesting for her first loan of $175 to buy these additional items which will help meet the household requirement of her family.

loans.use: To buy additional inventory for her shop

loans.name: Shamsiya

texts.ru:
Shamsiya R. lives in the city of Vahdat. She is 47 years old, married and has 5 children. She has a high school degree. Shamsiya is a housewife but her main occupation as well as the main source of income for her family is agriculture. She rents a plot of land where she grows wheat and potatoes. After harvest she keeps part of the crops for her family and sells the rest. Currently it is planting season in Tajikistan and Shamsiya requires additional funding to purchase seeds of wheat, potatoes and fertilizer. That is why she has planned to take out this loan. This loan will help her buy quality seeds and harvest a quality harvest which will help her attract new clients and be able to sell all the crops she grows. Shamsiya is planning to pay back the loan in the next 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva volunteer

Рабиева Шамсия жительница города Вахдат. Возраст клиента 47 лет. Замужем , имеет 5 детей. Образование среднее. Домохозяйка ,но основным видом деятельности и основным источником дохода ее семьи является земледелие. Она берет землю в аренду , засеивает пшеницей и картофелем.После того как она получает урожай , часть его она оставляет своей семье, а остальную часть продает. Сейчас самое время посевных , поэтому клиентка нуждается в деньгах для покупки семян картофеля , пшеницы и удобрений.Поэтому она запланировала получить кредит. Это поможет ей закупить качественные семена и получить качественный урожай, что поможет привлечь новых клиентов и без остатка реализовать свою продукцию. Погасить кредит клиентка планирует в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase of potato and wheat seeds and fertilizer

payments.comment: Correction due to overpayment for business 41020

loans.name: Godfrey's Group

texts.en: Godfrey is really focused. He has had a store in Kiriri for 13 years, where he keeps his maize, beans, and coffee that he has been buying from farmers and sells for a profit. His wife has a retail shop just next to his store. Godfrey is 32 years old and has 4 kids, plus 1 late brother’s daughter whom he looks after. His home is in the village, but he would like to buy another plot and build in the trading center just like his mates, as well as buy a car to help with the transportation of the goods to his store. The produce he buys is seasonal, and now the season is for maize, which he intends to buy in large quantities once given the loan from Kiva.

loans.use: Godfrey plans to buy maize, coffee, and beans for his store to sell, once he is given the loan from Kiva.

loans.name: Karomat

texts.en:
D. Karomat is 52 years old. She and her husband have raised their children, who are living with their families. Karomat is a market vendor. She sells groceries like tea, coffee, oil, and macaroni foods in the local market. Karomatt's husband is also involved in the business. For eleven years of the entrepreneurship activities, the business was turned to a stable one, and now Karomat has her vendor kiosk.

In general the business generates the main significant income for the family. Considering the constant competition in the market, Karomat is trying to diversify the range of goods. So today she also wants to increase the range of goods to sell. With this purpose she requests $1000.00 for the term of 10 months. Being the client of IMON for two years with the positive credit history, Karomat promises to repay the current loan promptly and thanks everyone for support.

loans.use: To purchase food like tea, coffee, oil, macaroni foods and others, in order to increase the range of goods for selling.

loans.name: Nafisa

texts.en:
K. Nafisa is 33 years old. She is married with four daughters. Nafisa has been baking the national bread called “lepeshka” for 11 years already. Nafisa's husband is also involved in the business. As a rule Nafisa, purchases all materials required for baking the “lepeshka,” like flour, coal, butter, and oil in the local market. Nafisa’s “lepeshka” are widely known in her neighborhood.

She is requesting a loan of $1000.00 for the term of 12 months. Having proved herself as a reliable client, Nafisa promises to repay the current loan promptly and thanks everyone supporting her today.

loans.use: To purchase materials like flour and coal, required for baking the national bread “lepeshka”.

loans.name: Gulinor

texts.ru:
Gulinor M. lives in the city of Vahdat. She is 32 years old, married and has 4 children. She has a High School education. Her business is agriculture. She rents a piece of land on which she grows wheat and potatoes. When the crop is ready, she keeps a small portion of it for her own family and sells the rest. She has been in this business for about 5 years now. Right now is the perfect time to plant. Gulinor needs money to purchase potato seeds, wheat seeds and fertilizer. The loan will allow her to purchase high quality seeds, which in turn will yield a high quality crop. This will attract additional customers and help sell the entirety of the crop. Gulinor plans to repay the loan within a 12 months period.

Translated from Russian by Jane Mazur, Kiva volunteer

Мисонова Гулинор проживает в городе Вахдат. Возраст 32 года . Замужем имеет 4детей. Образование среднее. Занимается земледелием., который засеивает картофелем и пшеницей. Она берет землю в аренду , засеивает пшеницей и картофелем. После того как получает урожай , часть его она оставляет своей семье, а остальную часть продает. Занимается этим видрм деятельности клиентка уже около5 лет.Сейчас самое время посевных , поэтому клиентка нуждается в деньгах для покупки семян картофеля , пшеницы и удобрений.Поэтому она запланировал получить кредит. Это поможет ей закупить качественные семена и получить качественный урожай, что поможет привлечь новых клиентов и без остатка реализовать свою продукцию. Погасить кредит клиентка планирует в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Burigul

texts.ru:
Burigul L. lives in the city of Vahdat. She is 53 years old, married and has 6 children. She has a High School education. Her business is agriculture. She rents land and plants wheat and potatoes on it. When the crop is ready, she keeps a portion of it for her own family while selling the rest. Burigul has been in this business for about 5 years now. Right now is the planting season. Burigul needs money to purchase potato seeds, wheat seeds and fertilizer. Obtaining a loan will help her purchase high quality seeds, which will in turn result in a high quality crop. This will help her attract new clients and sell the entirety of the crop. Burigul plans to repay the loan in a 12 months period.

Translated from Russian by Jane Mazur, Kiva volunteer

Лолаева Буригуль проживает в городе Вахдат. Возраст 53 года. Замужем имеет 6 детей. Образование среднее. Занимается земледелием., который засеивает . Она берет землю в аренду, засеивает пшеницей и картофелем. После того как получает урожай, часть его она оставляет своей семье, а остальную часть продает. Занимается этим видрм деятельности клиентка уже около 5 лет.Сейчас самое время посевных, поэтому клиентка нуждается в деньгах для покупки семян картофеля, пшеницы и удобрений. Поэтому она запланировал получить кредит. Это поможет ей закупить качественные семена и получить качественный урожай, что поможет привлечь новых клиентов и без остатка реализовать свою продукцию. Погасить кредит клиентка планирует в течении 12 месяцев

loans.use: Purchase seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Bahtiyor

texts.ru:
Bahtiyor K. Hakimovich lives in the city of Vahdat. He is 35 years old, is married and has a High School education with professional specialization. He is a turner by profession, however being a turner is more of a side job for him. His main source of income is agriculture. He rents land, plants wheat and potatoes on it and when the crop is ready, keeps a small portion for his own family while selling the rest on the market. Right now is the perfect time for planting. Bahtiyor would like to borrow money in order to purchase high quality seeds, which will in turn result in a high quality crop. The quality of the product will attract additional clients and will help sell the crop with no leftovers. He plans to repay the credit in a 12 months period.

Translated from Russian by Jane Mazur, Kiva volunteer

Кенджаев Бахтиер Хакимович житель города Вахдат. Возраст клиента 35 лет. Не женат. Образование средне-специальное. По профессии токарь .Подрабатывает токарными работами , но основным видом деятельности и основным источником дохода его семьи является земледелие. Он берет землю в аренду , засеивает пшеницей и картофелем.После того как он получает урожай , часть его он оставляет своей семье, а остальную часть продает. Сейчас самое время посевных , поэтому клиент нуждается в деньгах для покупки семян картофеля , пшеницы и удобрений.Поэтому он запланировал получить кредит. Это поможет ему закупить качественные семена и получить качественный урожай, что поможет привлеч новых клиентов и без остатка реализовать свою продукцию. Погасить кредит клиент планирует в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase wheat seeds, potatoes and fertilizer.

loans.name: Abdusattor

texts.ru:
Abdusattor G. is 63 years old, married and has 4 children. He is a mathematics professor at the Tadjik National Unviersity. Three sons and a daughter are married. He has 7 grandchildren. He owns a house, but the construction is not finished yet. The price of cement continues to increase. Abdusattor would like to borrow 4100 TJS to purchase cement and finish building his house.

Translated from Russian by Jane Mazur, Kiva volunteer

Гафаров Абдусаттор возрост 63 года , женат имеет 4 детй работает учителем математики в Таджикском Государственном Универститете.Три сына женаты, дочь замужем.Жена Абдусаттора .Абдусаттор имеет 7 внуков.Он имеет свой дом,постройка которого еще не закончена.Для этого он хочет взять кредит.Ему необходимо купить в данное время цемент , так как цемент заметно дорожает .Еиу нужно 4100 сомони.

loans.use: потребительский займ

loans.name: Ashurby

texts.ru:
Ashurby N. lives in the city of Vahdat. She is 55 years old, married and has 12 children. She has a High School education. She is currently self-employed. She is in the business of celling groceries. She has a sales location not far from her house. The profit from her business is the main source of income for her family. This money is just enough to feed her large family. Ashurby would like to increase turnover, but in order to do that she needs additional financing. This is the reason why she is seeking to borrow additional funds. She is planing to repay the loan withing a 9 months period.

Translated from Russian by Jane Mazur, Kiva volunteer

Насриддинова Ашурби жительница города Вахдат. Ей 55 лет , она замужем , имеет 12 детей. Образование среднее. Закончила 9 классов средней школы. Нигде не работает , но занимается бизнесом. Имеет торговую точку рядом с домом. Торгует продуктами питания. Ее бизнес дает небольшой доход , дающий возможность только скромно кормить свою семью.Не смотря на это этот бизнес является основным источником дохода ее семьи. Ашурби хочет увеличить свой товарооборот, путем дополнительного финансирования. Но это возможно только при помощи кредита. Поэтому клиентка обратилась к нам за помощью. Погасить кредит клиентка планирует в течении 9 месяцев.

loans.use: Increase the diversity of goods for sale

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for MLF HUMO - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Rahima

texts.en:
K. Rahima is 50 years old. She is married with three children. Rahima has been running her business for 20 years. Rahima cooks the national meals at her place at lunch time. She sells meals to traders and sellers, as well as clients and customers in the market. Rahima's daughter helps her with the cooking.

Rahima is living very close to the market, which allows her to provide her clients with fresh, hot lunches. She has many clients, and her business is successful, allowing her to help her husband in supporting the family. Rahima requests $450.00 for the term of 1 month. Rahima is planning to spend the loan to increase the working capital and to arrange a trading place in the market. Rahima is a repeat client of IMON, and now she promises to repay this loan on time, and thanks everyone supporting her.

loans.use: T increase her working capital to arrange a good trading place in the market.

loans.name: Kumush

texts.en:
P. Kumush is 35 years old. She is married with two kids. Kumush is a market vendor. She is selling fabric for sewing the national dresses, such as chiffon, satin, and others. Kumush purchases all the goods in the market of Dushanbe city, and sells them in the local market of her home city. As a rule, the majority of the goods purchased by Kumush are those already ordered by wholesale customers.

The business is rather successful, allowing her to help the husband support the family for the last three years. Today, Kumush is planning to purchase the new fabric for sewing the national dresses. She requests $600.00 for the term of 4 months.

She has had a loan before and proven herself as a reliable client. Kumush promises to repay the current loan promptly and thanks all supporting her.

loans.use: Purchase new fabrics for sewing the national dresses, to increase the range of goods to sell.

loans.name: Savrigul

texts.en:
