S. Savrigul is 38 years old. She is married with five children. Savrigul is a market vendor. She is selling the fabrics that are used for sewing the national dresses. The national dresses in Tajikistan are very beautiful and very popular. In running her business, Savrigul is trying to have a wide range of goods to meet the demands of the clients with various tastes and different levels of incomes.

As a rule, Savrigul purchases goods to sell in Dushanbe market. Savrigul's elder daughter helps her mother in the business. Today, Savrigul requests $600.00 for the term of 4 months. The loan shall be spent to increase her stock. Savrigul has had a loan from IMON and had proven herself as an honest client. She now promises to repay the loan promptly and thanks everyone for support.

loans.use: To purchase new material for sewing the national dresses, to increase her range of goods to sell.

loans.name: Boimahamad

texts.en:
P. Boimahmad is 42 years old. He is married with eight children, all of school age. Boimahmad sells cattle. Currently, he has 5 heads of cattle, 5 heads of calves, and 1 horse. As a rule, Boimahmad purchases the animals in the central market and then sells them for higher prices in the local market. Being in this business for 20 years, he knows very well how to choose the animals, how to breed them and look after them. His knowledge and skills allow him to make his business successful, and generates a stable income for his large family.

Today knowing that the prices for the animals are not so high now but shall increase for sure, Boimahmad is planning to enlarge the stock and to purchase cattle. He requests $600.00 for the term of 8 months. This is his first loan, and Boimahmad thanks all for trusting and supporting and promises to repay the loan on time.

loans.use: To purchase cows and calves while the prices are low, and sell them at higher prices later.

loans.name: Shahrinisso

texts.ru:
Shahrinisso N. lives in the city of Vahdat. She is 43 years old, is married and has 6 children. She has a High School education. She is self employed. She sells household items from her own house. She sells laundry detergent, soap and other cleaning supplies. This business is the main source of income for her family. Her turnover, however, is relatively small and does not allow her to increase the variety of goods she has for sale. The profit from the business is just large enough to feed her family. Shahrinisso wishes to see her business grow and generate more and more profit. For this reason she wishes to obtain a loan, which will allow her to diversify her selection of goods up for sale. In addition to that, the loan will allow her neighbors, who are also Shahrinisso's main clients, to purchase more goods close to home without having to travel to the market. The client plans to repay the loan in a 9 months period.

Translated from Russian by Jane Mazur. Kiva volunteer

Назирова Шахриниссо живет в городе Вахдат. Ей 43 года Замужем, имеет 6 детей. Образование среднее. Она закончила среднюю школу. Нигде не работает, но занимается частным бизнесом в сфере торговли . Торгует из дома продовольственными товарами. Торгует порошками , мылом и другими моющими средствами. Этот бизнес является основным источником дохода ее семьи. Но у нее не очень большая оборотная сумма. Которая не позволяет ей увеличить ассортимент товара. Доход от ее нынешней торговли хватает только для того , чтобы прокормить семью, а клиентка хочет , чтобы все-таки ее бизнес развивался и приносил большую прибыль. Для этого клиентка планирует получить кредит. Получив дополнительные средства у нее появится возможность разнообразить ассортимент товара. Кроме того соседи , которые являются основными ее покупателями получат возможность иметь больший выбор и им не придется ездить за покупками на рынок. Погасить кредит клиенка сможет в течении 9 месяцев.

loans.use: Diversify goods offered for sale

loans.name: Shahlo

texts.ru:
Shahlo D. lives in Tursun-zoda, she is 25 years old, is married and has 2 children. Shahlo has a high school education and is a homemaker. She does not have a full household because she does not have the resources to purchase domestic animals and you cannot live in a rural area without a cow or at least a few calves especially with little children who need dairy products.

As a result, Shahlo has decided to purchase a dairy cow to provide her family with milk and to sell leftover milk to neighbors. This will allow her to provide her family with milk to drink, dairy products to eat and extra income. In addition, her neighbors who do not have a cow will be able to purchase milk at affordable prices. This is her dream and she is applying for a loan to purchase a dairy cow. Shahlo will pay back the loan over a 15 month period.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Дустмуродова Шахло Хусановна проживает в городе Турсун-заде. Ей 25 лет, она замужем и имеет 2 детей.Образование среднее. Домохозяйка. У нее нет хозяйства та как нет средств , для того чтобы завести домашних животных , ведь в сельской местности нельзя без коровы или хотябы бычков, тем более у нее двое маленьких детей , которым необходимо молочное питание. Поэтому Шахло решила купить корову молочной породы , чтобы обеспечить свою семью молоком, а лишнее продавать соседям. Этим она даст возможность своей семье постоянно пить молоко ,есть молочные продукты и заработать денег, кроме того ее соседи , которые не имеют корову смогут покупать молоко у нее по доступным ценам.Она мечтает об этом , а для того, чтобы купить корову у клиентки нет денег, поэтому она запланировала получить кредит.А погасить кредит она сможет в течении 15 месяцев

loans.use: Purchase a Dairy Cow

loans.name: Ravshan.

texts.ru:
Ravshan S. lives in Tursun-zoda. He is 34 years old, is married and has 3 children. He has a high school education and works at a construction site. He does not earn very much at his job and supplements his income by raising livestock. Ravshan has a small barn with several small calves. He purchases them, grows them, fattens them and then sells them. He has very little working capital and he needs additional funds.

Ravshan thought about it for a long time, decided that he could get a loan and turned to us. With the loan he will be able to purchase 2-3 calves, fatten them for around 3 months and resell them for a profit. By that time demand for animals will increase and prices will go up. Purchasing calves now, will allow Ravshan to raise the animals without additional costs, because it is now spring and there are no problems with feed (grass). This will allow Ravshan to maximize his profits and to improve his family’s financial situation. He has 3 children and would like to give them the opportunity to study and to get an education. He will pay back the loan over 15 months.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Султонов Равшан живет в городе Турсун-заде. Ему 34 года. Он женат и имеет 3 детей. Образование среднее. Подрабатывает на стройке подсобным рабочим. Зарабатывает не очнень много , поэтому дополнительно он занимается животноводством. У Султонова Равшана есть небольшой коровник , где имеется маленькие бычки. Он покупает их , растит, откармливает, а потом продает.Но у клиента в обороте совсем мало денег и поэтому ему нужны дополнительные средства. Он долго думал и решил , что можно получить кредит, поэтому он обратился к нам. Получив необходимую сумму он сможет купить 2-3 телят , откормив которых около3 месяцев он сможет выгодно продать. Так как к тому времени спрос на животных увеличится , а цены вырастут . Если купить сейчас он сможет вырастить бычков без лишних расходов , так как сейчас весна и нет проблем с кормом (травой). Это конечно позволит клиенту увеличить свой доход и улучшить финансовое положение семьи, ведь у него 3 детей и он хочет дать возможность своим детям учиться и получить образование. Погасить креди клиент планирует в течении 15 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase Calves

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for MLF HUMO - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Sahar

texts.en: Sahar is a 39-year-old woman who lives and works in Aley. Sahar has 3 children and is helping her husband support their family. Sahar makes beautiful embroidery and is applying for a loan at A. Majmoua to buy the necessary materiA. to sustain her small business.

loans.use: to buy material

loans.name: Olimjon

texts.ru:
Olimjon A. lives in Tursun-zoda. He is 42 years old, is married and has 4 children. Olimjon has a high school education and works at a construction site. He does not earn very much at his job and supplements his income by raising livestock. Olimjon has a small barn with several small calves. He purchases them, grows them, fattens them and then sells them. He has very little working capital and he needs additional funds.

Olimjon thought about it for a long time, decided that he could get a loan and turned to us. With the loan he will be able to purchase 2-3 calves, fatten them for around 3 months and resell them for a profit. By that time demand for animals will increase and prices will go up. Purchasing calves now, will allow Olimjon to raise the animals without additional costs, because it is now spring and there are no problems with getting grass for feed. This will allow Olimjon to maximize his profits and to improve his family’s financial situation. He has 4 children and would like to give them the opportunity to study and to get an education. He will pay back the loan over 15 months.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Ачдаров Олимджон Холмуродович живет в городе Турсун-заде. Ему 42 года. Он женат и имеет 4 детей. Образование среднее. Работает на стройке подсобным рабочим. Зарабатывает не очнень много , поэтому дополнительно он занимается животноводством. У Ачдарова Олимджона есть небольшой коровник , где имеется маленькие бычки. Он покупает их , растит, откармливает, а потом продает.Но у клиента в обороте совсем мало денег и поэтому ему нужны дополнительные средства. Он долго думал и решил , что можно получить кредит, поэтому он обратился к нам. Получив необходимую сумму он сможет купить 2-3 телят , откормив которых около3 месяцев он сможет выгодно продать. Так как к тому времени спрос на животных увеличится , а цены вырастут . Если купить сейчас он сможет вырастить бычков без лишних расходов , так как сейчас весна и нет проблем с травой. Это конечно позволит клиенту увеличить свой доход и улучшить финансовое положение семьи, ведь у него 4 детей и он хочет дать возможность своим детям учиться и получить образование. Погасить креди клиент планирует в течении 15 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase livestock

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for MLF HUMO - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Safa

texts.en: Safa is a 39-year-old woman who lives and works in Aley. Sahar has seven children and is helping her husband support their family. Safa does beautiful crochet work. This is the second time she is applying for a loan at Al Majmoua. She needs to buy the necessary materials to sustain her small business.

loans.use: to buy material

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en: Ahmad is a 39 -ear-old father of two. Ahmad lives with his family in southern Lebanon, in Saida. He is a dry cleaner. He is applying for a loan at Al Majmoua in order to help him buy a car to assist him with his business trips. Ahmad is striving to sustain and develop his work.

loans.use: to help him buy a car for the business

loans.name: Holisahon

texts.ru:
Holisahon S. lives in Tursun-zoda. She is 35 years old, is married and has 4 children. Holisahon has a high school education and is a homemaker. She owns a small farming household and works it by herself. Holisahon owns several calves that she fattens and resells, but she is missing a dairy cow.

She would like to purchase a dairy cow in order to provide her family with milk and to sell leftovers to neighbors. This will provide her family with a constant source of milk, dairy products and income and her neighbors who do not own a cow will be able to buy milk at affordable prices. This is her current dream. Because she cannot afford the purchase on her own she is asking for a loan. Holisahon will pay back the loan over 15 months.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Собирова Холисахон Усмонкуловна проживает в городе Турсун-заде.Возраст 35 лет, замужем имеет 4 детей.Образование среднее. Домохозяйка. Имеет небольшое хозяйство, которым занимается сама. Имеет несколько бычков, которых она откармливает и перепродает , но ей не хватает дойной коровы. Она хочет купить корову молочной породы , чтобы обеспечить свою семью молоком, а лишнее продавать соседям. Этим она даст возможность своей семье постоянно пить молоко ,есть молочные продукты и заработать денег, кроме того ее соседи , которые не имеют корову смогут покупать молоко у нее по доступным ценам. Это ее мечта на сегодняшний день. Для того, чтобы купить корову у клиентки нет денег, поэтому она запланировала получить кредит.А погасить кредит она сможет в течении 15 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase a dairy cow

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for MLF HUMO - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Issam

texts.en: Issam is a 39-year-old father of two. Issam lives with his family in southern Lebanon, in Saida. He is a car painter. This is the second time he is applying for a loan at Al Majmoua. He needs to buy material to sustain and develop his business.

loans.use: to buy material

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a 39-year-old father of two. Ali lives with his family in southern Lebanon, in Saida. He is a car metalworker, welder and painter. This is the fourth time he is applying for a loan at Al Majmoua. He needs to buy material to sustain and develop his business. With the increased income generated from the credit he is planning to buy a television and a table for his house.

loans.use: to buy material

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a 41-year-old father of three. Ali lives with his family in southern Lebanon, in Saida. He sells secondhand products and appliances. This is the second time he is applying for a loan at Al Majmoua. He needs to buy merchandise to sustain and develop his business.

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en: Mahmoud is a 24-year-old father of two. Mahmoud lives with his family in southern Lebanon, in Saida. He is a car electrician. This is the fourth time he is applying for a loan at Al Majmoua. He needs to buy material to sustain and develop his business.

loans.use: to buy material

loans.name: Omina

texts.ru:
Omina A. lives in the Bohtar region. She is 55 years old, is married and has 2 children. Omina has a high school education and works in business. She sells vegetables at the central market in Kurgan-Tube. She purchases carrots, cuts them up and resells them. This product is in high demand as the main Tajik dish is plov, which uses a lot of carrots.

Omina has been in this business for 14 years and it provides her family with a stable income. She will use her loan to purchases appliances for her home. This will allow her to improve living conditions for herself and her family. She plans to pay back the loan over a 6 month period.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Абдуджалилова Омина проживает в районе Бохтар. Возраст 55 лет. Замужем имеет 2 детей. Образование среднее. Работает в сфере бизнеса. Торгует овощами на центральном рынке города Курган-Тюбе. Закупает морковь и продает ее в нарезанном виде.Эта продукция пользуется спросом у населения, так как основным блюдом является плов , а для его приготовления используют много моркови. Занимается этим видом бизнеса уже около 14 лет. Эта деятельность дает стабильный доход ее семье. Клиентка планирует получить кредит для того чтобы приобрести бытовую технику для дома. Это поможет ей улучшить условия жизни для нее и ее детей.Погашать кредит клиентка планирует в течении 6 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase appliances

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for MLF HUMO - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Samean

texts.en:
Mrs. Samean P. and her husband have been married for twenty years. They have five children; one son and four daughters. Two of their children are employed full time, two are in school, and the youngest one stays at home. The family lives about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Samean and has been farming for ten years. She grows many kinds of vegetable in the farm behind her house. Her husband is a soldier.

Mrs. Samean is requesting a loan for the first time in the amount of $800 to purchase a water pumping machine and repair her house.

loans.use: To purchase a water pumping machine and repair her house

loans.name: Chanthy

texts.en:
Mrs. Chanthy R., 40, and her husband, Sophoin Dem, married in 1988. They have four children; two sons and two daughters. One of her daughters is married and lives outside the family home. The other three children are in school. The family lives on Koh Dach Island on the Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Chanthy is in the business of weaving silk. She learned weaving from her relatives and started silk production in 2000. She sells the finish products to a middle man in the village. Her husband has been running a horse cart since 2000. Besides running the horse cart, he also raises cows.

Mrs. Chanthy is requesting a loan for the fourth time in the amount of $500 to purchase silk material for weaving and buy a new horse cart for her husband. Based on her business success so far, she will have no problem in repaying the loan to MAXIMA.

loans.use: To purchase silk material for weaving and buy a new horse cart

loans.name: Sengkun

texts.en:
Mrs. Sengkun T., 53, and her husband, Leang Sin, married in 1981. They have four children; three sons and one daughter. Two of their children are married and live outside the family house and the other two children are weaving silk at home. The family lives on Koh Dach Island on the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Sengkun is in the business of weaving silk. She learned weaving from her mother and started silk production in 1981. She sells her finished products in her village. Her husband helps her spin silk and raise cows.

Mrs. Sengkun is requesting a loan for the ninth time in the amount of $300 to purchase silk material for weaving. Based on her business success so far, she will have no problem in repaying the loan to MAXIMA.

loans.use: To purchase silk material for weaving

loans.name: Kahramon

texts.ru:
Kahramon Shukuorv is 35 years old. He is married and has 4 children. Kahramon has a high school education. He has been purchasing and selling livestock for more than 8 years. He purchases and sells livestock at the local market, at neighboring markets and sometimes in Uzbekistan. He earns an additional income from farming where he also gets feed for his livestock.

Every year, in the spring, Kahramon sells his winter livestock and spends half the proceeds to purchase wheat seeds and the other half he spends on new livestock to fatten. Kahramon has a big yard for livestock and during the day he and his neighbors give their livestock to a shepherd that takes it out to feed in the fields and mountains of Shahristan. One head of livestock costs 1 somoni per day and the shepherd is responsible for the livestock. Kahramon and his family work in farming and he will use his loan to purchase a new type of feed for his livestock.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Шукуров Кахрамон Мардонкулович - 35 лет. Женат. 4 детей. Образование среднее. Клиент купле продажей скота занимается более 8 лет . Он покупает и продоет скот в рынках скота с в местном , соседних сел и иногда с респ. Узбекистан. Доплнительный доход получает от дехканства,откуда так же берет сухой корм для скота.Каждый год он весной продает зимний скот откормленный и половину денег он тратит на закупку зерна для посева -пшеницы и на остальную часть снова покупает скот на откорм.У нег дома есть большой двор для скота а днем он и все в его махале отдают скот пастуху и он весь день пасет их на полях и горах Шахристана. Одна голова скота стоит 1 сомони в день и он отвечает за сохранность скота. Кахрамон со всей соей семьёй трудиться по дехканскому хозайству и он хочет получить сумму на покупку нового вида корма для скота.

loans.use: Purchase of fodder for livestock.

loans.name: Sim

texts.en:
Mr. Sim M. and his wife have been married since 1970. They have one son and one daughter. One of their children is married and lives outside the family home and other one works in a garment factory. The family lives about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mr. Sim has been a Motor Remoque taxi driver for ten years. He carries people and goods from his village to Phnom Penh City and from Phnom Penh to his village. His wife stays at home.

Mr. Sim is requesting a loan for the first time in the amount of $500 to repair his motor taxi trailer.

loans.use: For repairing his motor taxi trailer.

loans.name: Yi

texts.en:
Mrs. Yi H. and her husband have been married since 1983. They have eight children; five sons and three daughters. Five of their children are employed full time, two children are in school, and the youngest one stays at home. The family lives about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Yi has been selling vegetables for two years. She buys tH. from Ta Khmao Market for resale at her village. Her husband has been a construction worker for five years.

She is requesting a loan for the first time in the amount of $300 to purchase vegetables.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Kimsruy

texts.en:
Mr. Kimsruy S. and his wife have been married since 1990. They have three children; one son and two daughters. Their first daughter works in a garment factory and the other two children are in school. The family lives about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mr. Kimsruy has been a truck driver for seventeen years. He carries recycling materials from Phnom Penh to Vietnam. He earns $120 per month for his salary. His wife stays at home.

Mr. Kimsruy is requesting a loan for the first time in the amount of $500 to repair his house.

loans.use: To repair his house

loans.name: Imad

texts.en: Imad lives and works in the Beirut suburbs. Imad owns a bookstore. This is the sixth time he has applied for a loan at Al Majmoua. He needs $1000 to buy enough merchandise to sustain and develop his business.

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Adham

texts.en: Adham lives and works in Beirut. He is a car painter. This is the first time he has applied for a loan at Al Majmoua. He needs $1000 to buy materials to sustain and develop his business.

loans.use: to buy material

loans.name: Aline

texts.en: Aline lives and works in Beirut. She owns a toy shop. This is the first time she has applied for a loan at Al Majmoua. She needs $1200 to buy merchandise to sustain and develop her business.

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Rima

texts.en: Rima lives and works in Beirut. She owns a toys and accessories shop. This is the first time she has applied for a loan at Al Majmoua. She needs $1200 to buy merchandise to sustain and develop her business.

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Bachir

texts.en: Bachir lives and works in Beirut. He sells motorcycles and offers motorcycle maintenance. This is the first time he has applied for a loan at Al Majmoua. He needs $1000 to buy merchandise and materials to sustain and develop his business.

loans.use: to buy merchandise and material

loans.name: Raymond

texts.en: Raymond lives and works in Beirut. Raymond is a car mechanic. He owns a car workshop. This is the first time he has applied for a loan at Al Majmoua. He needs $1200 to buy material to sustain and develop his business.

loans.use: to buy material

loans.name: Manouchak

texts.en: Manouchak lives and works in the Beirut suburbs. She owns a store in which she sells towels, bed linens, etc. This is the second time she has applied for a loan at Al Majmoua. She needs $1200 to buy merchandise to sustain and develop her business.

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Sarkis

texts.en: Sarkis lives and works in the Beirut suburbs. He owns a DVD store. This is the fifth time he has applied for a loan at Al Majmoua. He needs $1200 to buy merchandise to sustain and develop his business.

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Onik

texts.en: Onik lives and works in Beirut. He owns a butcher shop. This is the fourth time he has applied for a loan at Al Majmoua. He needs $1200 to buy provisions to sustain and develop his business.

loans.use: to buy provisions

loans.name: Loudy

texts.en: Loudy lives and works in Beirut. She makes beautiful embroidery. This is the third time she has applied for a loan at Al Majmoua. She needs $1000 to buy the necessary material to sustain and develop her business.

loans.use: to buy the necessary material

loans.name: Wartteny

texts.en: Wartteny lives and works in the Beirut suburbs. She sells clothing from her home. This is the fourth time she has applied for a loan at Al Majmoua. She needs $1200 to buy merchandise to sustain and develop her business.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for the shop

loans.name: Bernadette

texts.fr:
Mrs. Bernadette G. (the woman in the black shirt) is 28 years old, married and the mother of two children. Owner for four years of the hairdressing salon ‘Vierge Coiffure’ in Agoé, on the outskirts of Lomé, she runs the business with much professionalism and receives a large number of customers. In addition to this activity, Mrs. G. has combined selling hair extensions with distributing women’s shoes and handbags. She gathers the money from these sales once a week, which allows her to buy more stock and continue with her business. This first loan she is requesting of FCFA 150,000 will enable her to buy three cases of hair extensions and a dozen pairs of shoes. She will thus be able to increase her stock and improve her earnings.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame G. Bernadette (femme habillée en chemise noire) âgée de 28 ans est mariée et mère de deux enfants. Propriétaire d’un salon de coiffure « VIERGE COIFFURE » à Agoè dans la périphérie de Lomé depuis quatre ans, elle gère ce salon avec beaucoup de professionnalisme et accueille un grand nombre de clientes. En plus de cette activité, Madame G. a associé la vente de mèches et la distribution de chaussure de dames et de sacs de sortie. Elle collecte l’argent de ces ventes chaque huit jours, ce qui lui permet de s’approvisionner et de continuer son commerce. Son premier crédit qu’elle sollicite d’un montant de 150.000FCFA lui permettra d’acheter trois cartons de mèches et douze paires de chaussures. Ainsi, elle pourra augmenter son stock et améliorer ses recettes.

loans.use: To buy shoes and hair extensions

loans.name: Chérifatou

texts.fr:
Mrs. Chérifatou K. was born on August 12, 1980 in Atakpamé, a town about 100 miles north of Lomé. She is married and has three children. Mrs. K. sells toothpaste and deodorant at Lomé’s main market, a business she has conducted since 2000. She wishes to use this loan of FCFA 500,000 to buy 24 cases of toothpaste and three cases of deodorant from a new shipment of merchandise in Ghana in order to supplement her stock and better serve her customers.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame K. Chérifatou est née le 12 août 1980 à Atakpamé, ville située à 165 km au nord de Lomé. Elle est mariée et mère de trois enfants. Madame K. Chérifatou est revendeuse de pâtes dentifrices et de déodorants au grand marché de Lomé, activité qu’elle mène depuis l’année 2000. Elle désire avec ce crédit de 500.000FCFA pour acheter au Ghana vingt quatre quartons de pâtes dentifrices et trois cartons de déodorant d’un nouvel arrivage pour augmenter son stock et mieux servir ses clients.

loans.use: To buy toothpaste and deodorant

loans.name: Gifty

texts.en: Gifty N. is married to a driver and has 2 children.  To help support her family, Gifty has been selling a variety of items, such as sandals, shoes, and clothing materials. She is requesting a loan of $525 to buy additional items to expand her business. She hopes this capital will increase her profit levels, since she’ll no longer have to buy items on credit. Gifty is also a member of a lending group called “Nyame Ye Kase Traders”, which consists of 14 borrowers in Cape Coast, Ghana.

loans.use: To buy additional items to expand her business.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.fr:
Mrs. Catherine H. is 39 years old and was born in Lomé. She is the mother of two children and is married to Mr. Amah d’Almeida. Her chief business is selling cotton tunics and shirts in Lomé’s main market. With 16 years’ experience in this business, Mrs. Houngbibo easily repaid her first loan of FCFA 300,000, which she had taken out in order to increase her stock during the Easter holidays in 2007. The FCFA 300,000 loan she is now requesting will enable her to obtain three dozen new-style tunics. She will thus be able to attract many customers and increase her revenue. 
Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer. 
Madame H. Catherine âgée de 39 ans et née à Lomé est mère de deux enfants et s’est mariée à Monsieur d’ALMEIDA Amah. Son activité principale est la vente des boubous et des chemises en coton au grand marché de Lomé. Ayant une expérience de seize ans dans l’exercice de cette activité, Madame H. Catherine a obtenu son premier emprunt qu’elle a bien remboursé d’un montant de 300.000FCFA pour augmenter son stock en période de fête de paques de l’année 2007.
Le présent emprunt qu’elle sollicite d’un montant de 300.000FCFA lui permettra d’acquérir trois douzaines de boubou de nouveaux modèles. Ainsi elle pourra attirer beaucoup de clients et augmenter son chiffre d’affaires.

loans.use: To buy tunics and shirts

loans.name: Ibrahim's Juhudi Group

texts.en:
Ibrahim, age 64, is married with 14 children. He runs a small general store and also has a garden where he grows vegetables which he sells at his shop. He started this business 10 years ago and currently makes about $40 a month from his sales. He works from 7am to 4pm daily.

In the past, he took four loans to expand his business and was able to pay these back successfully. With the loans, he purchased a plot of land and bought his garden. He also used the loan toward house expenses and school fees for his children. Ibrahim now hopes for a new loan to buy more stock for his shop and to use some of the money for building a new house.

Ibrahim will share this loan with his subgroup, whose members have businesses in clothing and general store sales.

In the picture, Ibrahim is in the red shirt.

loans.use: To buy inventory for his general store

loans.name: Latifa

texts.fr:
Born on January 25, 1985 in Lomé, Miss Latifa L. is unmarried. She owns a hairdressing salon called “Benediction” in Tokoin Novissi. Here she also sells hair extensions and cosmetics. She started the business in 2007 with a small clientele. In view of the large number of customers she has today, she wishes to buy a hair dryer, two boxes of hair extensions and some cosmetics. She is therefore requesting a loan of FCFA 300,000. 
Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer. 
Née le 25 janvier 1985 à Lomé, Mademoiselle L. Latifa est célibataire. Elle est propriétaire du salon de coiffure dénommé « BENEDICTION » sis à Tokoin Novissi. Dans son salon, elle vend également des mèches et des produits cosmétiques. Elle a démarré cette activité en 2007 avec une clientèle restreinte. Actuellement vu l’importance de sa clientèle elle désire acheter un séchoir, deux cartons de mèches et quelques produits cosmétiques. Elle  sollicite alors un emprunt d’un montant de 300.000FCFA

loans.use: To buy a hair dryer and cosmetics

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en: Veronica K. has been a trader in Elmina village for 6 years. She is married to a farmer and has 5 children to support.  She is requesting $525 to buy additional bowls, and pots and pans. She walks through the residential villages and local markets with her materials and sells to a wide variety of people. Veronica is also a member of a lending group called “Nyame Ye Kase Traders”, which consists of 14 borrowers in Cape Coast, Ghana.

loans.use: To buy additional bowls and pots and pans.

loans.name: Kokoè

texts.fr:
Mrs. Kokoè G. was born on November 11, 1964 in Aného, a town about 30 miles east of Lomé. Her husband, whose name is Agbéko Djamessi, is a carpenter. Mrs. G. has five children and sells food products. She began this business in 1984. With the income she makes from it, she is able to take care of the family expenses. The loan of FCFA 150,000 that she is requesting will allow her to buy a dozen bags of corn while supplies are good and be able to continue her business in between times. With the income from this activity she is able to take care of her children’s education and provide for their needs.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame G. Kokoè est née le 11 novembre 1964 à Aného, ville située à 50 km à l’Est de Lomé. Son mari qui s’appelle DJAMESSI Agbéko est un menuisier. Madame G. a cinq enfants et est revendeuse de produits alimentaires. Elle a commencé cette activité en 1984. Avec le revenu de cette activité elle arrive à supporter les charges de sa famille. Le crédit qu’elle sollicite d’un montant de 150.000FCFA lui permettra d’acheter douze sacs de maïs en ce temps d’abondance et de pouvoir continuer son activité en temps de soudure. Avec le revenu de cette activité, elle arrive à prendre en charge l’éducation de ses enfants et subvenir à leurs besoins.

loans.use: To increase her stock of corn

loans.name: Ayélé Ayaovi Mawussé

texts.fr:
Mrs. Ayélé Ayaovi Mawussé K. was born on April 11, 1974 in Lomé. She is married and runs a business selling dairy products (Fan Milk) in Lomé. This business, which she started in 2004, brings in a reasonable income, especially as she is located opposite a private high school (Notre Dame de l’Eglise). The loan of FCFA 300,000 that she is requesting will enable her to buy two new freezers to keep her products cold. Fully achieving this goal will enable her to improve her business’s profitability and increase her income.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame K. Ayélé Ayaovi Mawussé est née le 11 avril 1974 à Lomé. Mariée, elle exerce l’activité de vente de produits laitiers (FAN MILK) à Lomé. Cette activité qu’elle a commencée en 2004 lui rapporte un revenu acceptable d’autant plus qu’elle est située en face d’un Lycée privée (Notre Dame de l’Eglise). Le crédit qu’elle sollicite d’un montant de 300.000 FCFA lui servira à acheter deux nouveaux congélateurs pour bien garder ses produits au frais. La parfaite réalisation de ce projet lui permettra d’améliorer la rentabilité de ses affaires et d’accroître ses revenus.

loans.use: To buy two freezers

loans.name: Ludmila

texts.en:
Ludmila is a married woman with one child.  She lives in Ordzhonikidze and owns a small business selling women’s lingerie in the central city mall.  Ludmila has many loyal clients who know her little store for having versatile merchandise at affordable prices.  Ludmila has been in this trade for 13 years.  Presently, her turnover is about $6800.  Her monthly profit is about $600. 

Ludmila would like to increase the assortment of inventory in her store and improve her sales as a result.  Today she is requesting a loan of $800 to re-stock her inventory.  She is hoping to obtain a stable source of income and continue developing her business.  A committed wife and mother, Ludmila works tirelessly to improve the quality of life for her family. We are hoping that her eye for market trends and customer needs will help her maintain consistent growth in her business and reach success.

loans.use: To re-stock her inventory

loans.name: Zarema

texts.en:
Zarema is an experienced entrepreneur from Simferopol, Ukraine.  She has been in business for eighteen years and currently has two sales locations at the large Central Market in Simferopol.  She sells a huge variety of house-shoes as well as clothing items, some of which she makes herself.  House shoes or slippers are very popular in Ukraine. Generally, upon entering a home, it is customary to take off one’s outdoor shoes and replace them with house shoes while indoors.  Many times, extra house shoes are kept on hand for guests to wear.  Zarema has built a successful business selling these practical items.  She makes about $700 profit in a normal month.  Zarema is married and has two sons.  Her youngest son is 22 and lives at home with Zarema and her husband.

Zarema has requested a short term loan of $500 to help purchase new inventory for her second sales location which she just recently opened.  She is hoping to buy a good supply of new inventory and increase her profits.  This is Zarema’s first loan from Nadiya Ukraine.  We are happy to have the opportunity to assist her with her business endeavors.

loans.use: Purchase inventory for a new sales location

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua K. has been running a general store in Elmina village for over 25 years!  She is married and has 3 grown children.  She is requesting a loan of $325 to improve the stock of her general store.  Currently, the items on her shelves are scarce, but she hopes this loan will provide enough capital to fully stock them. Efua is also a member of a lending group called, “Nyame Ye Kase Traders”, which consists of 14 borrowers in Cape Coast, Ghana.

loans.use: To stock more items in her general store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To do paperwork for a new vehicle

loans.name: Haelen

texts.en:
HaelenN, aged 35, runs a general store called "Imma's Shop" (named after her 14 year old son Immanuel). There, she sells sugar, beans, rice, sodas, ice cubes, and other general food items. She opened her shop in 2003 and works there from 6:30am to 10pm daily. She makes a monthly profit of about $55 from her sales.

Four months ago, Haelen borrowed a loan from Tujijenge Tanzania to buy more stock for her shop and to also pay for her son's school fees. Having repaid this successfully, Haelen hopes for a new loan to buy more stock and to also pay her rent.

She belongs to the group "Giraffe," which consists of 35 other members who keep each other accountable and insure one another in paying back their loans.

loans.use: To buy inventory for her general store

loans.name: Vida

texts.en: Vida A. has been selling clothing materials for 10 years.  She is married and has 4 children.  Vida takes her clothing materials to seamstresses, who buy them and turn them into men’s and women’s clothes.  The clothing material she sells is usually made into tradiational African garmets.  She is requesting $525 to buy additional clothing patterns, so she can attract more customers. Vida is also a member of a lending group called “Nyame Ye Kase Traders”, which consists of 14 borrowers in Cape Coast, Ghana.

loans.use: To buy additional clothing patterns so she can attract more customers.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es:
Marcelina has been a member of the Banco Comunal Firmeza for 4 years.

Marcelina is divorced, 38 years old, with one daughter aged 14. Marcelina sells cosmetics and natural products through a catalogue; she also sells sportswear and shaped corsets to friends and family in the city of Lima. Furthermore, Marcelina is an aerobics instructor in various gyms in the city of Ayacucho and she would like to open her own gym.

Marcelina needs a loan of 2400 soles, money which she can then invest in purchasing sportswear, shaped corsets, creams, colognes and jewelry.

She will use her savings to finish off her home and set up her gym. Marcelina has hopes for a successful business, a gym which offers personal training, as well as hopes for her daughter to become a professional.

Translated from Spanish by Lucy Williams, Kiva volunteer

Marcelina es socia del Banco Comunal Firmeza hace 4 años.

Marcelina es divorciada, tiene 38 años y 1 hija de 14 años, Marcelina vende cosméticos y productos naturales por catálogo, también vende ropa deportiva, fajas moldeadoras a amigos, familiares, sus productos los trae de la ciudad de Lima. Además Marcelina es instructora de aeróbicos en diferentes gimnasios de la ciudad de Ayacucho y tiene proyectado aperturar su propio gimnasio.

Marcelina necesita un préstamo de 2400 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de ropa deportiva, fajas moldeadoras, cremas, colonias y joyas.

Sus ahorros lo utilizará para el acabado de su casa y la implementación de su gimnasio. Los sueños de Marcelina son tener una empresa de éxito, un gimnasio de atención personalizada y que su hija sea profesional.

loans.use: Marcelina needs a loan of 2400 soles to invest in purchasing sportswear, corsets, creams, cologne and jewlry.

loans.name: Fortunita's Group

texts.es:
Flor, Marta and Fortunita have been members of the Banco Comunal Firmeza for 4 months, 1 year and 10 years respectively.

Flor is single and 27 years old. Flor, with her aunty, has a restaurant on a street in the middle of Ayacucho city, which she started up 2 years ago.

On the other hand, Marta is married, 48 years old with 4 children. Along with her husband she has a carpentry workshop in her home. They carry out contracted work. Marta helps her husband paint the pieces of furniture.

Whereas Fortunita lives with her partner, is 39 years old and has 4 children. Fortunita sells jumpers, hats, as well as other wool products. She buys her stock in Juliaca, and sells it in the markets by travelling around.

Flor, Marta and Forunita need a loan of 800 soles, 600 soles and 1000 soles, money which they will invest in purchasing plates, rice, sugar, wood, paint, jumpers, hats and scarves.

Flor, Marta and Fortunita hope to educate their children so that they can become professionals, have children, other businesses and build a house.

Translated from Spanish by Lucy Williams, Kiva volunteer

Flor, Marta y Fortunita pertenecen al Banco Comunal Firmeza hace 4 meses, 1 año, 10 años respectivamente.

Flor es soltera y tiene 27 años, Flor junto a su tía tienen un restaurante en una calle céntrica D. la ciudad D. Ayacucho, actividad que realiza hace 2 años.

Por otro lado Marta es casada, tiene 48 años y 4 hijos, Marta junto a su esposo tienen una carpintería en su casa, realizan trabajos por contratos, Marta le ayuda a su esposo en el pintado D. los muebles.

Mientras que Fortunita es conviviente, tiene 39 años y 4 hijos, Fortunita venD. chompas, gorras, entre otros productos hechos D. lana, sus productos lo compra en Juliaca, sus ventas lo realiza en las ferias D. manera ambulatoria.

Flor, Marta y Fortunita necesita un préstamo D. 800 soles, 600 soles, 1000 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra D. platos, arroz, azúcar, madera, pinturas, chompas, gorras, chalinas.

Los sueños D. Flor, Marta y Fortunita son educar a sus hijos para que sean profesionales, tener un hijo, otro negocio mas y construir su casa.

loans.use: Flor, Marta and Forunita need a loan of 800 soles, 600 soles and 1000 soles, money which they will invest in purchasing plates, rice, sugar, wood, paint, jumpers, hats and scarves.

loans.name: Sonia's Group

texts.es:
Mercedes and Sonia have been members of the Banco Comunal Firmeza for 4 months and 12 years respectively. In their Banco Comunal they have learned to become responsible, punctual and to save.

Mercedes lives with her partner, is 25 years old and has 2 children. She sells food outside her house where there is a clothes market, something which she started doing 4 months ago.

Whereas Sonia is married, 37 years old with 3 childre. Sonia has a restaurant and an Internet shop, both businesses in rented premises. Furthermore, Sonia is opening a bookshop on the main avenue in Ayacucho city.

Mercedes and Sonia need loans of 400 soles and 1600 soles, money which they will invest in buying cutlery, plates, chairs, felts, presents, and painting the bookshop.

Mercedes and Sonia have hopes to give their children the very best, for their businesses to continue to grow, to have their own premises and to have successful, professional children.

Translated from Spanish by Lucy Williams, Kiva volunteer

Mercedes y Sonia pertenecen al Banco Comunal Firmeza hace 4 meses y 12 años respectivamente. En su Banco Comunal aprendieron a ser responsables, puntuales y a ahorrar.

Mercedes es conviviente, tiene 25 años y 2 hijos, Mercedes vende comida en la puerta de su casa donde se realiza la feria de ropas, actividad que realiza hace 4 meses.

Mientras que Sonia es casada, tiene 37 años y 3 hijos, Sonia tiene un restaurante y una cabina de Internet, ambos negocios en locales alquilados. Además Sonia esta aperturando una librería surtida en una avenida principal de la ciudad de Ayacucho.

Mercedes y Sonia necesitan préstamos de 400 soles, 1600 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de cubiertos, platos, sillas, peluches, regalos y para pintar el local de la librería.

Los sueños de Mercedes y Sonia son brindarles todo lo mejor a sus hijos, sus negocios sigan creciendo, tener locales propios y que sus hijos sean profesionales.

loans.use: Mercedes and Sonia need loans of 400 soles and 1600 soles, money which they will invest in buying cutlery, plates, chairs, felts, presents, and painting the bookshop.

loans.name: Julia Alejandra

texts.es:
Julia has been a member of the Banco Comunal Capulí for 8 years, where she has learned values and how to be close with her friends.

Julia is a single mother, 38 years old, with 2 children. She sells white stone sculptures, which she arranges to be made by craftspeople in Ayachuco city and sells wholesale in Lima city.

Furthermore Julia sells clothes on a stall in the market 12th April, getting her stock from Lima city, something she has been doing for 4 years.

Julia needs a loan of 2000 soles, which she will invest in buying children’s sets, blouses, trousers, jumpers and jackets.

Julia hopes to have a large clothes shop, her own home and professional children.

Translated from Spanish by Lucy Williams, Kiva volunteer

Julia es socia del Banco Comunal Capulí hace 8 años, en su Banco Comunal aprendió los valores y ser solidaria con sus compañeras.

Julia es madre soltera, tiene 38 años y 2 hijos, Julia vende artesanía en Piedra de Huamanga (esculturas en piedra blanca) sus productos lo manda elaborar con artesanos de la ciudad de Ayacucho y lo vende en la ciudad de Lima al por mayor.

Además Julia vende ropa en un puesto del mercado 12 de abril, su mercadería lo trae de la ciudad de Lima, actividad que realiza hace 4 años.

Julia necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de conjuntos para niños, blusas, pantalones, chompas y casacas.

Los sueños de Julia son tener una tienda grande de ropa, casa propia y que sus hijos sean profesionales.

loans.use: Julia needs a loan of 2000 soles, which she will invest in buying children’s sets, blouses, trousers, jumpers and jackets.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary N. is a widow and supports her 1 child.  She has been selling clothing materials for 5 years.  Mary takes her clothing materials to seamstresses who buy them and turn them into men’s and women’s clothes.  She is requesting $425 to buy additional clothing patterns so she can attract more customers. Mary is also a member of a lending group called, “Nyame Ye Kase Traders”, which consists of 14 borrowers in Cape Coast, Ghana.

loans.use: To buy additional clothing patterns so she can attract more customers.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Victoria has been a member of the Banco Comunal Capulí for 8 years, where she has learned to be punctual, responsible and respectful.

Victoria lives with her partner, is 33 years old and has 4 children. She sells meat wholesale in market F. She buys the animals in the town of Sachabamba and sells their meat in the San Juan Bautista district. Furthermore she sells cheese as retail in the same market.

Victoria needs a loan of 2400 soles to invest in buying sheep, pigs and cheese.

She hopes that her children will grow up to become professional, and to have a car to travel to markets. She also hopes that her business will grow.

Translated from Spanish by Lucy Williams, Kiva volunteer

Victoria es socia del Banco Comunal Capulí hace 8 años, en su Banco Comunal aprendió a ser puntual, responsable y respetuosa.

Victoria es conviviente, tiene 33 años y 4 hijos, Victoria vende carne al por mayor en el mercado F. Vivanco, los animales lo compra en el pueblo de Sachabamba y lo beneficia en el camal del distrito de San Juan Bautista. Además Victoria vende queso al por menor en el mismo mercado.

Victoria necesita un préstamo de 2400 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de ovejas, cerdos, queso.

Los sueños de Victoria son que sus hijos sean profesionales, tener un carro para viajar a las ferias y que su negocio sea más grande.

loans.use: Victoria needs a loan of 2400 soles to invest in buying sheep, pigs and cheese.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Victoria has been a member of the Banco Comunal Capulí for 9 years, where she has learned to be responsible and to save.

Victoria is a widow, 53 years old and has 8 children, 4 of whom still live with her. Victoria sells honey which comes from bees, pollen and Maca derivatives. She does this travelling throughout the city of Ayacucho. Her products come from the same producers.

Victoria needs a loan of 3000 soles to invest in buying honey from bees, pollen and Maca flour.

Victoria hopes to start a new business, and hopes that her children grow up to become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Lucy Williams, Kiva volunteer

Victoria pertenece al Banco Comunal Capulí hace 9 años, en su Banco Comunal aprendió a ser responsable y a ahorrar.

Victoria es viuda, tiene 53 años y 8 hijos D. los cuales 4 viven con ella, Victoria venD. miel D. abeja, polen y derivados D. Maca, actividad que realiza D. manera ambulatoria en una calle céntrica D. la ciudad D. Ayacucho. Sus productos son traídos por los mismos productores.

Victoria necesita un préstamo D. 3000 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra D. miel D. abeja, polen y harina D. maca.

Los sueños D. Victoria son iniciar un nuevo negocio y que sus hijos sean profesionales.

loans.use: Victoria needs a loan of 3000 soles to invest in buying honey from bees, pollen and Maca flour

loans.name: Gabriela

texts.es:
Gabriela has belonged to the Capulí communal bank for 3 years. In her communal bank, she has learned to be responsible, how to educate her children, and how to save money.

Gabriela is married, is 28-years-old, and has 3 children. She sells honey and pollen, among other products. She makes her sales by working as a street vendor in the different markets. Gabriela also sells clothing with her husband.

Gabriela needs a loan of 3000 soles, money that will be invested in the purchase of honey, pollen, and children's clothing.

Gabriela's dreams are to have her own home, to grow her business, and to see her children become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Gabriela pertenece al Banco Comunal Capulí hace 3 años, en su Banco Comunal aprendió a ser responsable, como educar a los hijos y a ahorrar.

Gabriela es conviviente, tiene 28 años y 3 hijos, Gabriela vende miel de abeja, polen entre otros productos, sus ventas lo realiza de manera ambulatoria en las diferentes ferias. Además Gabriela junto a su esposo venden ropa.

Gabriela necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de miel de abeja, polen, ropa de niños.

Los sueños de Gabriela son tener casa propia, que su negocio sea más grande y que sus hijos sean profesionales.

loans.use: Gabriela needs a loan of 3000 soles, money that will be invested in the purchase of honey, pollen, and children's clothing.

loans.name: Laadi

texts.en: A. Laadi is a trader who sells beans, groundnuts and other foods. She is married to a commercial driver and has 3 children. She wants to expand her business and increase her sales. She is asking for $850 to enable her buy more beans and groundnuts to meet the demand of her customers.

loans.use: To buy more beans and groundnuts

loans.name: Nemesia

texts.es:
Nemesia has belonged to the Capulí communal bank for 4 years. In her communal bank, she has learned to be responsible, punctual, and how to save money.

Nemesia is married and is 56-years-old. She sells slippers at wholesale prices in a store located near the central market of the city of Ayacucho. She brings her products from the city of Lima. She also delivers her slippers on a wholesale basis to the markets.

Nemesia needs a loan of 3000 soles, money that will be invested in the purchase of canvas slippers of different brands.

She will use her savings in case of an emergency that could arise.

Nemesia's dreams are to build her house in the center of the city and to have enough money for her old age.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Nemesia pertenece al Banco Comunal Capulí hace 4 años, en su Banco Comunal aprendió a ser responsable, puntual y a ahorrar.

Nemesia es casada y tiene 56 años, Nemesia venD. zapatillas al por mayor en una tienda ubicada cerca al mercado central D. la ciudad D. Ayacucho, sus productos lo trae D. la ciudad D. Lima, también reparte por mayor en los mercados.

Nemesia necesita un préstamo D. 3000 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra D. zapatillas D. lona D. diferentes marcas.

Sus ahorros lo utilizará en alguna emergencia que pueda presentarse. Los sueños D. Nemesia son construir su casa en el centro D. la ciudad y tener suficiente dinero para su vejez.

loans.use: Nemesia needs a loan of 3000 soles, money that will be invested in the purchase of canvas slippers of different brands.

loans.name: Alex

texts.en: Alex Taky M. is married and has 4 children.  He recently opened a general provision store in Elmina where he sells a wide variety of items.  He is requesting $525 so he can further expand his selection to include food products, which he currently lacks. Alex is also the president of a lending group called “Nyame Ye Kase Traders”, which consists of 14 borrowers in Cape Coast, Ghana.

loans.use: To add food products to his general store

payments.comment: Correction due to underpayment for business 41089

loans.name: Celia's Group

texts.es:
Vilma, Celia and Jeida have belonged to the Capulí community bank for 8 months, 10 years and 2 years respectively.

Vilma lives with her partner, is 25 years old and has 2 children. She is an ambulatory vendor of clothing at the Santa Clara market; her products are brought in from the city of Lima.

Celia is married, 67 years old and has 7 children, 2 of whom live with her. Celia has a bar in a rented commercial space. Additionally, Celia sells sweets, using a tricycle for her work as an ambulatory seller.

JeiD. lives with her partner, is 22 years old and has 2 children. JeiD. sells clothing at the Ceres market in the city of Lima. Her business is run by her sister and JeiD. travels frequently to check on the business.

Vilma, Celia and JeiD. needs loans to invest in the purchase of sweaters, sweatshirts, a table, glasses, cookies, chocolates, backpacks and for Celia, to paint her tricycle.

Vilma, Celia and JeiD.´s dreams are to see their businesses improve, to build their houses, to have a greater selection of goods to sell and that their children become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

Vilma, Celia y JeiD. pertenecen al Banco Comunal Capulí hace 8 meses, 10 años, 2 años respectivamente.

Vilma es conviviente, tiene 25 años y 2 hijos, Vilma venD. ropa en el mercado Santa Clara D. manera ambulatoria, sus productos son traídos D. la ciudad D. Lima.

Por otro lado Celia es casada, tiene 67 años y 7 hijos D. los cuales 2 viven con ella, Celia tiene un bar en un local alquilado. Además Celia venD. golosinas en un triciclo D. manera ambulatoria.

Mientras que JeiD. es conviviente, tiene 22 años y 2 hijos, JeiD. venD. ropa en el mercado Ceres D. la ciudad D. Lima , su negocio esta en administración D. su hermana, JeiD. viaja constantemente para verificar su negocio.

Vilma, Celia y JeiD. necesitan préstamos D. 1600 soles, 1000 soles, 600 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra D. chompas, buzos, mesa, vasos, galletas, chocolates, mochilas y para hacer pintar su triciclo.

Los sueños D. Vilma, Celia y JeiD. son que sus negocios mejoren, construir su casa, surtir más su negocio, que sus hijos sean profesionales.

loans.use: To purchase supplies for their businesses: sweaters, sweatshirts, a table, glasses, cookies, chocolates.

loans.name: Edwin

texts.en: Edwin is 38 years old, married and has 4 children. He lives in Benin-City, Edo state.Nigeria.  Edwin uses his motorcycle to move people from place to place. He has been in this business for the past 8 years. Now Edwin needs a loan of US $625 to enable him purchase a new motorcycle.

loans.use: To buy motorcycle

loans.name: Rosa Leonidas' Group

texts.es:
Lizette, Rosa and Albina have belonged to the Violeta community bank for 4 months, 15 years and 12 years respectively.

Lizette lives with her partner, is 21 years old and is expecting her first child. Lizette and her husband make hand-crafted bricks in the community of Huayllapampa, which is 30 minutes outsiD. the city of Ayacucho.

Rosa is a widow, 67 years old and has 9 children, 5 of whom live with her. Rosa has a store in her house where she sells groceries, vegetables and fruit.

Albina is married, 60 years old and has 8 children, 4 of whom live with her. Albina and her husband make hand-crafted bricks in the community of Huayllapampa. Additionally, Albina sells food on Sundays.

Lizette, Rosa and Albina need loans to invest in the purchase of milk, rice, sugar, oil, soft drinks, pastas, potatoes and meat, and to pay their unskilled laborers.

Lizette, Rosa and Albina´s hopes are that their children become professionals, that their businesses improve and to have more capital.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

Lizette, Rosa y Albina pertenecen al Banco Comunal Violeta hace 4 meses, 15 años, 12 años respectivamente.

Lizette es conviviente, tiene 21 años y esta esperando su primer hijo, Lizette junto a su esposo fabrican ladrillos artesanales en la comunidad D. Huayllapampa que queda a 30 minutos D. la ciudad D. Ayacucho.

Por otro lado Rosa es viuda, tiene 67 años y 9 hijos D. los cuales 5 viven con ella, Rosa tiene una tienda en su casa, donD. venD. abarrotes, verduras, frutas.

Mientras que Albina es casada, tiene 60 años y 8 hijos D. los cuales 4 viven con ella, Albina junto a su esposo fabrican ladrillos artesanales en la comunidad D. Huayllapampa. Además Albina venD. comida los días domingos.

Lizette, Rosa y Albina necesitan préstamos D. 600 soles, 1600 soles, 600 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra D. leche, arroz, azúcar, aceite, gaseosas, fideo, papa, carne y para el pago D. los peones.

Los sueños D. Lizette, Rosa y Albina son que sus hijos sean profesionales, que su negocio mejore y tener más capital.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret B. is a trader who owns a general store. She is a single parent of 2 children. She wants to increase her income by increasing her sales. She is asking for $1050 to increase her stock to satisfy her increasing customer base.

loans.use: To buy stock for her store.

payments.comment: Correction due to underpayment for business 41093

loans.name: Guadalupe's Group

texts.es:
Guadalupe, Alejandra and Rufina have belonged to the Violeta community bank for 2, 4, and 3 years respectively.

Guadalupe is married, 45 years old and has 8 children. Guadalupe sells vegetables - which she always buys from the same producers - in the Nery García market. In addition, Guadalupe travels to different markets in the region where she buys grains and sells them at retail in her market.

Alejandra is married, 36 years old and has 2 children. Alejandra has a grocery store in her home, located in the community of Huayllapampa. She also sells food to the workers in the area.

Rufina is married, 44 years old and has 2 children. Rufina has a store where she sells groceries and vegetables. In addition, Rufina travels to the market in Paras where she also sells groceries, and from the various markets she brings cheese, which she later sells wholesale at the markets in Ayacucho.

Guadalupe, Alejandra and Rufina need loans to invest in the purchase of wheat, barley, corn, lettuce, cilantro, rice, pasta, oil, sugar, eggs and cheese.

Guadalupe, Alejandra and Rufina's wishes are that their children become professionals, to improve their busineses and to be successful in everything.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

Guadalupe, Alejandra y Rufina pertenecen al Banco Comunal Violeta hace 2, 4, 3, años respectivamente.

Guadalupe es casada, tiene 45 años y 8 hijos, Guadalupe venD. verduras en el mercado Nery García, sus productos los compra D. los mismos productores. Además Guadalupe viaja a las diferentes ferias D. la región donD. compra cereales y lo venD. al por menor en el mismo mercado.

Por otro lado Alejandra es casada, tiene 36 años y 2 hijos, Alejandra tiene una tienda D. abarrotes en su casa ubicada en la comunidad D. Huayllapampa. Además venD. comida a los trabajadores D. la zona.

Mientras que Rufina es casada, tiene 44 años y 2 hijos, Rufina tiene una tienda donD. venD. abarrotes, verduras. Además, Rufina viaja a la feria D. Paras donD. también venD. abarrotes y D. las ferias trae queso que luego venD. por mayor en los mercados D. la ciudad D. Ayacucho.

Guadalupe, Alejandra y Rufina necesitan préstamos D. 600 soles, 1000 soles, 1600 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra D. trigo, cebada, maíz, lechuga, culantro, arroz, fideo, aceite, azúcar, huevo, queso.

Los sueños D. Guadalupe, Alejandra y Rufina son que sus hijos sean profesionales, mejorar sus negocios y salir adelante en todo.

loans.use: To buy wheat, barley, corn, lettuce, cilantro, rice, pasta, oil, eggs and cheese.

loans.name: Edita's Group

texts.en:
Edita U., N. Jeremia, Elizabeth N. and Victoria S. make up the AGAPE group. They are all residents of Tabata in the city of Dar Es Salaam.

For the past three years, Edita U. has run a stationery shop. She and her other group members are all requesting a loan to help them expand their business.

loans.use: Expand the stationery shop

loans.name: Adela

texts.es:
Adela has belonged to the Violeta community bank for 6 years, where she has learned to be responsible, to save, how to eat right and how to run her businesses.

Adela is married, 38 years old and has 4 children. She sells clothing by request to workers, friends and family members. She brings her products from Lima and also sells cosmetics by catalog. In addition, Adela and her husband have a fighting ring for roosters at their house, which is open on holidays and Sundays. During Easter week, which is approaching, she will sell regional foods and offer lodging for families.

Adela needs a loan to purchase bedspreads, sheets, corn, meat, potatoes and rice.

Adela dreams of having a hotel, a recreation area with all the amenities and that her children finish school.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

Adela pertenece al Banco Comunal Violeta hace 6 años, en su Banco Comunal aprendió a ser responsable, a ahorrar, como alimentarse y administrar sus negocios.

Adela es casada, tiene 38 años y 4 hijos, Adela vende ropa a pedido a trabajadores de instituciones, amigos, familiares, sus productos lo trae de la ciudad de Lima, también vende cosméticos por catálogos. Además, Adela junto a su esposo tienen un coliseo de gallos en su casa, que funciona los días feriados y domingos. Adela, por la Semana Santa que se aproxima venderá comida típica y brindara hospedaje familiar.

Adela necesita un préstamo de 1600 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de cubrecamas, sabanas, maíz, carne, papa, arroz.

Los sueños de Adela son tener un hotel, un recreo con todas las comodidades y que sus hijos culminen sus estudios.

loans.use: Purchase bedspreads, sheets, corn, meat, potatoes and rice.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama A. is married and has 5 children.  She has been selling firewood for the past 6 years.  Firewood is extremely important in rural villages, because it is often the only way to prepare hot meals.  She is requesting a loan of $425 to buy firewood in bulk so she can receive a discount. Ama is also a member of a lending group called “Nyame Ye Kase Traders”, which consists of 14 borrowers in Cape Coast, Ghana.

loans.use: To buy firewood in bulk so she can receive a discount.

loans.name: Amina's Group

texts.en: Amina Kasim, Harriet M., and Zuena S. are the members of the big three group. For the past five years, Amina Kasim, the group leader, has run a small restaurant in the Tabata area. These group members are requesting a loan to help them expand the restaurant.

loans.name: Angelica's Group

texts.es:
Angélica, Blanca and Maria have belonged to the Hormigas community bank for 2, 8 and 3 years respectively.

Angélica is a widow, 51 years old with 6 children, 3 of whom live with her. Angélica sells baskets and chocolate from Ayacucho in the Santa Clara market. She hand makes the chocolates herself at home.

Blanca is married, 45 years old and has 4 children. Blanca sells natural products by catalog and she also sells Renaware cookware, products which she offers to friends and relatives.

Maria is married, 35 years old and has 2 children. Maria sells vegetables at the market on Cuzco Avenue. In addition, Maria travels out to the Ayacucho jungle to sell vegetables.

Angélica, Blanca and Maria need loans to invest in the purchase of baskets, cocoa, natural products, tomatoes, onions and pumpkins.

Angélica, Blanca and Maria´s hopes are to have money for their old age, that their businesses grow, to start new businesses and that their children become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

Angélica es viuda, tiene 51 años y 6 hijos D. los cuales 3 viven con ella, Angélica venD. canastas y chocolate ayacuchano en el mercado Santa Clara, los chocolates lo elabora ella misma en su casa D. manera artesanal.

Por otro lado Blanca es casada, tiene 45 años y 4 hijos, Blanca venD. productos naturales por catálogo y también ollas Renaware, productos que ofrece a amigos familiares.

Mientras que Maria es casada, tiene 35 años y 2 hijos, Maria venD. verduras en el mercadillo D. la Av. Cuzco. Además Maria viaja a la selva ayacuchana donD. venD. verduras.

loans.name: Graciela's Group

Graciela, Elena and Delfina have belonged to the Hormigas community bank for 6, 3 and 6 years, respectively.

Graciela is married, 40 years old and has 1 daughter. Graciela has a stO. where natural medicines are sold, which is located in Lima. She travels continually to Lima to supervise her business.

Elena is married, 40 years old and has 3 children. She sells sweaters by request to friends and family, and brings her products from the city of Huancayo.

He is requesting a loan of $525 to buy video tapess, CD's and additional filming equipment.  Thomas is also a member of a lending group called “Nyame Ye Kase Traders”, which consists of 14 borrowers in Cape Coast, Ghana.

loans.name: Fatuma's Group

texts.en: Fatuma O., Siza M., and Jane L. make up the Upendo group. They have been together as a group for one year. Fatuma runs a shop in the Tabata area that sells food. They are requesting a loan to help them expand their business selling food items.

loans.name: Eliza

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 35-year-old Eliza M.. She is married, and has three children, ages 15, 17 and 20. In 2006, Eliza established her liquor store business. Eliza requires a loan in order to purchase additional stock of beer and soft drinks. She thanks you for your support.

It is said that Coca Cola® is one of the most recognized symbols or ‘words’ in the world. And it’s true. Even in the most remote villages in Africa, there is usually some kind of ‘bar’ selling Coke, Fanta, and Guinness (Pepsi has made it to most African capitals but not to the sticks, but I’m sure they’re working on it!). The hot weather makes soft drinks all the more appealing; a very cheap marketing tool! All of which explains why selling soft drinks is such a popular venture, whether you’re the CEO of Coca Cola Ltd in the United States or a micro-entrepreneur in Tanzania!

loans.use: To purchase additional stock of beer and soft drinks in bulk.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Sero Lease and Finance Ltd. (SELFINA) - Oct 25, 2008)

Cecilia takes her clothing materials to seamstresses, who buy them and turn them into men’s and women’s clothes. Cecilia is also a member of a lending group called “Nyame Ye Kase Traders”, which consists of 14 borrowers in Cape Coast, Ghana.

Demand for her goods, such as beans and groundnut paste, has increased, but she does not have enough capital to enable her to increase sales. She is asking for $625 to increase her stock to meet the increase in demand for her goods.

loans.name: Hidawa's Group

texts.en: Hidawa H., Fatuma M., Sharifa Hamis make up the Jiendeleze group. For the past six years, Hidawa, the group leader, has run a stationery shop, in the Tabata area. loans.name: Mariamu

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 40-year-old Mariamu M.. She is single, and has one child, age 10. In 2003, Mariamu established her general store business. Mariamu requires a loan in order to purchase additional stock in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of leasing and leaseback microfinance, as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support, hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock for her general store in bulk.
